As Cyberdramon swung blindly around where Orionmon used to be Reddmon teleported behind him and landed a crushing blow at the back of his head. Cyberdramon regained his stance and shook the remnants of the fire from himself.

He glanced around him and locked on to Growlmon then advanced towards him. Reddmon Teleported between them about halfway and Cyberdramon barely broke step. He just refocused on Reddmon and raised his claw, which began to glow slightly. He looked like he was about to take a swing when Orionmon appeared from a hole and attempted to impale him with one of his arm mounted spikes, which was extended to about a metre long. Displaying blinding speed Cyberdramon dodged out of the way and grabbed the spike in one movement. He then slammed Orionmon to the ground and tossed him out of the way

Kyubimon saw another opening as Cyberdramon watched Orionmon hit the ground. She used her Fox Tail Inferno attack again, aiming it squarely at his back. A moment before it hit him He crouched and dodged it easily. He jumped backwards, avoiding the flurry of lasers that Gargomon was firing at him.

Gargomon kept up the fire, following Cyberdramon as he ran across the clearing straight towards Reddmon. He was forced to stop as Orionmon yelled "Fire Pike!" again and slammed into the ground in front of them. He stood up and glared at Cyberdramon in font of him. He turned his head slightly and whispered something to Reddmon who nodded and teleported away. A moment later he appeared next to her and whispered "C'mon, he's faster than we thought. We have to leave, you take Rika and Takato. I'll help Henry. Go, now!" He motioned for her to leave and then waved to the other digimon who nodded and backed into the forest, then teleported somewhere else, presumably to get Henry. Kyubimon knelt down to let Rika climb on her back then dashed into the forest and made her way round to where Takato was with Growlmon. "We must escape. Takato Climb on" said Kyubimon letting him get on too. With a nod from Growlmon they began running through the forest roughly the way they had come to get here.

Kyubimon turned as she heard Gargomon and Reddmon appear from the trees Reddmon carrying Henry on his back, jumping from tree to tree while Gargomon was running behind him. Knocking through any branches that got in his way. "Reddmon do you think Orionmon will be okay?" Asked Takato

A blood curdling roar came from behind them. "Yeah, he should be fine." Reddmon replied grimly. Suddenly Kyubimon noticed him glance behind him then yell "Every one down!" Kyubimon stopped and quickly pressed herself as close to the ground as she could. The other digimon did likewise, and for a second there was silence. Kyubimon was about to ask why they had stopped when a massive blade of energy cut the air and trees above them.

Every one was forced to dodge or destroy falling trees a second later as they all came toppling down around them. As the dust cleared a perfect path was revealed. The trees cut clean through almost two metres across. Reddmon readjusted Henry on his back and nodded. "As I said, he should be fine." And continued running. Everyone looked back to see that the swathe of cut trees led all the way back to the clearing and Cyberdramon could be seen fighting a digimon wielding a pair of large axes and clad in what looked like animal furs. "C'mon." called Reddmon. He was following the new path and was already far ahead, waiting for them. Kyubimon shook her head muttering "Unreal!" to herself and following Reddmon and the others.

After a while they reach the original clearing which was untouched by the fight they could still hear going on in the distance. Reddmon let Henry get down and looked back in the direction they had come. "I've got to go back now, everyone should wait here. Hopefully we'll be back soon." Reddmon sighed as he disappeared back into the forest.

Kyubimon de-digivolved into Renamon and looked from Rika to the place where Reddmon left. As she looked back at Rika she nods and Renamon runs into the forest following, Reddmon.
11111111122211121121211111211.title: Everyone hides and waits. (Renamon's POV)

choices: We need to get some information from Cyberdramon."
I think I know how this happened."
111111111222111211212111112111.content:
As Reddmon approached the clearing he began slowing down and paying more attention to being as silent as possible. If either Cyberdramon or Savagemon sensed him they were likely to attack. The sounds of combat had died down as Reddmon arrived. He pushed a branch to reveal the clearing, it was almost completely unrecognizable. Massive gouges had been taken from the ground and surrounding trees and scorch marks covered everything. in the middle, standing off was the two digimon both panting and covered in cuts and gashes.

Savagemon roared in anger and threw his axes at Cyberdramon, who managed to dodge one completely. The other hit his shoulder making him grunt in pain and stumble. As he landed Savagemon slammed both fists into the ground, causing a explosion to rip through the ground towards Cyberdramon. Cyberdramon was unable to dodge it, still recovering from the axe blow and was hit with its full force. Cyberdramon was knocked backwards slamming into a tree with enough force to shatter it in half, and slumped to the ground.

Savagemon stood there for a moment, panting heavily, then was obscured by a flare of fire that surrounded him. The fire quickly dissipated to reveal Orionmon who fell to his knees. Reddmon quickly teleported next to him. leaning him over his shoulder. Orionmon glanced at him "Thanks. This must ridiculous though, I'm nearly twice your size." He mumbled tiredly. Reddmon chuckled. "Yeah, and it feels like you way a ton." Reddmon looked up as Renamon emerged from the forest. "So, did you do it?" Reddmon nodded "He's over there." He said pointing to the prone form of Cyberdramon. "Reddmon could you lay me against a tree then take Cyberdramon back to the camp. We can't leave him alone, in case he wakes up and runs off." Reddmon nodded and helped him limp over to a tree and lowered him down. "I'll needs Renamons help to get him there. Are you sure you'll be okay till we get back?" Orionmon nodded producing a spray bottle from behind him and squirting it over himself. "I just need a nap I should be able to get back myself. Now get going. Everyone will be anxious to find out what happened." With that Orionmon adjusted himself against the tree and closed his eyes. Reddmon stood up and looked at Renamon. Who shrugged and walked over to Cyberdramon and picking up one of his arm.Reddmon followed her lead and they both began jumping from tree to tree back towards the clearing.

They soon arrived at the clearing. As they left the forest everyone turned from what they were doing and Bombarded Reddmon and Renamon with questions "What did you bring him here for? Where's Orionmon? Is he okay? What happened." Renamon spoke up first. "Orionmon said to bring him here and that he'll be along shortly. Now someone help me find some rope." Reddmon helped her deposit Cyberdramon on the ground and then waited next to him. As Renamon and the others went searching for rope Guilmon and Takato came over to crouch down next to him "Why do you think he was trying to delete Virus digimon Reddmon?" Asked Takato. Reddmon shrugged "No idea. Hey anyway, about when we met earlier. Sorry if I was rude. Would you be up for a rematch sometime?" Guilmon slapped him on the shoulder. "Your on." He laughed. Reddmon smiled to himself. Seems like they were all warming to him.

Renamon walked up behind them carrying a large coil of steel rope. "Orionmon really does have some weird things in here." She commented as they started tying up the unconscious Cyberdramon. As they finished Orionmon appeared from now where and stumbled over and slid down the trunk of a tree. Henry and Terriermon rushed over to help him while everyone else double and triple checked Cyberdramon's bindings. Satisfied Reddmon stood up and began to walk over to check on Orionmon. "Takato and Guilmon, could you please stay and watch Cyberdramon." He didn't wait for their reply as he walked over to talk to Orionmon.

As he got closer Reddmon noticed that he seemed to be unconscious. "Is he alright?" He asked them, they just shrugged in reply. "We're not sure but we think he just needs to sleep a while. Reddmon nods looking around the camp. Everyone seems to be busy with one chore or another. Guilmon and Takato were watching over Cyberdramon. Henry and Terriermon were watching Orionmon and Rika had left with Renamon to get food from the fridge. Reddmon noticed that the wood was running low so he decided to go cut some more. "Going on a wood run." Said Reddmon and walked out of the clearing.

A few hours later Orionmon had come too, as had Cyberdramon. Although he was knocked back out again with the application of a handy rock.

Orionmon had tended to his wounds and done a quick check of Cyberdramon. Declaring him in no immediate danger of death.

As they sat around to dinner again this time prepared by Rika and Renamon. "This is excellent Rika, Renamon. But more importantly.
111111111222111211212111112111.title: Reddmon reaches the clearing (Reddmon's POV)

choices: She finds him in a park.
She finds him running out of a store.
1111111112221112112121111121111.content:
Renamon nodded grimly, he was right. If someone did send Cyberdramon after Reddmon and Guilmon they were likely to keep sending assassins till they where both dead. "Can you find out who sent Cyberdramon to delete Reddmon and Guilmon?" Orionmon shook his head sadly, glancing over at the prone form of their captive. "I don't posses that level of programming ability, but I may be able to pull in an old favor from a Datamon I know. He will defiantly be able to find that information, if it exists, as well as fixing any corruption that may have been caused to him. That may take some time, and could very well be fruitless so i'll do some investigating myself. But for now we should all get some rest. I'll return you all home in the morning." Everyone nodded then went about cleaning up after dinner. Again Renamon slept between Reddmon and Rika, as she drifted off to sleep her mind wandered through everything that had happened in the past week.

Renamon woke to the sound of someone calling her name. It was Reddmon, he was crouching next to her gently shaking her shoulder. The digital vixen sat up rubbing her eyes blearily. "What's up." She mumbled to Reddmon who smiled in response, "You, finally. C'mon everyones ready to go." Renamon looked around, he was right, everyone had their back packs on and where watching the two of them. Renamon blushed as she scrambled to her feet and rolled up her sleeping bag. "Why did you let me sleep in?" She hissed to him angrily. "You looked too cute to wake up." Renamon threw a soft punch at his shoulder. "Jerk!" She laughed, tossing the Rolled up mattress at him. He easily caught it and teleported over to the tree it was taken from. As he reappeared next to her he called out to Orionmon "Ready." The warrior digimon made an opening gesture and a large hole appeared next to him big enough for any of them to walk through.

Renamon and Reddmon watched as everyone took turns leaping into it. Finally Orionmon stood next to it waiting for the pair of them. They walked over and jumped in, quickly surrounded by total darkness. Then suddenly Renamon was blinded by a light and felt gravity change strangely. She prepared herself to land on her feet and a second later landed softly on a grassy mountain side. The other digidestened getting up from where they had been deposited, all of them having fallen in a heap. Apparently Renamon and Reddmon where the only one with the agility to land properly. Renamon exchanged a look with Reddmon then they both began helping everyone up.

Once everyone had gotten to their feet and brushed themselves off Orionmon appeared from nowhere, holding the still unconscious Cyberdramon on his shoulder and gave everyone a sheepish look. "Sorry for the rough landing everyone, I must still be a bit shaky from that fight." Renamon noticed a few irritable looks aimed at him. If he noticed them he must have shrugged them off. He reached behind himself and produced a bag, he tossed it to Takato, how caught it and looked inside he looked back at Orionmon. "So what are these things?" He asked taking out a small black device with a speaker and several buttons. "They are simple communicators, you can use them to contact me or each other. I need to take this guy to that Datamon now, and I've got a few ideas on where to start looking for info, so i'll use these," He held up a device identical to the one Takato held, "to contact you if anything important comes up." With that he waved good bye to everyone and disappeared into a hole that came into existence behind him.

As the hole closed up everyone turned to Takato and took out a phone each, on the back of which was a clip that would slip onto a belt or strap, which Orionmon had been farsighted enough to include in the bag. The digimon wore the belts around thier waist or shoulder while the digidestined simply clipped them on next to their digivices. Renamon looked round for the first time, noticing that they where on a hill right next to town. Takato and Henry waved good bye and left with their partners, leaving Reddmon, Renamon and Rika alone on the hillside. Reddmon was the first to speak up. "So ladies, I have one or two things that I need to do, would you be okay getting home yourselves?" Rika shrugged, "Sure, whatever." Renamon smiled, guessing what Reddmon needed to "do".

Reddmon disappeared teleporting off somewhere. after a moment, when she was sure Reddmon had left Rika Huffed to herself, "Well the least he could have done is seen us home." Renamon just smiled and started walking toward home, Rika jogging to quickly catch up. "I'm sure we'll seem him later." Renamon chuckled. Her partner gave her a knowing look and laughed as well. "So when are you going on a date?" Renamon gave her a sideways glance. Rika was grinning widely at her, at least she seemed to accept it, but might as well be sure. "I'm guessing that's what he's arranging now. But anyway, Rika, how do you feel about him?" Rika barely missed a step. "That doesn't really matter, you like him so that's good enough for me." Renamon felt a rush of affection towards Rika, she really had matured emotionally since they'd first met.

As they neared home Renamon began thinking about what exactly Reddmon would be doing, hopefully he wouldn't steal or destroy anything. Although it was almost certain he would do one or the other. When Rika unlocked the door and opened it Renamon decided she really should check up on him. "Hey Rika I get the feeling Reddmon might end up causing trouble, whether he means to or not, mind if I go check on him?" Rika gave her a crooked grin. "Sure, if thats your only reason." Renamon felt hersefl blush and quickly teleported away. She went from area to area looking around for any sign of Reddmon
1111111112221112112121111121111.title: We need to get some information from Cyberdramo...

11111111122211121121211111211111.content:
Reddmon walked around the park, trying to gather a nice bunch of flowers for Renamon. So far he'd gotten several yellow and white ones and tied them together with a red ribbon, it certainly wasn't a professional job but it still looked quite pretty. Not to mention the colours would allow Renamon to find all sorts of hidden messages. Reddmon gave it one more look over and dematerialised it, storing it for later when he came to the perfect moment. Reddmon pulled a list from it's ethereal state, he had made it almost as soon as he'd left Renamon and Rika. It had taken him quite a while to write it up, he just couldn’t think what he needed, it read.

1.Get food.
2.Get flowers
3.Decide on location.

Materializing a pen he crossed out get flowers. Leaving only number three left, but that was probably the most difficult one. A picnic was the obvious thing to do, but the only place that was secluded enough was the nearby forest, and he didn't know any nice places up there.

Just then he sensed someone watching him, he sniffed the air and smiled as he caught Renamon's scent. "What’s up Renamon?" He called out, discreetly putting the list behind his back and dematerialising it. Renamon teleported right in front of him, looking out of breath and a bit annoyed. "Where in the world have you been? I've been looking everywhere for you!" Reddmon shrugged and held up the phone Orionmon gave them. "Why didn't you just call me on this thing?" Renamon glanced from him to the one attached to her waist and slapped her paw against her forehead. "Damn, I forgot about that thing." She signed. Reddmon replaced his phone and chuckled. "Hey, Renamon you up for that date now?" He asked holding out his paw. Renamon looked at the extended paw then back to him. “You really do have no sense of timing with these things do you?“ Reddmon pulled his arm back slightly, was that a no? Renamon reached forward and took hold of his paw, giving it a reassuring squeeze. “I’m sure I could help with that.” He sighed mentally and led her towards the forest, hoping that he would stumble across a look out or something with a nice view.

-------------------------------

"So Reddmon do you have any idea where you are going?" Asked Renamon. She had let him lead her around for at least three hours. They where only half a kilometre from a rarely used road, but Renamon was pretty sure Reddmon didn't know anything about the area so she just let him keep wandering around. Eventually Reddmon hung his head and sighed. "Okay, it's official, we’re lost.” No, he was lost, she knew the whole area perfectly. Renamon laughed lightly, “C’mon, I know a nice place nearby.” She took his arm and led him through the undergrowth.

A humorously short walk later the trees suddenly thinned and the ground beneath them was replaced by a stunningly complex, yet some how subdued mosaic pattern. In front of them stood an ancient shrine, small well carved statues stood at regular intervals beside the mosaic path, all of which was shaded by over hanging trees. The setting sun shining through to create a shimmering effect as the trees swayed. “Wow.” Breathed Reddmon, Renamon walked over to a statue and sat against it. This one was in the shape of a robed monk kneeling in prayer. “I know, pretty isn‘t it. This is where I come to think or be alone. Not even Rika knows about it.” She smiled to herself as Reddmon walked over to the shrine and inspected it, she wasn’t completely sure to who or what it was dedicated to, but she was pretty sure it had something to do with Taoism.

Reddmon walked over and sat against the statue opposite her. “So, you hungry Renamon?” Renamon nodded, she hadn’t eaten anything since this morning in Orionmon’s place, but why was he asking? Did he want to go home already? Out of nowhere Reddmon reached behind the statue he was sitting against and pulled out a picnic basket. “Reddmon, what the hell?” He better not have stolen that, for that matter where did it just come from? Reddmon removed a wrapped sandwich from the basket and handed it to her, she accepted it warily and began eating. Reddmon must have noticed her hesitance because he laughed, “I know what your thinking, I helped someone at a sandwich store for an hour and he made me the sandwiches, and lent me the basket.”

Renamon frowned to herself, that answers one question but how did he get it here without her noticing? Then she remembered Orionmon, he was always pulling things from thin air. “So. did you learn that trick from Orionmon?” She asked casually. Reddmon almost choked on the mouthful of sandwich he was chewing. “Ha! Other way round, after we fought for the first time Orionmon somehow changed his coding to allow him to create those hole things of his, it lets him compensate for his lack of agility. Surprised the hell out of me the first time he did it. An energy ball I had just thrown hit me square in the face.” Reddmon chuckled, running the side of his muzzle. Renamon glanced at the basket again, taking another bite of her sandwich. “So how does it work?” Reddmon raised his paw and an apple appeared and dropped, landing in his waiting palm. “Well, I store stuff by putting it in an ethereal state, where it kind of doesn’t exist, whereas Orionmon just creates portals, either to another place where he has lots of things he thinks he might need or to a location he wants to go.” Renamon thought about that for a moment, what sort of bizarre objects did he have hidden away in there.

Her thoughts were interrupted by a loud beeping from her hip. She quickly took off her communicator and Reddmon moved a bit closer as she pressed the receive button.
11111111122211121121211111211111.title: She finds him in a park.

choices: He changes into Redd and runs off to school.
Mabye not. He still needed to do other stuff around town.
111111111222111211212111112111111.content:
"Renamon, do you hear me?" Asked Orionmon, his voice slightly distorted by static. "Yes, relativity clearly. Whats wrong?" Replied Renamon, curious as to what Orionmon wanted so soon. "Is Reddmon with you? I called Rika and she told me you went out looking for him?" Reddmon leaned closer and called out, "Yeah I'm here, what do you want? You can’t have found out anything already, you only dropped us off this morning." A note of irritation in his voice, Orionmon went on, either not noticing or not caring about Reddmon's tone. "Well, I got lucky and found someone who has information about the Cyberdamon attack, but as I thought he wants something from me, well you and me."

"Who is he and what does he want? Nothing ridiculous I hope." Asked Renamon. "He's an Etemon who is known for dealing in information, he told me a little, just enough to prove he does have the information we need, but he'll only tell us the rest if Reddmon and myself take part in a tournament he's running soon. He also gave invitations to the digidestined, everyone except you and Rika have accepted already. Rika said it was your decision, since you are the one who will be fighting after all." Renamon glanced at Reddmon who had lent back against the statue and was looking upwards at the newly risen moon, his finger under his mouth. Probably thinking about facing off against Guilmon or Orionmon. She had to at least watch over him, anyway it would probably be fun.

"Sure, I’ll go as well. What's the prize for first place?" Renamon heard paper being rustled on the other end of the line. "First prize is one million digidollars. Although, that’s pretty much useless to you in the real world. But I might have something more useful to trade that for. Anyway, its champion level or lower and it will be starting in five days. I’ll meet you all the day it starts, beside that good luck. Oh, and, sorry if I interrupted anything. Just thought you should be told immediately." Renamon and Reddmon said goodbye and hung up. Almost intermediately Reddmon got up and stretched his back, he looked at her for a moment then put his paw behind his head and scratched his ear. "Renamon, if we face off in this tournament, do you want, me to uh, you know, throw in the towel?" He asked with a lot of blushing and looking at the back of his other paw. Renamon laughed, he must be joking, he's gone from picking fights with me to being willing to take a fall within a few days. Reddmon looked at her indignantly, "What? What's so funny?" This just made Renamon laugh all the harder. "I was going to ask you if you wanted to train with me that’s all." She said wiping a tear from her eye. "C’mon we might as well head home, it's getting dark anyway.” Reddmon nodded “Yeah, you think you can find your way through the forest at night.?” Renamon got up and brushed a few crumbs out of her fur, “Huh, of course I can. C’mon let‘s go”

--------------------------------------

Half an hour later they had reached Rika’s and Renamon’s house Reddmon landed lightly in front of the back door then turned and watched Renamon land beside him. Reddmon had been planning exactly what he was going to say the whole way. “So Renamon, thanks for showing me that place tonight, it was beautiful,” He leaned close and kissed her softly, materializing the bunch of flowers behind his back, then broke of the kiss. “But not nearly as beautiful as you.” He revealed the flowers and handed them to her. She took them and blushed deeply. ”Reddmon, Rika has got to go to school to catch up on stuff she missed recently, and I’d promised I’d watch her.” Reddmon nodded, wondering where this was leading. “So I need you to promise me, you won’t cause any mischief or havoc okay, and you won’t come to school either. No one knows about me and we need to keep it that way.” That gave Reddmon an idea actually but he kept a straight face and put his paw over his heart. “I promise that I, Reddmon will not appear at you school tomorrow.” He said in as a sincere voice as he could manage. Judging by the look she gave him she probably didn’t believe him so he bowed formally and teleported himself out of there. He watched from the branch of a tree as she looked at the flowers he had given her glanced at the surrounding trees and rooftops, not taking any notice particular of his position. Then she shook her head and mumbled, “I know I’m going to regret this tomorrow.” as she turned around and opened the door. Reddmon was sure he caught a smile on her face as she walked inside.

Reddmon quickly returned to the abandoned house he had claimed for his own and settled himself down on the dusty couch. He looked around for moment, noticing the thick fog of particles that floated in the still air. He really would have to clean up tomorrow morning. Next time Renamon came round she would probably be in a state to notice the mess. As Reddmon let himself slip into the embrace of sleep he wondered, what had caused Cyberdramon to attack him?. Did he have enemies? Probably.

---------------------------------

The next morning he rummaged through the closets in the house and found a broom, a feather duster and a bunch of other cleaning equipment. Within the hour he gathered most of the dust within the house to a pile in what he had started calling the living room. He stared at this massive pile of dirt, soot and rubbish and tried to figure out what the hell he was going to do with it. Shrugging he just dematerialized it, he could just dump it somewhere else later.

He looked round at his house, it was a lot better than when he had first arrived, not clean but much better. He glanced at the clock he had found in a closet, it had been out of batteries, which he had found in a cupboard in the kitchen, and he’d had to re-time it against the town clock, but it was working fine now and showed that it was about twenty minutes to 9. Grinning Reddmon thought about going to Rika’s school as Redd, seeing if she and the others would catch on. Renamon would probably kill him later, but it would be worth it.

Decisions, decisions.
111111111222111211212111112111111.title: The tournament.

1111111112221112112121111121111111.content:
Reddmon walked out of his home, teleporting to the top of a nearby apartment block and looked around, spotting the roof of the school. He began jumping from building to building, figuring that he needed 3 minutes to get there and about 10 minutes to infiltrate the building and create all the documents that said Redd was attending the school as of this morning.

He soon reached the block the school was on and laid himself flat against a roof, materializing his binoculars as he did. He looked from window to window until he found both the principal's office, an empty toilet attached to the same hallway and the principal's parking space in the parking lot. Which was empty, meaning this was his best shot to do what he needed.

He pushed himself to his feet and teleported inside the vacant toilet, quickly changing into Redd. He walked over to the toilet door and opened it. As he made his way towards the principals office a thin lady with glasses and white hair come out of a doorway marked teachers lounge. She began walking along the hall towards him, mumbling something to herself when she noticed him just as he reached level with her. “Hello young man. I don’t remember seeing you before? Are you new?” Redd noticed a badge on her chest declaring her the head librarian and under that in thin elegant hand writing, Mrs Tang. Redd nodded and smiled politely, wanting to get on with it before the principal arrived “Yes, I start today, but I need to see the principal first, so if you’ll excuse me.” She shook her head. “Sorry Mr Kakashi hasn’t arrived yet, but you should be able to wait in his office until he does.” Redd nodded “Thank you Mrs Tang.” He said and continued towards Mr Kakashi’s office.

When he reached it he turned the handle, looking both ways as he did, hoping no one else would enter the hall. Luckily the door was unlocked and the hallway clear so he slipped inside and quietly closed the door after himself. The Principals office was pretty plush, lots of leather chairs and a large desk with a good quality computer on it. Redd walked over to the computer and began looking around. It was on already and didn’t seem to have a password set up so Redd was able to access the files he needed immediately. He modified the database to say that a new student from Kyoto was starting today by the name of Holt Kenari. After all the others might see through a kid known only Redd, he put himself in the same year and class as Rika, Henry and Takato and saved all the changes he made. Then he got up and put everything as he had found it. He looked at the time in the bottom of the computer, he still had ten minutes till school started so he slipped back out of the Principals office and began walking around the halls, taking random turns here and there.That was almost to easy he thought to himself, he had done it in less than half the time he expected.

Just as he was about to turn another corner he heard the familiar voices of Henry and Takato very close by, talking about being late, Redd smiled to himself and walked around the corner. Henry and Takato barreled into him, barely able to slow themselves down. Redd let himself fall down hard and bang his head against the lockers behind him. Rubbing his head Redd looked up. “Hey you're Takato and Henry right.” Henry gave him a wary look as he reached down and helped him up. “Yeah, How do you know that, and why haven't we seen you before?” Redd smiled and turned the helping hand into a handshake. “I just started today my names Holt Kenari. The principal told me I would be in your class and that you would be able to help me round for the day, “ He said shaking Takato's hand as well. Takato smiled widely, the kind of person who makes friend quickly I suppose, thought Redd. “Sorry about knocking you over Holt, our teacher gets furious if we’re even a minute late. Which reminds me, we gotta hurry. C’mon” He said motioning for him and Henry to follow. Redd chuckled to himself and ran after them, this was going to be an interesting day.

They reached the class room just as the teacher, a stern looking man with a thick mustache, was guiding everyone inside. He gave them all a withering stare as they fell into line with everyone else, in particular Redd. “Who are you boy?” He practically bellowed, “A new student sir, Holt Kenari, I transferred this week.“ He was tempted to salute as well, but thought better of it. The teacher nodded and grumbled, “No one tells me anything around here.“ and let him inside. As he entered the room Takato waved and pointed to a seat between him and Henry, with Rika sitting behind him. Redd sat down behind the small desk and turned in his seat, “Hi, you’re Rika, Right?” Rika gave him a suspicious look then nodded. “Yeah, but how do you…” Takato cut her off. “Kakashi told him to hang around with us till he gets settled.” Rika nodded, most of the suspicion disappeared. “So what are we learning today?” Asked Redd. Henry was the first to answer. ”Trigonometry, Great fun huh.” He said rolling his eyes. Reddmon nodded in agreement and opened the lid to his desk, getting pencils and paper out. This part might not be so interesting, thought Redd tiredly.

The teacher walked over to the chalkboard and tapped his chalk against it, causing the class to quite down. “Class we have a new student today, “ He said pointing to Redd, his voice still raised higher than necessary. “So I’ll reintroduce myself for him as well as go over my rules. My name is Oba Hidori, When I talk, you listen. I Won’t tolerate any misbehaving. And anyone who breaks either of these rules gets detention. This is your only warning! Got it?” He said, writing everything on the board. The class replied “Yes Sir.” in unison. Satisfied Mr Hidori used a duster to whip what he had written from the board. Then he began drawing various algorithms and rules for math on the board and Redd settled in for the most boring three hours of his life.

Finally the Recess bell rang and everyone walk out of the room chattering excitedly about one thing or another. As they left Takato tapped him on the shoulder, “Do you want to have lunch with us Holt?” Redd shook his head, “Nah, I was going to have a walk around on my own, you know learn the playground.” Henry and Takato waved goodbye while Rika looked at Redd again, “I’ve got someone I need to talk to, I’ll see you all after lunch.” She said waving then running off. Probably going to see Renamon, thought Redd as he walked the opposite way. As soon as he turned the next corner in the hall he broke into a run, circling round the front of the school, figuring he might be able to sneak behind Rika and see Renamon. He wouldn’t reveal himself of course, he just wanted to see where she was hiding Renamon.
1111111112221112112121111121111111.title: Hanging around at achool.

choices: A silent empty house greeted him.
11111111122211121121211111211111111.content:
As he rounded the building and came into the playground area Redd noticed a crowd of people gathering around something, making lots of ooh and ahh noises. Redd jogged over and stood on his toes, wondering what had everyone so excited about. The group of kids had formed a circle, inside of which stood a teenager, massive both in height and in girth. He had short black hair and a nose that had been obviously been broken dozens of times. Also in the circle was none other than Rika, she was on the ground rubbing the side of her face, which was an angry red and already beginning to swell. The bully crossed his arms in front of his chest and laughed. “Get it through you thick skull Rika, I own this playground and you can’t keep walking round as you please, you pay the fee and you're free to go.” Rika spat out some blood and gave him a cold look. “No?” he asked mockingly. “Well fine then, have it your way.” He said advancing on her and cracking his knuckles together. Redd began pushing into the crowd, Trying to get to her. Renamon must be killing herself, she can’t do anything but watch. Redd forced his way inside the circle, several people giving cries of annoyance.

As he entered the bully looked up, his fist cocked, ready to strike Rika. “So your that new kid huh. What do you want?” Redd looked him up and down, he must be at least two years older than Rika and over twice her weight. “Put her down and back off.” He said, not trying to sound particularly aggressive. The bully just laughed letting go of Rika and turning towards him. “Your asking for it wimp, but I’ll let you go if you pay her fee and your own. That comes to thirty bucks. For today.” Redd took a step towards him, mindful of everyone watching them. Seeing that he wasn’t going to back down the bully raised his left fist and stepped towards Redd, taking a huge swing at him. Redd dodged under the blow and slammed his fist into the guys chest. He doubled over in pain as the crowd gasped. Seems like no one stands up to this guy, thought Redd as he raised both his fists in the boxers stance and backed away from the bully a bit. Someone in the crowd began chanting fight, which was quickly taken up by the rest. This was so much like the tournaments he’d been to, thought Redd, dodging a lunge the bully made and punched him in the lower back causing him to fall to the ground and cry out in pain. He quickly recovered though and picked himself up, murder in his eyes. He took another clumsy swing at Redd which he dodged easily and then another. Redd stepped back, away from the blow then moved inward, giving him an uppercut to the chin then stepping round and smashing the other fist into the side of his head. The bully gave a moan then crumpled to the ground, out cold for at least half an hour. Finished with him Redd turned to Rika who was still kneeling on the ground, rubbing the side of her face again, staring at him with a slightly dazed look on her face. Redd walked over to her and offered her his hand. She smiled, or winched in pain, it was kind of hard to tell and took the hand, letting him pull her to her feet. “Thanks.” She mumbled waving and turning, breaking into a run.

The crowd had broken up by now, the show having finished and all, so Rika was able to run clearly towards the forest that marked the edge of the school yard. Renamon was probably hiding within there somewhere. Redd was about to follow her in when a hand clamped on his shoulder. In the split second before he turned three things went through his mind, it was either a teacher come to chew him out, the bully himself, ready to knock him out, or one of the bully’s friends, ready to take revenge.

He was surprised then to see Henry, with Takato running up behind him, panting heavily. “What’s up?” asked Redd. Henry gulped down a few breaths of air before answering. “Holt, we heard that Rika got in a fight. What happened?” Redd jerked his thumb over at the small group of people crouching around the bully. “That guy had set up some kind of toll fare scam, he had hit Rika and when I got here I broke it up and knocked him down.” Takato stared at him with a look of disbelief. “Tollfare? Do you mean you beat up Headkicker Chuck.” Redd shrugged “I guess so, anyway, Rika went into the forest, I was about to go in after her to make sure she was fine.” Henry and Takato exchanged a quick glance then patted him on the shoulder, leading him towards the cafeteria. “Don’t worry, she has a er, a hangout in there, she’ll be fine. C’mon we’ll buy you lunch.” Said Takato. Obviously trying to get him to not to follow her, Probably to keep him from discovering Renamon. He shrugged, at least that confirms where the yellow fox was hiding, “Sure, do they have any good food?” He had Forgotten breakfast amidst all the cleaning so he was actually pretty hungry.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

After lunch they went back into class and Redd noted that Rika was absent. A few hours later the final bell rang and everyone filed out of the class room again. Reddmon was about to bolt home when he heard Takato call out his name, well his fake name anyway. “Hey Holt, wait up a minute.” Takato ran up next to him, “Do you want to come over to my house? My parents own a bakery and we always have fresh bread.” Redd shook his head, he had to get home as quickly as possible, if Renamon or one of the other digimon bumped into him he might be in trouble. “Sorry, I’m late as it is, and I think I might not be able to come to school tomorrow.” Takato looked slightly downcast as Redd turned and waved then bolted as fast as he could to his block.

He ducked into an alley and quickly changed back into Reddmon, stretching his tails happily. After he felt limber enough he hopped to the top of he roof and took a round about path to his house. He teleported in front of the door and slipped inside.
11111111122211121121211111211111111.title: Redd to the rescue.

choices: They go training in the forest.
111111111222111211212111112111111111.content:
As he quietly closed the door behind him he heard someone inside sniffle softly. Reddmon stiffened slightly, had someone stumbled into his house? Reddmon silently edged closer to the wall, it sounded like it had come from the living room. Maybe he should change into Redd again, in case it was some random kid. After all he wanted to stay low key, the cops probably wanted to have a little talk to him after his, let's say, flamboyant entrance (not to mention the missing officer). But on the other hand if it was one of the digimon or the digidestined they would both find out about his human form and Renamon would be really angry at him for doing what she specifically asked him not to do, even if he did help Rika out. Reddmon moved a little further inside trying desperately to identify who was inside.

"Rika, calm down, you're okay, that Holt kid sorted out chuck didn't he?" Reddmon breathed a sigh of relief it was Rika and Renamon. He stepped into the living room and both Renamon and Rika turned round suddenly, Rika's face had gone from an angry red to a rich purple, although a little of the swelling had died down already, and judging by the puffy redness around her eyes she had been crying a lot recently. Guessing by the arm she had wrapped around her partner Renamon was trying her best to console Rika.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Rika heard a noise in the living room and spun round to see who it was, ready to jump up and run if necessary.But it was only Reddmon, Rika felt Renamon relax a bit, her grip having tightened slightly. This was the last thing she wanted though, they had only come here to hide instead of letting her mother see the bruise, she would have a complete fit over it anyway, but now that Reddmon had arrived she was regretting that decision. Any moment he would start poking fun at her, probably calling her week for losing a fight.

Instead he frowned and turned on his heel, rushing out of the room. Rika looked questioningly to Renamon who shrugged as they heard doors being opened and closed in another room. As quickly as he went Reddmon returned, holding a bunched up cloth. He sat down next to them and held it out to Rika, "Here, put this against your cheek. What happened?" Rika hesitantly took the bundle and found that it was cold, he had gotten some ice from somewhere and put it inside the cloth. Rika put it against the bruise and sighed as she felt it alleviate the dull throbbing that had been bothering her since Chuck had punched her. "Thanks Reddmon, that's much better. Some jerk at school has been taking kids money, claiming it as a toll fare. I wouldn't give him my "toll" so he hit me." To her surprise, and she was already surprised after the makeshift icepack, Reddmon's frown deepened and a sphere of dark energy formed in his hand. "You want me to go round his place and deal with him?" Rika laughed and shook her head, "Thanks, but someone else beat you to it. The jerk was about to hit me again when a new kid stepped in and took him down."

Renamon stood up and walked over to the window, peeking out threw the blinds. Rika smiled to herself, Renamon was still protective towards her and it bothered her to see me hurt. "Renamon, stop beating yourself up, you couldn't have helped without scaring the living daylights out of everyone. We still need to keep you hidden unless it's absolutely necessary. And besides, the police wouldn't put up with you beating up a kid, especially after all the trouble Reddmon made recently." Renamon sighed and turned around, leaning against the wall. "I know, your right, but still. Hold it, Reddmon, where were you today? We came here about lunch time and you were nowhere to be seen." Reddmon sat up straighter, smiling sheepishly, "Believe it or not I was here cleaning this morning, and I went out later to train in the forest." Seemed reasonable enough to her, thought Rika, the house was relativity clean, considering it had been abandoned for years. But Renamon didn't seem to be buying it. "Then why can I smell Rika's school on you?" Reddmon shrugged, "I went round there on my way back from training, thought I could see you home or something."

Renamon still seemed slightly suspicious but let the matter drop, then Reddmon stood up, "So will you two being staying for dinner? Or going to school tomorrow for that matter?" Rika exchanged a glance with Renamon. "If you would let us stay that would be great, and I don't think so, I was hoping that this bruise would heal in a day or two. The ice should help." Reddmon clapped his paws together. "Great, does anyone know of any good restaurants nearby?"

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Half an hour later they began eating a variety of Asian dishes, everything from Chow mien to Tom Yum soup, the table between them practically covered in takeaway containers. Reddmon had asked Rika to call in the order and answer the door when it was delivered, giving her money he had found stashed away when he was cleaning. The delivery man had asked about Rika's bruise but left without any further trouble. She had told him about a fight at school and he had nodded, mumbling something about the collapse of society.

Reddmon was feeling great, he had gotten away with going to school with them and they where spending the night at his place. Once they were done eating Rika went down the street to a phone booth to tell her mother and grandmother she would be staying at a friends for the evening, which was true enough. When she got back they sat around in the living room and talked for a while. Nothing in particular just this and that, plans and ideas. Eventually it got late enough for Rika to start yawning and he showed them to the room Renamon had stayed in, if somewhat reluctantly, the last she was here. He was pretty sure he didn't have stand guard this time so he went back down to the living and gathered up the remains of dinner, putting the containers with food left in the fridge and then dropping himself on the couch. He sat there for a while, smelling the intense aromas of the dinner they had eaten.

Reddmon was quickly asleep, actually looking forward to what tomorrow would bring.
111111111222111211212111112111111111.title: Reddmon has visitors.

choices: They head out into the forest.
They run into an old friend.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112.content:
Renamon awoke to the sound of Rika rolling over in her sleep, having thrown her sheets off during the night. Renamon pushed herself out of the large comfy chair she had been sleeping in and went over to their room's window, it was still dark outside but she could see the sun cresting the mountains. Renamon thought about sitting and watching the sun rise, but then again, Reddmon could be awake, it was worth checking at least.

Renamon snuck out of the room and walked down the hall, pausing to stare at a really weird hole in the wall, it looked vaguely head shaped, possibly Reddmon's. As Renamon padded down the stairs Reddmon came into view, laying sprawled out on the couch, his eyes closed. Even from here she could see his eyelids moving constantly, probably having a dream thought Renamon. She walked over to the chair opposite him and sat down, watching him for a bit. After a while her eyes began to wander around the room and Renamon noticed that Reddmon had a working clock, and if it was right the time was 6 o'clock. The shops wouldn't be open yet so Renamon decided to fetch some food for breakfast, she really didn't feel like leftovers anyway. Renamon picked up the change that Reddmon had left on the table and left his house, figuring that Rika would be safe with him.

She quickly made her way to the nearest general store, which still had a large hole in it's wall from the red fox's recent visit, but that had been boarded up so Renamon just teleported herself inside. She picked up a package of bacon, a carton of eggs and a carton of juice, as well as a container of butter. She put the proper amount of money on the counter and left as she had arrived. Renamon was hopping from building to building when she passed Takato's place. She paused for a moment, glancing at the armful of food she was carrying. Fresh bread would go nicely with this, she thought leaping onto Takato's house and placing the stuff she had gotten in a corner.

Renamon jumped down the side of the house, grabbing the rain gutter with one paw and swinging to a halt in front of Takato's bedroom window. Inside Takato and Guilmon were sitting at his desk, with what was probably his homework spread out in front of them. Renamon tapped a claw softly against the glass until they looked up, glancing around for the source of the noise. Guilmon was the first to spot her and he said something to Takato and they both rushed over and slid the window up. "Renamon, what are you doing here?" Asked Guilmon, who looked up to see what she was hanging from. "I was hoping I could have some bread. I have some money if you want it." Takato shook his head. "Don't worry about it. I'll get some now." Guilmon turned to him, "Takato, could you get me some as well?" Takato nodded and ran out of the room, closing the door behind him.

Guilmon sniffed the air, then gave Renamon a crooked grin "So where's Reddmon, huh?" Renaom felt herself blush slightly, why did he think they would always be nearby each other? "He's at his house with Rika, when I left they were both asleep." Guilmon cocked his head, and with not a trace of guile on his face he asked. "Did you all sleep together?" Renamon nearly lost her grip on the gutter after that question. "No Guilmon, we did not sleep together. Me and Rika slept in an upstairs bedroom while Reddmon was in the living room." Guilmon was about to ask another probably embarrassing question when Takato came in holding two loaves of bread. One wrapped in brown paper the other unwrapped. He tossed the unwrapped one to Guilmon who laughed happily and immediately began eating it. Then he handed the other to Renamon who took it with her free hand. As Takato handed her the bread he asked, "So how's Rika?" Renamon took the bread and answered. "She's alright, as far as I know, she's still asleep at Reddmon's house. We stayed there last night." Takato blinked, "What, he has a house? How did he get that?" Renamon laughed, it was a bit strange actually. "It's the old place on Omori St, so there aren't any owners. Hey, maybe you could come around after school? I'll call you later." With that she pulled herself up and got the other food, stacking it all haphazardly in her arms.

-------------------------------------------------------------

Renamon arrived at Reddmon's place without much else happening and when she stepped inside everything was as she had left it, although Reddmon had rolled off the couch and was now sleeping on the floor. Smiling to herself Renamon walked into the kitchen and put the food on the table. She looked around in the cupboards, taking out a large frying pan, three plates and cups. She turned the the stove top on and drew a claw across the plastic wrapping of the bacon. As she put several pieces of bacon on the hot pan Reddmon wandered in, rubbing his eyes blearily. "Morning." He mumbled, absently picking up one of the glasses and getting a drink of water from the kitchen sink's tap. Renamon cracked the eggs open over the pan and got out a spatula from a drawer, turning over the bacon.

Reddmon yawned loudly and got out some forks and knives as well as finding a toaster. He plugged it in and began slicing the bread with a knife he drew from thin air, putting pairs inside the appliance. Rika walked in, her hair messed up and her cheek still a deep purple, she sat down at the table and poured herself a glass of orange juice. Renamon smiled to herself and turned her attention back to the stove. As she kept the eggs and bacon from burning she realized something, she had been smiling and laughing a lot since Reddmon had appeared in their lives, maybe that was what everyone was picking up on?

Pretty soon everything was ready and put onto plates, everyone digging in. "So," Said Rika, pushing her empty plate forward, "do you have any plans today Reddmon?" Reddmon shook his head and swallowed the mouthful he was chewing. "No, I'm open to ideas. Anything you were thinking of specifically?" Rika shrugged, "How about a training session in the woods?" Reddmon nodded, taking another bite of toast. Renamon remembered her short stop earlier. "Oh, and I saw Guilmon and Takato, they might be up for that after school as well." Reddmon smiled, "Yeah sounds good, but isn't it Saturday tomorrow anyway?" Rika nodded, "Although, you would want to be as prepared as possible wouldn't you?" Reddmon leaned back in his chair. "Not really, I just go for the sheer fun of fighting. And to have a chance to beat up Orionmon in front of a crowd." Or get beaten up, thought Renamon.

"Well should we head off then?" Asked Renamon taking everyones plates and rinsing them off in the sink. Everyone else cleaned up everything else and they where soon ready to leave.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112.title: Renamon fixes breakfast.

choices: It was a trap. Reddmon gets nailed.
He manages to get her into the open.
11111111122211121121211111211111111121.content:
With breakfast over and done with Renamon teleported to the roof while Reddmon stayed inside with Rika. He figured that while Renamon could move unseen he would be a lot more obvious, since they had decided that he would carry Rika until they got to the privacy of the forest, they needed Renamon to make sure the coast was clear before they exited the house. Reddmon knelt down, letting Rika climb on his back and wrap her arms around his neck. "Ready?" He asked her. "Just try not to go too fast okay? We'll be going over rooftops right?" Reddmon nodded, waiting for Renamon to give the signal.

Suddenly his phone crackled to life, Reddmon pressed a button on it and Renamons voice came through. "Go." She said simply. Reddmon pushed open the door and knocked it closed with his tail. He then jumped up onto the roof, something a bit more difficult with Rika hanging on to him. He landed next to Renamon who motioned for them to follow then began jumping from roof to roof, trying to avoid busy intersections. Reddmon followed and they soon reached the edge of the forest.

Reddmon let Rika down and stretched his back, "So, how should we do this? Find a clearing then beat the stuffing out of each other till we get tired?" Rika laughed "I know of a clearing that should do the trick. Follow me." She ran off through the trees and Reddmon dashed after her, tapping Renamon on the shoulder and whispering, "Tag, you're it." Then he jumped into the trees, leaping from trunk to trunk, following Rika's path roughly. He heard Renamon laugh and follow him, catching up quickly.As he sensed her getting close Reddmon teleported to the ground and ran for a bit, weaving through the trees. Suddenly Renamon dropped down in front of him, instead of changing course Reddmon materialized a smoke grenade and threw it at the ground between them. Renamon didn't have time to react as a cloud of smoke burst from the grenade and engulfed her. Reddmon jumped over the cloud and landed on a branch. He could hear Renamon stumbling about blindly, coughing. As he jumped forward to catch up with Rika he heard her yell, "Cheater!" after him. He smiled and moved as fast as he could.

------------------------------------------------------

He burst into the clearing to find Rika panting against a tree. She could run fast, he had to give her that. He landed near her and walked over, looking around, the clearing was a few metres wide and surrounded on all sides by tall trees. Judging by how fast they had moved it was probably pretty far from anyone as well. "Where's Renamon?" Asked Rika. Reddmon laughed, "We began playing tag, so she should be along soon." He was suddenly knocked to the ground by a heavy weight hitting him in the back. "You're it." Said Renamon getting off him and jumping a good distance away, smirking.

Reddmon pushed himself up, trying to get his breath back. He probably deserved that for the grenade stunt. "Hey Renamon, how about ranged combat practice? Rika you might want to move into the forest." Rika backed away while Renamon began walking backwards and sideways, keeping Rika well out of the line of fire as well as getting extra distance. Reddmon created a pair of energy spheres and waited for Renamon to make her move. Renamon slowly took a braced stance and began creating lots of those diamond shards of hers. Reddmon winced, remembering how much those things hurt.

Seems like she was waiting for him so decided to oblige and threw the first ball in a low arc that would follow the ground. Then without even watching it hit he teleported into the air above her and tossed it downwards. Only to find that she wasn't there and that the glittering projectiles had been flung in all directions. He couldn't dodge in time so he threw his arms up to cover his face. He felt several pin pricks sting his arms and let himself fall to the ground, figuring he should move immediately upon contact with the ground.

As soon as his paws touched the grass he rolled to the side, the ground was instantly embedded with twenty or so shards of diamond. Reddmon lept aside again as another flurry flew past him, he looked around, dodging as he did. Renamon was nowhere to be seen, so she must be in the forest. And the attacks where coming from completely different directions each time, his first choice would be to randomly toss attacks into the forest. But Rika was about so that was out of the question, so that left going in after her.
11111111122211121121211111211111111121.title: Training begins

choices: Some other way of settiling it?
111111111222111211212111112111111111211.content:
Reddmon chose a random direction and launched himself into the forest, landing deftly on a tree branch. He sniffed the air, smelling Rika's and Renamon's scent coming from nearby. He could hear Rika breathing on the other side of the clearing, but he couldn't hear anything from Renamon, neither footstep nor breath. Concentrating harder he picked up a light whistling sound and fell backwards just in time to avoid a bunch of crystalline needles, which struck the tree where his torso had been a moment earlier. He grabbed a branch as he fell and swung forward, jumping off the trunk of a tree and heading in the direction the attack came from.

He landed on another branch, running his paw over the rough surface, Renamon's scent was still strong and he could feel a slight warmness on the bark. Reddmon heard the singular whistling behind him and jumped forward to avoid it, only to have Renamon appear from nowhere, her feet ablaze, and kick him in the stomach then again on the underside of his muzzle. Reddmon gasped as the breath was driven from him again, he somersaulted mid air and landed on the ground, holding his stomach and rubbing his chin, she really was giving it her all. Reddmon looked up to see Renamon sitting on a branch, her legs swinging underneath her. "Ready to give up?" she asked, smiling at him.

Reddmon laughed, he was to used to crashing through obstacles, taking the most direct route, making one if he needed to. This was different, he needed to use finesse here. Well I don't have much experience in that department, but I guess that's why they call it training, he thought to himself. He teleported onto a branch opposite Renamon and crouched down. "Okay, round one to you. But how about close combat next?" Before Renamon could even answer Reddmon lept backwards into a leafy branch then teleported a fair distance away, teleporting again just to be sure. He lent against a tree and materialized an alarm clock he had. He quickly set the alarm for two minutes and placed it inside of a hole in the tree.

Reddmon dropped to the ground and picked up a few pebbles, then jumped over to another tree and concealed himself within a clump of foliage. He waited until he heard Renamon come along, counting off the seconds till his clock went off. With about thirty seconds till the alarm rang Renamon cautiously moved into view, obviously expecting some sort of ambush. Reddmon smiled and tossed a rock against a tree nearby, watching Renamon spin towards the noise and launch several diamonds in the same movement, as well as moving away from the sound. Reddmon threw another rock in the opposite direction, getting an identical result. He did it once more, which made her land right next to the tree he had planted the surprise.

Renamon looked slightly jumpy at the moment, completely unsure of what he was doing or even where he was. Reddmon smiled, counting down, five, four, three, two, one. The alarm rang out, shattering the silence. Renamon screamed and jumped about a metre in the air, Reddmon burst from his hiding place, punching Renamon in the stomach as she turned towards him and teleported behind her, sweeping her legs from under her. Reddmon quickly teleported to a higher branch and sat down as she fell heavily and nearly tumbled off the branch. He let his legs swing back and forth a bit as she groaned and picked herself up, glaring at him. She turned and took the clock out of the nook it was hidden in and tossed it at Reddmon's head. "What?" He laughed, moving his head to the side and letting the clock sail by, "I thought it was pretty sneaky." Renamon let out a laugh, "Yeah, but why the hell did you have a clock anyway?"

Reddmon looked behind him at the metallic wreckage on the ground. "Yes I guess past tense would be correct. Anyway that makes us one all. What next?" Renamon lent against the tree, her stance not completely relaxed. He had surprised her at her own game and she didn't seem to like that much.

Renamon closed her eyes, apparently deep in thought. She probably wanted to win as much as he did. How should they resolve this? Reddmon chuckled to himself.
111111111222111211212111112111111111211.title: Being sneaky 101.

choices: Mabye one more round. Still a lot of hours in the day.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Renamon opened her eyes, "No, I've got nothing. How about you?" Reddmon shrugged, "Beyond taking another swing at each other I'm out as well. And if I remember right, when you threw my clock it wasn't even twelve." Renamon pushed herself off the tree. "Well a draw won't do, so," She jumped onto the branch Reddmon was sitting on and charged towards him, "I'll try things your way." She engulfed her feet and paws in blue flame and spun, bringing her leg around towards the still sitting Reddmon. Reddmon rolled backwards under the attack, standing up on his paws and swinging his foot at a high arc aimed at Renamon's muzzle. She easily ducked back from that and made a sweep at Reddmon's arms, Reddmon flipped himself over Renamon's leg and parried a blow Renamon sent at his chest.

In the same movement Reddmon turned sideways and drove his elbow at her shoulder, which she knocked upwards and then hit him hard in the now exposed ribs. Reddmon stumbled backwards then teleported onto the underside of the branch, gripping it with his claws. Renamon didn't know this of course, she was still standing on top of the branch, trying to figure out where Reddmon had run off to.

Reddmon chuckled to himself then punched the branch, breaking it clear in half with a loud crack. As the surprised Renamon fell past Reddmon smiled and threw another punch at her, which she managed to grab and use to yank him from his perch. She used the leverage to smash both her feet into his chest, knocking him away from her and into a tree. Reddmon grunted as he hit the tree, but recovered quickly enough to draw his claws along the tree trunk, slowing his fall.

As Reddmon landed he heard Renamon giggle somewhere above him, Reddmon looked up in time to see the yellow vixen flying towards him. She hit him in a flying tackle, sending them both tumbling to the ground. After a brief struggle Renamon ended up on top, pinning Reddmon’s arms and legs to the ground.

Renamon smiled and gave him a quick kiss on the cheek, “I win.” She said getting off him. Reddmon brushed himself off as he got up and touched where she had kissed him. As Renamon stood against a tree watching him again Rika walked around a tree “So, who won?” she asked. “She did.” Answered Reddmon begrudgingly, not used to anyone but Orionmon ever getting the best of him in combat, and even that didn‘t happed often. Though truth be told, he somehow didn’t quite feel like he’d lost at all.

His thoughts were derailed as Rika asked “You two hungry? We can go get some food if you want a break, or would you like to go another round?”
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: And the winner is,

choices: Sorry, I'm actually late as it is.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
This time Renamon carried Rika while Reddmon followed behind them. They soon arrived back at the town and Reddmon moved up along side them. “So what’s the plan Rika?” He asked as he hopped from branch to roof. “I was going to pick up some meat and salad from a delicatessen nearby. Renamon and I usually go there after training.” Reddmon nodded and looked around, noticing that they were in a part of Shinjuku he didn’t recognize. Suddenly Renamon turned and jumped into a tree that stood near the edge of a park. Reddmon followed and landed within it’s branches as Renamon let Rika from her back. ”So where is it exactly?” Asked Reddmon, not sure why they had stopped here at all. Rika didn’t answer though, instead she was concentrating on climbing down the tree's trunk.

Renamon nudged him towards the edge of the tree’s leaves, moving a small branch out of the way. “Do you see that shop over there?” She asked, pointing at a small building nestled between a large office and a department store. Reddmon nodded, watching Rika cross the road and enter it. “A friend of Rika’s grandmother works there, so we usually get things at a discount.” Reddmon looked both directions along the street. Not many people around today. He thought to himself. Then he noticed a guy walk from a nearby ally. He was rather tall and bulky, wearing a long heavy coat and a wide rimmed hat pulled low over his head. A few people would look back at him as they passed, but other than that he seemed rather inconspicuous despite his size. Or maybe people are just getting used to weird things happening around here. Noted Reddmon. Thinking of the recent digimon attacks, both himself and Cyberdramon.

Then it hit him, “No, he wouldn’t.” Moaned Reddmon aloud. Renamon looked at him, then at the stranger. “What? Who wouldn't?” Reddmon slapped his paw against his forehead, this couldn’t end well.

---------------------------------

Rika looked over the large selection of sliced meat and the various types of salads, trying to guess what might be suitable for all three of them. When the bell hanging above the doorway jingled. Rika looked absently behind her to see a massive man stooping slightly to walk inside without hitting his head on the doorway. He was dressed completely in dark, concealing clothing, and wearing a pair of black glasses which covered his eyes and a portion of his face.

He noticed Rika looking at him and frowned, walking up to her and crouching down on his haunches so that he was level with her. “Rika what happened to you? Your face is bruised.” Rika blinked, she recognized that voice, “Orionm-” Orionmon held up his hand, “C’mon now, don’t lie, was it you know who?” Rika shook her head, that was almost the exact same reaction Reddmon had. “No, it was just a bully at school, but what are you doing here?” Orionmon straightened himself up before answering. “Buying more supplies for my place. And you?” Rika almost laughed, that explained all the fresh food he had in that fridge of his. “I'm getting lunch for me and the others. But should you really be here?”

Orionmon just shrugged, turning towards the store clerk, who had an order wrapped up already. “Sorry, I couldn’t help over hearing, but Orion, that’s a bit of a strange name.“ Orionmon took the package and gave the clerk some money, “It’s more of a nickname really, I teach at the dojo downtown you see. So that’s just what some people call me.” The clerk seemed satisfied by the answer and smiled, turning to Rika. “So Rika, have you decided what you want yet?” Rika nodded and asked for some pasta salad and several slices of chicken and beef.

As they walked out with their orders Orionmon said, “Sorry about that Rika, I honestly didn’t know you would be there, and I’m pretty sure my sudden appearance might be off-putting to some. Anyway, where’s Renamon, and probably Reddmon?" Rika took the lead, pointing towards the tree the two foxes were hiding in. “In that tree. But seriously, hasn’t anyone caught on to your disguise?” Orionmon laughed, “I’m one of the few digimon who, if given enough clothes, could pass for human. But yes, I do get more than few sideways glances.”

----------------------------------

Reddmon watched as Rika and Orionmon walked out of the store, holding a package each. They walked up to the tree and Rika knocked on the trunk then tossed up her bag, which Renamon easily caught and put aside. Reddmon sniffed the air, catching the smell of herbs and meat. Whatever Rika had bought it smells nice. I wonder how long till we can eat? Oh damn, I'm starting to think like Guilmon. Reddmon smiled at that.

"Hey Orionmon, it's not like you to pull stunts like that." Orionmon shrugged, his response dulled down as usual. "I've been doing this for quite a while actually. But what are you talking about, I'm sure you've had your own bit of under cover fun. Espionage and such." Reddmon grimaced, did he know about Redd? "So where are you training?" Asked Orionmon putting his package behind his back and dropping it into a hole that appeared. "In the forest. Why?" Replied Rika having gotten up the tree and sat down next to Renamon. "I was going to offer you a lift back to it, that is if you wanted." Rika nodded, "It would save us a lot of time."

"Great, where exactly are you?" Asked Orionmon. The teenage girl looked at her hands, calculating something in her head. "About one and a half kilometres south of here." Orionmon nodded and said. "Look behind you, and see you there." He stepped backwards into an oval that appeared behind him, vanishing from sight. Reddmon looked behind him as asked and found that a similar portal waited for them, he let Rika and Renamon go through first then grabbed the bag of food and followed.

A second later they where back in the clearing they had found earlier. And apparently Rika had gotten used to Orionmon's preferred method of travel because she and Renamon where already walking over to sit next to Orionmon. Who was stripping of his clothes, revealing the thick and heavily scarred metal plates he had riveted to his chest, arms and legs. Reddmon chuckled as he walked over to them, wondering how many of those nicks and dents where because of him. He sat next to Renamon as Orionmon took off his hat and glasses, tossing them behind him. They disappeared to some far off place.

Reddmon began sorting out the food Rika had bought, while for some strange reason Orionmon produced a flute from behind him and began playing it. Reddmon shook his head as he recognized the tune as something that Orionmon had played or whistled since he had first met him*. It was a slow, sad melody that always had a weird effect on Orionmon. Causing him to relax, to become a touch more, well mellow. "Orionmon, I didn't know you could play an instrument." Said Renamon a look of surprise in her eyes. Orionmon stopped playing and smiled, spinning the flute in his hand, "Well I guess I'm the sort of jack of all trades, master of non kind of mon. I have lot's of skills, but combat is what I truly excel at. Everything else is just hobby, ways to fill the time."

As strange an answer as ever Orionmon. I wonder what you hide? Thought Reddmon as he laid out the meats and opened the salads container. For as long as he'd known him Orionmon had given a off a strange aura. Giving even weirder answers.

With the food set out and forks produced by Orionmon (Something everyone else had forgotten about.) everyone began eating. Except for the warrior digimon, who said he wasn’t hungry and began playing his song again.

Once the food was gone and everyone full Rika looked at her watch, “It’s still only two o’clock, we have about an hour to wait before we can even call the boys. So Orionmon, would you like to have a sparing match with Renamon?” Orionmon stopped playing again and looked up for a moment, probably running through the daily schedule he made each morning. A complete waste of time, he never sticks to it anyway. Reddmon thought to himself. But it was just another one of the digimon’s strange habits.

(*The tune played is Resident Evil: Outbreak, main theme, a nice piece.)
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: The food run.

choices: Renamon wins, trouble seems to follow Reddmon.
Surprise, surprise it's a quite trip home.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Orionmon nodded standing up, “Always happy to spar with new people.” He said, laughing as he walked over to the far side of the clearing. Reddmon and Rika went over to take cover in the trees, Renamon meanwhile stood up and worked out a bit of stiffness in her shoulder.

She went through everything she knew about Orionmon, he was big and strong but relatively slow. He used his portals to counteract this, moving instantly around the battlefield. This didn’t put her at an disadvantage though, she could do that as well, if not better and more effectively. She had only seen him fight for a few minutes but his style seemed quite direct, with an emphasis on strong close combat attacks. Her best course of action then was probably stay at range attacking while avoiding his counters, but on the other hand she doubted he only had that fire pike attack of his, which in itself seemed to have a short range, as well as a obvious preparation and set-up.

Renamon took her fighting stance as Orionmon did likewise. He was about 10 metres away, which suggested that either he was going to engage in a fire fight, which she was confident she could win, or he was gong to use his portals to close the distance quickly in which case she should use a blow to the chest to launch herself backwards then teleport to a different location to setup an offensive.

Slowly Orionmon changed his stance, crouching down and touching his hands to the ground, a typical runners stance. Then he burst forward with worrying speed, his feet gouging up divots of dirt and grass as he thundered forward. Renamon jumped aside at the last moment and spun around to watch him run past, as she did she swore she felt an influx of displaced air. Renamon summoned up a cloud of diamonds and prepared to launch them at him when Orionmon rammed one of his spikes into the ground and slid to a halt, turning as he did and using the other spike to rake up a cloud of dust, obscuring himself. Renamon launched the diamonds anyway, he wouldn’t have time to block after that manoeuvre.

The barrage of razor sharp projectiles disappeared into the dust and Renamon listened hard for sounds of impact against something solid, but only heard them hit the trees behind it. She looked around, ready for an attack from an unexpected quarter, building up another storm of diamonds as she did.

Suddenly Orionmon burst from the cloud of dust, sprinting at her again, Renamon quickly launched another volley of diamonds at him but Orionmon moved to the side just enough to avoid them. Instead of dodging again Renamon dashed forward to meet him, placing her hands on his shoulders and vaulting over him. As she landed gracefully Orionmon pulled up to a halt, a good few metres behind her, a smaller cloud of dust marking his skid. He had a lot of momentum when he got moving, that much was certain. Maybe she could use that when he charged next.

He turned and took another stance, different from before. Which had been a sprinting stance. This one seemed to be more of a swordsman like position. Orionmon had extended his spikes, which we now encircled in a bright orange flame, and began advancing. Not nearly as fast as before but his long strides would soon get him within striking range. Renamon decided she needed to throw him off balance with a ranged attack then follow up with strike at his legs, arms or neck.

She created another group of diamonds, splitting it into two smaller one, launching one aimed at Orionmon’s left shoulder the other at his head. Orionmon saw what she was doing and raised his forearms, which were protected by the steel of his wrist mounts. Renamon was sure they would stop the crystals so she tried to change the trajectory mid flight, but that was hard at the best of times and she had been sparring or travelling most of the day. But she managed to change it enough to get through his guard and Orionmon stumbled back, the diamonds glittering against his torso.

Renamon saw her chance and teleported behind him punching him in the ribs then striking him in the neck. Instead of crumpling to the ground like most opponents would have Orionmon just grunted, falling to one knee and raised his hand. Renamon backed off while he pushed himself to his feet, groaning as he brushed the diamonds from his side and rubbed the side of his neck. “Alright, you did really well. But you seem tired. Your reactions aren’t as quick as I would expect. Would you like to get some rest and try again tomorrow?”

Renamon stood panting, slightly confused. Is he giving up? Orionmon waved for Reddmon and Rika to come back into the clearing. “You all seem quite weary. Maybe you and the others should come to my place tomorrow, It would allow us all to give everything we have, being so secluded and all.” Reddmon crossed his arms across his chest, “Hold on a sec, that’s not like you at all Orionmon, usually you badger me to keep training with you till you fall flat on your face with exhaustion.” Orionmon laughed nervously and scratched his shoulder.

Reddmon shook his head and continued “But I have to give it to you. It is a good idea, we can have some real fun without the risk of burning down the whole forest.” Renamon frowned, he was holding back? Oh that’s just great, another battle hungry nutcase to deal with. Suddenly Reddmon and Orionmon grinned at each other and broke into a fit of laughter. “Hey Orionmon, you remember that time our attacks struck each other mid air and exploded, pretty much levelling the Mechadramon’s battle arena.” Orionmon wiped his eyes. “Oh yeah, I forgot about that. Ha, that explains why he was so unhappy to see me yesterday.” Reddmon looked shocked, “You say Mechadramon? What did he do?” He asked. “Well, lets just say his newly rebuilt arena isn’t going to be open for use anytime soon “ Replied Orionmon, which made Reddmon laugh all the harder.

Renamon exchanged a look with Rika, “Boys, their the same no matter what the species.” Said Rika shaking her head. Renamon nodded, this was usually how Takato and the rest behaved. But still, Reddmon was kind of cute like this, rolling around on the ground laughing helplessly as Orionmon described his recent misadventure.
