They waited for a gap in Orionmon’s story and Renamon called out “Hey guys, we need to leave, Rika’s bruise has healed up enough to pass off as nothing, so we’ll see you towmorrow. OK?” Both digimon smiled and nodded. “Don’t cause any trouble, got it.” Said Rika seriously as they turned and left the clearing. Renamon smiled to herself, why did she even bother saying that? Was she asking for them to cause more havoc? “Hundred yen says that we hear an explosion from them before we get home.” She whispered to her partner, to make sure Reddmon didn’t over hear. Rika laughed “Your on. I’m probably going to lose but still.”

Both digimon and tamer continued walking towards the town, talking occasionally. But mostly they were consumed by there own thoughts.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: A meeting of opposites. Speed vs strength.

choices: It's Renamon and Rika. Wonder what they want?
Oh damn, it's the cops. Welcome to the Reddmon shooting range.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
As both the girls left Reddmon stopped laughing for long enough to catch his breath. "Seriously though Orionmon, you and I haven't know each other for all that long, why have you been hanging with me recently anyway. Besides our fighting skills we don't really know much about one another, much less have anything in common." Orionmon's wide grin quickly faded being replaced by a solemn look Reddmon hadn't seen on him before. "Your right, I don't know much about you. A while back I heard rumors of a digimon that matched your description causing chaos in the digital world, attacking places and what not, but then those reports stopped for a while. Eventually they started again, nothing as serious as before and not following the same pattern, but recognizable as your work all the same. Then we meet in combat and thats how we are now. But all that aside I know one thing about you Reddmon."

Reddmon was slightly unnerved by all this. This was the first time Orionmon had talked, in anyway, about their pasts. "And what's that?" He asked, not quite sure where Orionmon was even going. Orionmon gently put his hand on Reddmon's shoulder "That you my friend, are like me, a pariah." All the mirth from earlier had seeped from his features. He smiled wryly "Sorry, life gets the better of me sometimes. Will you be fine by yourself?" Orionmon asked standing up and brushing off his fur cuisse then opening a portal behind him. Reddmon nodded, still trying get a grasp on what Orionmon had just said. Orionmon nodded in return then disappeared through the hole.

Alone now Reddmon laid down on his back and stared at the sky for a while, watching the clouds move slowly towards some unknown destination. Who was he? Reddmon couldn't remember anything past landing in some village. The digimon there had attacked him on sight and he'd had to fight his way out. That was pretty much the beginning of his memory. But according to Orionmon he had been around before that, so why didn't he have any recollection of it? "Screw it." Mumbled Reddmon as he got up and began walking towards the town, he had a life and it was fine by him. It didn't matter who he'd been, he was Reddmon and he was happy enough with his lot in the world.

As Reddmon walked through the undergrowth his thoughts turned back to Renamon, he needed to impress her, show her his sensitive side. First I need to find it I suppose. Ideas, I need ideas. Save a kitten? Nah, that's way too cliché, and kind of lame. Charity work? Again, same problems. By this time Reddmon had reached the town and exchanged grass for rooftop.

Suddenly he heard a series of gunshots followed by an explosion. Figuring that whatever it was it might be worth a look. Reddmon changed direction and made his way towards the sound. He quickly came to a road which was blockaded both ways by several police cars with another few creating a ring before a bank building. Reddmon soon spotted the source of the explosion as a car that had burst into flames somehow and flipped over. Judging by the set up and the crowd of worried people it must be a robbery or a hostage situation.

A man with an assault rifle of some kind lent out of a window, firing an extended burst at another police car. The officers near it fled as the vehicle shuddered from the impacts and exploded in a bright red fireball, being launched into the air as it did, nearly hitting some of the fleeing cops as it crashed back to the ground. "Heroics might be just as good as sensitivity. And at the very least it will get the police off my back for before." Chuckled Reddmon as he lept forward, jumping over to the other side of the road and landing on a window sill of the back. He smashed the glass a hopped inside.

Hearing shouts of alarm from downstairs Reddmon ran to the doorway and pressed his ear against it, listening to heavy footsteps make their way up some stairs, sounded like there was three of them. Nothing he couldn't handle of course, but if he wanted to pull this off properly he needed to keep collateral damage to a minimum. He looked around the room and saw an old fashioned typewriter. He went over and picked it up then crept back to his position near the door. Waiting till he heard the people outside walk past. Reddmon tossed the heavy piece of equipment into the middle of the room then stood where the door would swing inward. At the loud thud he heard the people outside stop, then gruff a male voice said something and the footsteps rushed toward his room.

The door was suddenly kicked inward, nearly smacking Reddmon in the muzzle, but he grabbed it and waited as one guy stormed in, shortly followed by a second. Reddmon flung the door closed, hearing a grunt of pain and a thud, one down. The other two spun round to face him. He smiled, nothing impressive, just average thugs. Reddmon dashed forward, punching the first guy in the stomach and wrenching the gun from his grasp, tossing it out the window. Then before the other guy could even raise his firearm Reddmon teleported behind him and landed a solid kick to the back of his head. Muscle bound or not the guy fell like a sack of potatoes and Reddmon ran to the door opening it again. The third guy was on the ground, his eyes closed and blood running from his now broken nose.

"Too easy." Chuckled Reddmon as he made his way down the hall. He paused at the stairs, kneeling down and poking his head through the railings of the banister. From his upside down view of the main room he could see two guys, almost carbon copies of the ones he'd taken care of, brandishing more rifles at a group of terrified looking people who were laying bound up on the floor. Reddmon smiled as he saw several children in the group. Jackpot. He thought as he pulled his head back through the banister. He looked around for something heavy, if a trick works on an idiot once it'll work a million times. Finding nothing suitable Reddmon just shrugged and yanked one of the banister's posts out with a loud crack. He swung himself over the rail and used it to launch himself into the foyer. As the to brutes swung round their rifles Reddmon tossed the railing at ones head, teleporting behind the other as he did. A few quick blows later and the robbers where unconscious on the tile floor.

Reddmon turned towards the crowd of people and smiled, walking towards them. "Hi I'm Reddmon, I'll be rescuing you today." One person actually laughed as he began untying people's bonds. Once they had been freed people ran out of the building in groups, several actually thanking him as they left. Being the hero is actually kind of nice. An interesting change. Thought Reddmon as he looked around the room, empty except for the robbers, who where out cold.

Satisfied that he was done Reddmon walked over to one of the open windows and looked out, instead of seeming thankful smiles he was looking down the barrels of about thirty different guns. Reddmon gulped and ducked under the hail of bullets as the fuzz opened fire. Reddmon waited till the gunfire stopped and yelled back. "A thanks would have sufficed." His witty comeback was replied with another round of police fire. "Geez, ingrates." Muttered Reddmon as he teleported out of the building and hopped from roof to roof until he was several blocks away.

--------------------------

Meanwhile Renamon and Rika had just reached their front door and Rika had the key in the keyhole when they heard the first explosion. "Damn, Ranamon I think you just won by a split second. C'mon we'd better go sort him out." Renamon nodded and they made their way toward the source of the noise.

As they arrived at the scene a crowd of people rushed out of the bank. A man Rika recognized as Takatoe's father noticed them arrive and smiled, "Sorry to say but your a second too late, the bank robbers have already been dealt with." Then Rika saw Reddmon walk up to a window and smile, only to duck down a moment later as the police officers opened fire. Mr Matsuki groaned. "And they just opened fire on the hero. They must still be mad about the damage he caused last week. Funny, but everyone else has gotten used to it really, and its not like he was the worst one yet. He didn't even actually hurt anyone." Renamon giggled softly while Rika choked back a laugh. "That means I win." Said Renamon. Rika nodded, it seems like Reddmon didn't cause the explosions after all. She could clearly see bullet holes in the pavement near the wrecked cars.

"C'mon we'll meet him at his place." Said Rika as they ran towards Reddmon's house.

--------------------------------

Reddmon flopped himself down on his couch. The police had hopefully gone into the building and actually captured the robbers by now. It had been an, interesting day and Reddmon was spent. But just as he was about to nod off the doorbell rang. "Who the hell could that be." Grumbled Reddmon as he pushed himself up and walked over to the front door, peaking through the window besides it.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Reddmon to the rescue. Go figure.

choices: Oops, he mistimed. Somthing smashes through the wall.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Reddmon let the drapes fall back into place, there was at least ten of them outside. He slumped against the wall, groaning softly. He was in trouble now. Unless it was some kind of random search, which he doubted, they had somehow found out where he lived. He could turn into Redd and try to throw them off? No, bad idea. That would just reveal that Reddmon and Redd, and Holt for that matter, were linked.

Reddmon sighed and opened the door. Might as well face the music. An officer with a larger hat than the others stepped forward, probably the chief or something, Reddmon noticed that none of them had their guns drawn. "Um, may I help you?" He asked, still holding the door, ready to slam it shut at a moments notice. The chief coughed, clearing his throat. "Afternoon er, sir. We want to apologize for earlier when we," He paused nervously, looking at anything but Reddmon. "Shot at me?" Offered Reddmon helpfully. The police officer laughed shakily and took off his hat, worrying it in his hands. "Yes, sorry about that. We've been under a lot of pressure recently. The only real crimes going on are those caused by you digimon, and we're more or less helpless against you. So when we saw you we, overreacted. I'm ,we're sorry." Several officers behind him nodded solemnly.

Reddmon almost laughed out loud, they weren't here to take another shot after all. "Well don't worry about me causing trouble any more, I'll even try to take care of any Digimon related problems for you." He said, smiling at them reassuringly. This seemed to calm the officer down a bit. "That would be really helpful, we would be quite appreciative. I guess that’s all then. Thank you for your help today and your time this afternoon." With that he replaced his hat and nodded goodbye. Turning and leaving with the rest of the cops.

Reddmon watched the police get into their cars and drive off. Yep, I might just fit into the role of hero after all. Thought Reddmon as he closed the door and turned, almost walking head first into Renamon. "Gah! Where did you come from?" He exclaimed. Rika was standing close behind, watching them both intently. The corners of her mouth tweaked into a grin. "So first you save some people, and then your polite to the police, even offering to help them. Who are you and what have you done with Reddmon?" Asked Renamon putting a paw under his chin and turning his muzzle left and right, as if she was looking for signs of a disguise.

“Ha ha, very funny. What’s up?” Replied Reddmon, gently removing her paw and leaning against the door. Renamon shrugged, “We saw them shoot at you earlier and thought we should just check to make sure your not injured.” Reddmon made a mental note of that and smiled. “Well as you can see I’m fine and now on good terms with the authorities. But I’m tired, and if I know Orionmon he plans to put us all through boot camp tomorrow.”

“Boot camp?” Questioned Rika. Reddmon rubbed his eyes blearily before answering, “As you might have guessed he takes training really seriously. He’s probably going to ask us all to face off against him then give us tips on our fighting style. Surprisingly it actually works, he tends to spot flaws pretty well.” Chuckled Reddmon. “And he won’t go easy on you, so you might want to get some sleep tonight. Which is what I‘m hoping to do now” He finished with a yawn.

Renamon huffed. “Well he’ll be in for a surprise tomorrow, my technique is flawless.” Reddmon shrugged and opened the door, “We'll see tomorrow won’t we.” Renamon and Rika both narrowed their eyes at him and Reddmon thought they might try to prove him wrong right now.

But instead they walked out and he waved goodbye, though neither of them were looking at him, instead talking to each other intently. Reddmon smiled and made another mental note, don't offend their ability to fight, then closed the door. He went back to his couch and laid himself down again. “Well unless anyone else wants to burst in,” He glanced at the door, half expecting something or other to happen. After a minute of silence he continued, “I’m going to bed.” He closed his eyes and was soon fast asleep.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: A strange encounter.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Reddmon winced as a ray of morning light hit his eyes, an annoying way to wake up. He rolled off the couch he had been sleeping on and landed on his paws, doing a few quick push ups to get himself started. More alert he pushed himself to his feet and went into the kitchen, taking out a container filled with leftovers and putting it in the microwave on the counter. While that was running Reddmon went over to the sink and turned on the cold water. He watched it run down the drain for a moment then cupped some in his paws and threw it at his face, wiping last bit of drowsiness away.

Thoroughly awake Reddmon fished a fork from a drawer and wandered over to the microwave just as it dinged, announcing that the food was hot. Reddmon retrieved the steaming rice and meat and sat down at the table, looking out the draped window.

The sooner they got through this tournament the sooner they dealt with the person behind Cyberdramon. And then he could get back to more important matters, like Renamon. The saving helpless civilians thing had worked pretty well, he was sure he had surprised and impressed both Renamon and Rika. But he needed something else, winning at the tourney would be a good start but he needed something, well, something beautiful.

He created an energy ball and held it for a while. Watching the black lighting leap within the sphere, it definitely had it’s own kind of beauty, he let it dissipate, but not quite what he needed. Reddmon tossed the now empty food container into the bin against the wall. “Maybe I can get the big lug to teach me to play and instrument.” He said to himself, only half joking.

As if on cue the phone attached to his new belt crackled loudly. “Reddmon are you awake?” It was Orionmon, of course. Reddmon sighed, How did he do that? then grabbed the communicator and pressed the talk button. “Orionmon, do you have my house bugged or something?” He asked. There was a moments silence before Orionmon replied. “What do you mean bugged?” He'd never had any talent in deceit so it was probably just a coincidence.

“It’s nothing. What do you want?’ He asked as he put the fork he'd been absently twirling in the sink. “Could you meet me and the others by that delicatessen from yesterday.” Reddmon had already left his house and was about a quarter of the way there before Orionmon even finished the sentence. “Yeah, I’ll be there soon.” He hung up and quickened his pace.

He was soon in sight of the tree that stood adjacent to the deli, and sure enough underneath was Orionmon, in disguise of courses. Next to him stood Rika and Takato as well. Reddmon jumped into the trees branches landing next to Renamon. She smiled and waved to him. “Good morning Reddmon.” She seemed to be in a very good mood today. Takato was the first to look up and notice him crouching within the leaves. “Oh, hey Reddmon. We’re just waiting for Henry and Terriermon.” Reddmon glanced around, he couldn't spot the red and white lizard. “Where’s Guilmon?”

Reddmon heard a squeaky giggle somewhere above him. “He he he, hey Reddmon, up here.” Reddmon’s head snapped up and he nearly lost his balance and fell out of the tree. Less than two feet above him, his legs and arms wrapped around a branch, hung Guilmon. He waved his tail happily and grinned from ear to ear.

Below Rika tsked. “Sooner or later he’s going to fall you know.” Reddmon thought she was probably right, but he seemed to be enjoying himself to much to care. “Hey, here comes Henry and Terriermon.” Called Guilmon from his high vantage point.

Indeed Henry jogged into the shade of the tree a few moments later, with Terriermon riding on his shoulder. “Your late.” Noted Orionmon crossing his arms. ‘Momentai Orionmon.” Said Terriermon as he jumped off Henry. Reddmon chuckled to himself, remembering what Renamon had said that meant. Orionmon was the last mon to “take it easy.” Suddenly there was a cry of panic above them and a red blur shot past. A second later Orionmon was knocked to the ground as Guilmon fell on top of him. Well, Rika was right. Reddmon hopped down to help them.

“I told you this would happen.” Complained Rika as she helped Takato pull Guilmon off Orionmon and onto his feet. Orionmon waved his hand in a dismissive gesture as he stood, “It’s alright, no one got hurt. But you’re all here so we might as well go.” He waved again and a portal appeared against the tree trunk. Reddmon was the first to walk through it this time, and after a moment of disorientation he was back at Orionmons place.

A few seconds later everyone else stepped through and Orionmon closed the hole. “So let’s get everything set up then. Erm, I’ll need help with that.” He said scratching his nose absently. “With what?” Asked Henry looking around at the empty clearing. Reddmon chuckled again as Orionmon made a downward gesture. Creating a huge, horizontal, hole above the clearing. A large pile of metal and transparent material plummeted down and slammed into the ground with enough force to make everyone stumble. Except for Reddmon and Orionmon who knew exactly what was going to happen.

“Orionmon what the hell is that?” Exclaimed Rika regaining her balance. “Is that a, blast screen?” Asked Henry as he walked over to it and tried to lift the top piece. Reddmon smiled, it was no use, only him and Orionmon could even begin to get those things in place. Instead Henry climbed on top of the pile and rapped a knuckle against the see through section. “Where in the world did you get this? It must be at least four inches thick.” Orionmon walked up next to him and slapped a palm against the stack. “Apparently it’s able to stop a tank round. Must get around to trying that. Anyway, Reddmon and I picked it up during a sortie we went on through some sort of military base.”

Takato and Guilmon leapt up against the pile and began pulling on the top plate with everything they had, while Renamon and Rika just waited by a tree. Renamon’s ears perked up when Orionmon mentioned the word sortie. “When you say sortie you mean a paid mission, right?” She asked. “Yes, didn’t I tell you? I usually work as a mercenary or hired sword. And sometimes, when I think I’ll need to blow stuff up I get Reddmon to come along, he is rather good at that. So can every one digivolve to champion. We‘ll need the extra strength.”

The kids took out their digivices and a flash of white later Growlmon, Gargomon and Kyubimon stood before them. “Okay everyone, just gather into groups take a piece of screen. Place it next to another and slid them together. Then pull out the supporting struts and push them into the ground.” Reddmon and Kyubimon went with the Digidestined while Gargomon and Orionmon handled one together. Growlmon on the other hand was big and strong enough to deal with one on his own.

They soon had a large circle set up inside the clearing. Orionmon did a quick check of all the shields then nodded his approval. “That was much easier than doing it by ourselves. Wasn’t it Reddmon?” Laughed Orionmon. Reddmon had to agree with him, it had taken only a few minutes from start to finish.

“So, one on one combat. Who’s up first?” Asked Orionmon clapping his hands together.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: The next day. Boot Camp!

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Orionmon motioned towards the circle formed by the blast shields, "Kyubimon, I believe I promised you a rematch? Would you like to have the honours?" The large yellow fox nodded and easily jumped the three metre high barricade. Doing a graceful somersault midair and landing lightly on her paws.

Orionmon watched her acrobatics and shrugged just creating a pair of portals on either side of the wall and walking through it, door like. Reddmon chuckled, pretty sure Orionmon only did that so he wouldn't look like a fool struggling up it.

"Right, shall we begin? Remember no need to hold back. Everyone is quite safe from any stray attacks." Said Orionmon stretching his arms out. Reddmon stood next to the wall, watching as both digimon took their fighting stances. "This promised to be a good fight." Thought Reddmon. After all, he was able to take Orionmon down but he was interested to see if Kyubimon could as well.

Kyubimon made the first move, spreading out her tails and calling "Fox tail inferno!" The flames on her tails flared brighter and shot outwards, flying towards Orionmon at incredible speed. He managed to duck and dodge the first few projectiles but the last pair hit him hard in the chest and shoulder.

Orionmon stumbled backwards a few steps then brought his arm up, wreathing it in flame and yelling "Infernus Axe!" He slammed it into the ground with a resounding boom. A fierce fire erupted from the point of impact and swallowed Orionmon, swelling out to take up nearly half the makeshift arena. Even through the shield Reddmon could feel the intense heat radiating from the conflagration that burnt inside. The others flinched back from the fire and Rika turned to him. "What’s happening? Will he be alright?" She asked worriedly. Before he could answer a shape burst from of the side of the fire. It was Orionmon, launching himself sideways. When in mid air he made a slashing motion with an extended spike, bellowing "Blazing slash!" and a large line of fire flew from his arm, scything threw the air towards Kyubimon.

She saw the attack coming and jumped over it, spinning vertically. Her whole body was suddenly engulfed in an ice blue flame, which took on a life of it’s own and formed into a draconic maw. “Dragon wheel!” Cried Kyubimon as the flaming attack rushed toward Orionmon. He rolled to the side as the flames passed over him, missing by inches. “To close.“ Chuckled Orionmon as he brushed some soot from his shoulder plate. Kyubimon landed on her paws and smiled back, looking over his shoulder. Orionmon frowned and followed her gaze to see the attack had swung up behind him in a wide arc and slammed on top of him.

Orionmon braced as the dragon swallowed him, obscuring him completely. When the fire dissipated Orionmon fell to one knee panting heavily. Grunting he pushed himself back to his feet, swaying slightly. “I’m not done yet.” He muttered between heaving breathes. Reddmon chuckled. Defiant to the end, that summed Orionmon up for sure.

He pulled his arm back, it’s whole wrist mount now blazing. “Fire pike!” He yelled as a lance of pure heat shot out towards Kyubimon, who jumped aside to avoid it. Then jumped upwards as another pair of attacks crashed into the ground in front of her. Only to have a wave of fire fly at her. Unable to dodge again she blocked with her tails. Stopping the works of the assault.

She landed shakily, and was immediately knocked her from her feet as Orionmon emerged from a portal and crash tackled her in the side. The two wrestled in the dirt for a few seconds before Kyubimon managed to get her legs under Orionmon and shove him off herself. Orionmon landed heavily on his back and scrambled to his feet as Kyubimon stood as well, facing off again. Reddmon could tell that both digimon were starting to tire, although he also knew neither would give up that easily.

“C’mon Kyubimon take him down.“ Called Rika, giving the shield a loud thump for emphasis. Kyubimon nodded and spread her tails wide. The flaming tips becoming brighter again. “Fox tail inferno!” She cried as the small flames spread out in several different directions. Turning midair and zeroing in on Orionmon. For his part the warrior digimon just smiled and opened a series of portals swallowing the projectiles. This was probably Orionmon's most powerful, or possibly annoying ability, redirecting attacks. A pair of portals opened above Kyubimon and two of her own attacks flew out and nearly hit her. A series of holes began appearing all around Kyubimon. Lousing a rapid volley of her flames. She managed to dodge most of them, mainly by jumping around, under or over them.

Orionmon added several of his own attacks to the barrage, getting them to where he needed them by using his portals. Kyubimon had to jump over a wave of fire that flew close to the ground. Orionmon watched as she launched herself into the air and disappeared into a portal. Appearing underneath her, crashing into her bodily.

Both digimon slammed into the ground, with Orionmon on top, pinning Kyubimon with his arms and legs. Kyubimon struggled a bit, but found that Orionmon’s grip was two firm. Finally, “Alright you win.” She muttered grudgingly, ceasing to squirm. Orionmon got off her and watched as she de-digivolved, turning back into Renamon. Orionmon smiled and held out his hand helping Renamon to her feet.

He coughed then closed his eyes, probably running through the whole fight in his head. “Well my analysis of you combat ability is pretty good. You tactics, agility, speed and accuracy are all perfect. And you seem to have the ability to guide you projectiles, I would invest time on improving that talent. Try creating attacks and moving them around at will. Maybe weaving them throughout trees in a forest. Beyond that your an excellent fighter.”

Reddmon glanced at Rika from the corner of his eye and noticed her smiling ever so slightly. Seems she was happy with Orionmon’s praise.

Renamon and Orionmon walked to the edge of the shield, exiting the same way as they entered. Once outside Orionmon pulled a pair of small objects from a hole. Reddmon instantly recognised them as food bars that Orionmon kept with him, they boosted a digimon’s regenerative ability considerably. Orionmon tossed one of them to Renamon then sat down against a tree trunk opening the plastic of his own. “What is this?” Asked Renamon inspecting the wrapping. Orionmon was already chewing on his so Reddmon answered for him. “It'll help you heal and regain your energy much quicker, tastes pretty good too.”

Orionmon swallowed the last of the food bar as Renamon opened hers and chewed on it daintily. “So who’s next?” He asked looking around the group.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: A rematch, Orionmon vs Renamon

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
"Oh, me, me, me!" Cried Growlmon jumping up and down, waving his arms excitedly. "Uhh sure, who do you want to fight?" Asked Orionmon. Growlmon looked to Reddmon, "You said we could have a rematch for earlier, now is good." Reddmon nodded and jumped on top of the shield, balancing easily on the thick steel. He glanced back at Growlmon who looked at the wall, he was easily taller than it but not enough to jump over, and it would fall over if he tried to climb. So he pulled two panels apart with his claws and just walked through.

After putting them back together he turned towards Reddmon, who jumped down from his perch and took up his fighting stance. "You not gonna take me out so easy this time." Chuckled Growlmon, rearing back his head. "Pyroblaster!" He yelled, a large burst of flame hurtling from his mouth towards Reddmon. Who laughed and easily dodged aside, dashing forward as soon as his paws touched the ground. Growlmon launched another fireball at him, but Reddmon saw this one coming as well and jumped over it, flying towards Growlmon, his right foot extended. This was going to be a mirror image of the last fight. Thought Reddmon, just as Growlmon ducked the kick. His tail whipping up and slamming into Reddmon’s chest, knocking him into the far wall, hard.

As he slid down the transparent barrier Reddmon smiled to himself, this was going to be fun after all. He pushed himself to his feet and began running towards Growlmon, ready to teleport out of the way of any projectiles. Instead of another long range attack Growlmon advanced to meet him, the fin like protrusions on his arms lengthening and beginning to glow brightly.

When Growlmon was within arms reach, which was a lot longer than Reddmon’s, he made a large swing at his waist. Reddmon vaulted over the blade and ducked as the other arm rushed over him. He quickly formed a ball of crackling energy in his paw and lobbed it up a Growlmon's muzzle, teleporting as he did. Reddmon landed several feet away, just in time to watch as Growlmon recoiled from the cloud of smoke created by the sphere’s explosion. The large dinosaur like digimon shook his head and coughed, looking around for him. He quickly spotted Reddmon and growled, charging straight at him again.

Reddmon created another energy ball and jumped into the air, flipping and throwing the projectile at the ground beneath him. Dematerializeing a smoke grenade and pulling the pin as he fell into the black cloud to conceal himself. He dropped the grenade and rolled aside as he heard Growlmon charge into the dust. Reddmon kept low as he sensed Growlmon’s tail swinging around just above him. He mustn't have a clue where I am. Thought Reddmon as he ducked under Growlmon’s tail again.

Growlmon was a natural brawler but he still didn’t have nearly as much battle experience as Reddmon did, which was something he could use. Reddmon quietly pushed himself to his feet and backed out into the clear air. Hopping back onto the barricade and watching for any sign of Growlmon. Eventually his red and black striped snout emerged from the smoke cloud. Reddmon teleported in front of him and did a midair back flip. Kicking him hard and sending Growlmon stumbling backwards into the smoke with a yelp. Reddmon tossed an energy ball in after him for good measure, as well as to sustain the cloud

Reddmon heard some cursing from inside the smoke and chuckled, teleporting to stand on the wall again. He waited a bit longer for Growlmon to try to get out again, ready to punish any mistakes. “Pyroblaster!” Growlmon yelled, a continuous beam of fire bursting out of the cloud and hitting the wall, sweeping along it. Reddmon felt the barrier vibrate softly as the fire passed under him, but it easily held. The grenade was beginning to wear off and it wouldn’t be long till Growlmon got another solid blow.

Which meant he needed to stop playing around. Reddmon waited a little longer, until he could see the vague outline of Growlmon standing within the fading cloud and dropped down from his position, running full speed towards Growlmon. As soon as he hit the ground his opponent turned and walked from the smoke, blades extended and glowing. Reddmon dodged a sweeping blow that carved a large ditch in the ground and jumped onto the extended arm, running along it and punching Growlmon in the side of the head. He teleported above him and threw another energy ball at his snout.

Growlmon was knocked forward by the resultant blast, and Reddmon followed through by teleporting behind him and throwing a strong to the back of the his knee. Growlmon stumbled and fell heavily onto his side with a grunt of pain. Reddmon formed another sphere and landed near his head. “Ready to give up now?” He inquired pleasantly. Growlmon looked from him to the crackling ball of energy. “Will you throw that thing at me if I say no?” He asked tiredly. Reddmon smiled and nodded. “Yep, so, what’s your answer.”

Growlmon sighed and was engulfed by a white light, reappearing as Guilmon “You win.” He said somewhat dejectedly as he walked towards the blast shield. “Wait, Guilmon.” called Reddmon, running after him. “You did loads better this time, just look at me as a rival you need to overcome.” Guilmon seemed to be slightly cheered up by this, or maybe he just couldn't stay depressed for any length of time, either way. “Yeah, next time I’ll win for sure.” Reddmon smiled and walked with him to the edge of the protecting wall.

Orionmon created a portal for them to walk through, after all Guilmon wasn't strong enough to lift apart the wall. Once through Orionmon tossed them a pair of his energy bars. Which Reddmon immediate opened and began chewing on. “Yay, food!” Yelled Guilmon, nearly eating the wrapper as well as the bar.

“Good job Guilmon!” Said Takato, running over and hugging Guilmon. "You almost had him." Reddmon smiled at that, jumping up into a tree and sitting down on a branch. “Indeed, you seem to make good use of your strength and toughness, as well as even using your tail as an effective weapon. My only advice would be to work on your reaction speed. That would allow you to attack and defend more accurately” Said Orionmon appraisingly.

“So that leaves you Gargomon. I guess I‘ll face you.” Orionmon got up and brushed a few bits of soot from himself, the varios scratches and such having completely disappeared.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Reddmon vs Growlmon

choices: I'm tired, I might as well go home.
Well there's something you could help me with.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Orionmon did a check on the mechanism controlling his wrist spikes then created a portal, motioning for Gargomon to step through. As he started towards it Henry placed a hand on his partner’s shoulder. “Good luck Gargomon, and watch your shots. He can easily use them against you.” Gargomon nodded, ”Momentai Henry, I've got it all planned out.” Henry sighed and raised a finger in warning, “Remember, no battle plan survives first contact with the enemy.”

Gargomon laughed and stepped through the hole, reappearing on the other side. Orionmon closed the hole and opened another to the far side of the clearing, taking up his stance as Gargomon did a final check on his arm mounted gatling guns.

This time Gargomon attacked first raising his guns, yelling “Gargo bullets!” Firing full auto, spraying shots in Orionmon’s direction. Orionmon bolted to the side, managing to stay inches in front of Gargomon’s barrage. Even from this distance Reddmon could tell by Gargomon’s stance that he was planning something sneaky.

Because of the curve in the arena wall Orionmon was forced to move towards Gargomon which meant he wouldn't be able to stay in front of the bullets for much longer. As soon as he saw this the warrior digimon crouched slightly and raised his arms in front of his torso. He was running straight at Gargomon now, the gunfire pattering against his metal armguards.

Suddenly Gargomon stopped firing, green light coming from the barrels of his guns. Then as Orionmon closed in, his arm raised to strike Gargomon released all the bullets at once, almost like a shotgun. Orionmon weaved to the side avoid the first blast but was knocked from his feet as the second one hit him in the chest.

Gargomon immediately stepped forward, rasing his arm and bringing it down towards the prone form of Orionmon. At the last second Orionmon caught the heavy gun barrel and pulled back, putting a foot on Gargomon’s chest and flipping him over himself, changing his grip slightly and slamming Gargomon onto the ground.

Both digimon quickly scrambled to their feet, Gargomon charging up his guns for another close range blast and Orionmon extending his spikes to full length. Gargomon brought up his left gun but Orionmon stepped forward and knocked the barrel to the side, letting it blow a large chunk of dirt into oblivion, and swung the other, club like at Gargomon’s shoulder. Gargomon quickly raised his right gun to block and a loud clang of steel on steel rang out through the clearing. Gargomon angled the gun barrel towards Orionmon’s head and fired, but Orionmon jerked aside, the shots glancing off his shoulder plate.

Gargomon pushed hard against his larger opponent but it was clear that he was considerably stronger, and as Orionmon gave a solid push Gargomon slid backwards several inches. Smiling slyly Orionmon suddenly retracted his spikes and the unbalanced Gargomon stumbled forward, only to take a brutal blow to the chin. Actually lifting him clear off his feet. Orionmon followed up by using a portal to get above Gargomon and grabbed him mid air, spinning and throwing the gunner digimon against the arena wall.

Gargomon grunted as he hit the ground and pushed himself into a sitting position rubbing his chin. ”Okay okay, you win. What’s up with you guys anyway, how come your so tough?” Orionmon walked over and extended an arm to help him up. “Simple, I train, a lot. Reddmon on the other hand, well I not sure, he won’t tell me much about who taught him to fight.” Orionmon and Gargomon exited the arena and Orionmon glanced up at him. I’ve told him a thousand times, I don’t know where I learned to fight. He probably only wants to pester whoever taught me anyway.

“Anyway, Gargomon, you’re an excellent fighter as well. Your attacks would give you an edge when fighting multiple opponents and that variation you made has a real kick to it, useful for close range one on one encounters, and surprisingly your hand to hand abilities are quite good for a long range specialists. But most impressive is your planning ability. Until we reached that deadlock you seemed to have two steps already set up. Something that neither Guilmon or even Renamon can match. My only suggestion would be to hone your close combat ability. Maybe study a martial art of some sort, good for self discipline as well.” Henry laughed and put an arm over Gargomon’s shoulder. “Him, disciplined? Yeah right.” The digidestined and their digimon chuckled at that. Seems like Gargomon has a reputation. Thought Reddmon as he rolled off the branch and landed next to Renamon, who looked at him and smiled warmly.

Orionmon passed Gargomon an energy bar as well and turned back to the ring of shields. With a large sweeping gesture a massive hole opened up under it and the whole thing just fell into it. After closing it he turned back to the group. “Overall you all should do really well in the upcoming tournament. Oh and something else of note is that deleting digimon is prohibited when on the grounds, so don’t worry about losing you partners.” He said smiling at the tamers. “It’s mainly to keep strong fighters returning in the following competitions.” Noted Reddmon.

“ Umm, I guess that’s it, we have two days left to prepare so good luck. Anything else anyone wants to say or needs me to get for them?” Everyone shook their heads. “Well then form a line and tell me where you want to go.” Everyone took turns at hopping through portals, Henry and the just de-digivolved Terriermon went home to their apartment, Takato and Guilmon went to the park and Rika and Renamon went somewhere uptown.

This left Reddmon once again alone with Orionmon, “So where to?” He asked, hand at the ready.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: One last round of combat.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
"Sure, what is it?" Asked Orionmon, closing the portal and crossing his arms behind his back. “Well *sigh* laugh and I’ll kill you. But could you, teach me to play an instrument?” Reddmon asked, scratching the back of his head. Orionmon chuckled and opened a pair of portals, from which two large, comfortable looking chairs fell. Orionmon sat down in one and looked at Reddmon, smiling slyly. “No prizes for guessing why, huh? To woo Renamon?”

“Yeah, yeah. Got it in one. So will ya?” Asked Reddmon dropping himself into the chair opposite Orionmon. “Of course I will, but the question is what instrument would be suitable? Taking into account your level of dexterity and the target audience, a flute perhaps? No, that’s not really you.” Orionmon looked towards the sky and scratched his chin. “A piano? You could transport it easy enough, but you fingers might be too thick to manipulate the keys." Orionmon paused for a moment, then. " Hmm, maybe. Could you create one of you projectiles?” A strange request but Reddmon did as asked, forming a sphere of energy and letting it float an inch above his paw.

Orionmon closed his eyes and cocked his head, listening intently. The sphere made a soft humming noise, constant and even. “Yes, that could work.” Said Orionmon. “What do you mean?” He asked, looking from the ball of energy to Orionmon, not quite sure where this was going. “Don’t worry, just wondering about something. Can you decrease the energy inside the sphere will maintaining its form?” Reddmon nodded “Um, sure.” He dropped the amount of power in the ball, which in turn shrank, its humming decreasing in volume and pitch. Ah, so that’s what he’s getting at. Thought Reddmon, smiling.

“So, your catching on? Next try to increase the density of energy while keeping its size the same.” Reddmon pushed more strength into it while simultaneously restricting its size. He was rewarded with a higher pitched humming and a slight increase in volume. “Good, now how about a pulse, a quick increase in the volume. Try to keep the density the same while increasing the size quickly.” Reddmon concentrated on gathering energy into the his paw. Then when he had enough he pushed it into the sphere, the ball bulged suddenly creating a thud sound like the beating of a drum or even a heart.

“Does it feel like the integrity of the sphere was in anyway in danger of being compromised?” Reddmon shook his head, that was easy to maintain, almost natural. “Then lets try a rhythm next. Try to copy this with you sphere.” Orionmon clapped his hands together in a simple pattern. Which Reddmon copied easily, Thud thud, thud, thud thud, thud.

“As I thought, this will be much simpler than learning a traditional instrument, and more characteristic. One last thing to try. Can you increase the volume slower, more like a slide than a beat.” Reddmon drew energy from the sphere at a steady rate, creating a sound somewhat like a engine powering down. Then reversed it, going back to the original size and tone. “So if you combine those two lessons you should be able to create music. What’s more I've noticed that the projectiles you create in combat seem to be of a standard size, you could try different sizes and densities for various situations.”

“Back to the topic of music though. Would you like to try a tune now?” Reddmon nodded as Orionmon pulled his flute from midair. “Listen once then try to copy, okay?” Reddmon re-adjusted himself in the seat and re-distributed the energy in the sphere. Orionmon played a more complex tune this time, one that Reddmon actually liked the sound of. Then once he finished playing he motioned for Reddmon to join in and began again.

Reddmon managed to play through with only a few errors. When they finished Orionmon lowered his flute, “That was very good Reddmon, you seem to have a knack for this. One more time then well move on to the last lesson.” They played the tune again. This time, much to his own surprise Reddmon got it perfectly, matching Orionmon note for note.

“Ha ha! Now your getting the hang of it, but now where on the last stretch. Can you create a second energy ball, then copy this tune with it?” Said Orionmon jovially, raising the flute to his lips and playing a different piece this time. This one had fewer notes but they all sort of ran into the next one, sliding up and down. Once finished Orionmon began again and Reddmon again copied, getting it on the first try. “Good, now see if you can play both parts at once.” Reddmon frowned, that might be tricky, like patting ones head and rubbing their stomach at the same time. “You mean one part on each hand right.” Orionmon nodded and waited for Reddmon to start, absently spinning the flute in his hand.

Reddmon inhaled deeply and slowly let it out again. Starting both at once would be too hard so he decided to begin the first part then come in later with the second. Within moments he had both orbs of energy pulsing in time with their respective tunes, the melody they had been practicing played in its full for the first time. Reddmon grunted as his concentration slipped a bit and an incorrect tone interrupted the flow of notes. Orionmon opened his eyes, having closed them at some point or another. “Reddmon, that was good buy why don’t you let them dissipate, it’s getting late and were both tired anyway.” Reddmon watched the lightning leap around the insides of the sphere then drew it out and back into his paw. “I guess your right, Thanks.”

“Well do you think you have a grasp on this now?” Asked Orionmon. Reddmon nodded, “Yeah, so where do you think I should look to find new songs to learn?” Orionmon reached into a portal and pulled out a CD player. “Here, I think there is a music store near your place, have a look there sometime. But don’t slack off this week, I don’t want you to get knocked out of the running before we fight.” With that Orionmon stood up opened a portal. “So you read to go home, or is there something else you need?”
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: A note of beauty

choices: Might as well check out how the kids are doing.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
"Yeah thanks, home’s good. See you Tuesday." Yawned Reddmon, walking through the portal Orionmon created for him a moment later, giving a small wave as Orionmon disappeared from his sight.

After a short, dark trip he was back in his living room, the last rays of evening light struggling through the thick dusty drapes. Dead tired Reddmon glanced at the stairs, he could go up and sleep in one of the bedrooms. But he just settled for the couch again and sat down, punching the pillow a bit to get it comfy then laying his head on it. Within moments he was out.

-----------------------------------------

Again Reddmon winced as bright light hit his eyes. He sat up and stretched, glaring at the beam that traced along the room and over the cushion where his head had been moments ago.

He looked at the clock, his eyes taking a moment to adjust. It was nine o’clock already so the tamers would be at school, probably with Renamon watching them, while Guilmon would be hiding out at the park. Reddmon frowned, that left Terriermon unaccounted for. He wasn’t sure where the rabbit like digimon hung out during schooldays, most likely at home or maybe even at the park with Guilmon, those two seemed to get really along.

He could join the tamers as Redd/Holt, after all that jerk from before might give Rika trouble again, but on the other hand he really wanted to practice his “music” and maybe even experiment with changing the properties of his attacks.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: A new day.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
“Nah, they can deal with the bully by themselves.” Muttered Reddmon as he walked over to the front door, before he began practicing he needed to get some food though. He was starving, having forgotten to eat dinner last night. He changed into Redd and grabbed some money from the change bowl that stood on a table near the door. He would need to get some more cash soon, after all Renamon probably wouldn’t approve of him stealing things anymore.

Reddmon, well Redd, walked around town for a while, finding and investigating the music place Orionmon had mentioned and in the end stopping at a small roadside stall and eating some decent braised beef and rice.

After Redd had eaten his fill he went back to the record store and picked up a few CDs that had gotten his attention. Leaving the store he decided that he might as well practice outside, so he walked to the park and found a large area completely filled with trees. Redd hopped up into one and sat down, “feeling” around himself for anyone that might discover him.

Sensing no one he changed back to Reddmon and materialized the CD player Orionmon had given him. Taking out one of the discs that he’d just bought, Reddmon switched it on and inserted the CD into a likely looking slot, turning the volume dial to a relatively low setting. Reddmon listened to several of the songs, noting the ones that he thought he could play with just two or even one “instrument”.

Once he had gone through the CD he went back to the one he thought most suitable and played it again. He listened to it a second time then created a energy sphere in his paw and took a deep breath. “What cha’ doin’ Reddmon?” Asked a squeaky voice. Reddmon started, dropping the ball of pure destructive energy.

He quickly swung backwards under the branch and snatched the sphere from midair, halting it’s fall inches from Guilmon’s upturned muzzle. Not particularly disturbed by this Guilmon asked again. “So is it training, or are you playing a game? Oh, can I play too?” Reddmon dispersed the ball and righted himself on the branch. “How long have you been there?” He asked. The happy-go-lucky Digimon just shrugged. ”A few minutes, how about a game of tag?”

“Nah, maybe another time, I’m trying to learn something new at the moment.” Guilmon cocked his head and sat down. “Mind if I watch?” This time it was Reddmon’s turn to shrug. “Sure, but it’s more of a listening thing.” Guilmon adjusted himself and watched Reddmon intently as he created another energy ball.

Reddmon started playing the music he had heard a moment ago, getting several notes wrong but getting even more right. He played it again, with much more success. And on the third try he got it perfectly. Quite happy with himself he looked down to his audience, “So what do you think Guilmon?” Guilmon didn’t answer, he was fast asleep, snoring softly, a small bubble of snot coming from his nose.

Reddmon glared down at Guilmon, his eyebrow twitching. Keep calm, keep calm, he fell asleep right? That’s a good sign. It means it’s soothing. Aw hell I could hit him twenty times before he woke up, let alone struck back. Reddmon took another deep breath and let the energy ball he was holding fade. Sighing Reddmon dematerialised his stuff and hopped from the branch, materializing a camouflage patterned blanket and laid it over the sleeping form of Guilmon. Didn’t want to freak out any park goers after all.

Reddmon left the park and made his way back home, entering by one of the upstairs windows. As he landed softly Reddmon sensed a presence in the room. He span round to see Renamon sitting on the bed, smiling at him warmly. Reddmon smiled back and clutched his chest it fake surprise. “What’s up Rena, don’t you usually watch Rika and the others on school days?” Renamon got up and glanced out the window, “Terrirermon is at the school at the moment, he should be able to handle any trouble. So what have you been doing?” Reddmon shrugged, and made a mental note to talk to Guilmon about keeping his mouth shut in relation to earlier. “Nothing much, just looking around town, thinking.”

Renamon took a few steps closer, near enough for her muzzle to be inches away from his own. “What where you thinking about?” She asked, almost whispering. Reddmon smiled and gently touched her chin, “Truth be told you certainly crossed my mind a few times.” Renamon laughed lightly and sat back down on the bed.

“Sorry to say but I actually came here to ask you about less pleasant matters. Do you have any thoughts about the whole business with Cyberdramon.” Reddmon rubbed his eyes, “Not really, hopefully this tournament will turn up some leads. I’m pretty sure that wasn’t just a random digimon suddenly being obsessed with me.” Renamon sighed, nodding. “Your right, but what do we do once we find out who’s behind it all?”

“Heh, that parts simple. I go beat them up till they beg for mercy.” Chuckled Reddmon, leaning casually against the window sill. Renamon laughed and teleported behind him, standing on the veranda roof. “I hope for your sake its that easy.” Reddmon turned to look to ask her what she meant but she had already disappeared.

“Meh, I can always ask them for help if it comes to that.” Muttered Reddmon as he left the room, although he only said that because he was sure Renamon might be listening. And he suspected trust would be something she would appreciate.

Reddmon made his way downstairs and sat in one of the chairs in the living room, rematerialising his CD player and finding the tune from earlier. He created another energy ball and began playing along, wanting to surprise the foxy lady as soon as possible.

-----------------------------------------------

Several hours later, as it began to get dark, Reddmon dispersed the spheres he was using and laid back in the chair. “Perfect.” He said to himself, smiling. He had gotten four pieces down and he had another that he wanted to start learning, but keeping those spheres coherent was beginning to tax him. And he still needed to figure out when to show Renamon, maybe sometime after the tournament.

Reddmon wandered up to the top floor, grimacing as he saw the large dent he had made in the wall. That was from the first day I met Renamon, heh, that seems like such a long time ago. Thought Reddmon as he swung the door open, looking at the bed Renamon spent a few days recovering on. “Which reminds me, I should change those sheets soon.” Said Reddmon aloud as he walked to another room and laid down on its bed, then almost immediately getting up again and making sure the widows drapes where firmly sealed. He nodded in satisfaction then laid down again pulling the sheet haphazardly across his chest and instantly falling asleep.

Note: Tune was Lon Lon ranch from ocarina of time (If its not on CD it should be!)
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Another music session.

choices: Someone else shows them how it's done.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Renamon walked into the Nonaka’s kitchen and said good morning to Rika’s grandmother. She was always up at the crack of dawn, making some “interesting” recipe or another. Rika struggled to eat most of it but Renamon herself usually found it quite palatable. This morning's food smelt strongly of ginger and cinnamon.

“Here you are Renamon, you’ll need your strength for today won’t you?” Said the elder Nonaka kindly, placing a plate of colourful and fragrant food on the table. “Thank you very much. It looks lovely.” Said Renamon with a slight bow as she sat down and began eating. After the D-reaper incident Renamon had become a official member of Rika’s family. Complete with a touching ceremony which had brought a tear to her eye.

As Renamon finished the food on her plate Rika entered the room, rubbing her eyes blearily. “Morning everyone.” She mumbled getting herself a glass of juice and a bowl of cereal. She sat down opposite to Renamon, “So, are you feeling confident.” She asked as she chewed a mouthful of cereal. Renamon snuffed a laugh, “Well if Reddmon wins most of the time I have a good chance. But it’s going to be fun going back to the digital world, we haven’t been there in a while ”

Rika choked on her cereal, she thumped a fist against her chest a few times and swallowed hard. “Fun?” She cried, “The last time we went there we got separated and completely lost, not to mention almost getting deleted about twenty times! And we even lost Leomon.” She finished, referring to Kari’s long gone partner. Renamon nodded. “It is true that we lost much there, but we gained even more and saved many, besides Orionmon can get us out of any trouble we can’t deal with.”

Rika nodded, conceding and finished the last of her cereal. “So should we call the others and meet them someplace?” Asked Rika. Renamon shrugged and got up, taking her and Rika’s dishes and putting them all in the sink. As she ran some hot water she lent against the sink. “I suppose we should just get them to head over to Guilmon’s place. I mean, that’s where we usually meet up.” She turned off the water and began cleaning the dishes. Rika came over and helped drying and putting them where they belonged.

A few minutes later they had both cleaned themselves up and gotten ready. “Bye grandma!” Called Rika as she put her shoes on and left. “Keep safe you two.” She called back. Renamon hopped on top of the nearest building and watched Rika as she took out her phone and began calling the boys and Reddmon, even calling ahead to Guilmon so they wouldn’t surprise him.

When they arrived Reddmon was already there, talking about something to Guilmon. “Alright, alright, I won’t say anything about it.” Complained Guilmon as she and Rika walked up the path. “About what?” Asked Renamon as they stepped inside small the building Guilmon hid in. “Nothing, nothing.” Said Reddmon quickly, too quickly. He was definitely up to something and Guilmon was in on it. Renamon glanced over at Guilmon who smiled nervously and waved.

Whatever. She thought, turning to greet Henry and Terriermon who had just arrived. “So does anyone know when Orionmon will arrive?” Asked Henry, straight to the point as usual. “Yeah, he said he would be around soon.” Answered Reddmon, visibly happy for the change of subject.

The arrival of Takato was announced by a load panting as he came up the path weighed down with a huge backpack, even from this distance Renamon could smell the fresh bread. Now that his parents knew about Guilmon Takato could stop bringing only day old bread. A fact that Guilmon had celebrated for a week non-stop.

“Why in the world did you bring all that? We’re only going for one day.” Said Rika motioning towards the bag. Takato laughed, “This is going to be an awesome show, we’ll probably want something to eat. And if it’s anything like the real world the food will be way too expensive.” Renamon had to give him that one. Food at events like this was usually triple or more than at other places.

A few minutes later Orionmon walked from a bush. What he was doing there she had no idea. ”So everyone ready?” He asked, looking around at the group. Everyone nodded so he created a portal in front of them and waited for them to enter.

After the familiar feeling of weightlessness they landed in a seemingly empty wasteland. “Great just like old times! Orionmon, did you get us los…” Rika trailed off as she turned to yell at the massive rookie. Her jaw had dropped, she was looking at something behind them, Renamon and the others followed Rika’s gaze to see what she was staring at. When she saw the spectacle Renamon had to admit it was impressive, behind Orionmon stood an absolutely huge building that resembled the ancient Roman Coliseum. “Welcome to Etemon’s arena.” He said with a chuckle as he turned and began walking towards it.

Renamon and the others jogged to catch up and Terriermon was the first to ask what everyone was thinking. “So what’s with the architecture?” Orionmon shrugged. “Like every Etemon I ever met he has an ego the size of a small country. I guess the roman motif is because he sees himself as Caesar, you know a great conqueror and such.” Renamon frowned, “Sounds like a jerk, will we have to meet him in person?” Orionmon stopped at the huge pair of doors and knocked, “No, no, I’ll take care of that and get back to you when I have what we need.”

The large pair of doors ponderously swung inwards, revealing a cavernous foyer filled with digimon. Some in groups, some by themselves, mainly champion level but several rookies could be spotted in the mix. “Come on, we’d better sign in.” Said Orionmon pointing towards a Gekomon behind a small reception desk.

As they walked across the tiled floor Renamon noticed that most of the Digimon were watching them semi-surreptitiously, probably trying to gauge their strength. She was doing the exact same thing herself and by the looks of things they might have a tough fight. Renamon smiled to herself, this was going to be fun for sure.

“Ahh, Reddmon, Orionmon glad to thee you here. And you brought guesths.” Said the Gekomon with a pronounced lisp. “Good morning, Reddmon and I are signing in and we also have three other combatants, Guilmon, Terriermon and Renamon, they’ll be participating in their champion forms. Also can we have three guest seats?” Orionmon took out some digital currency and gave it to the Gekomon, who quickly counted it and typed something into the computer on his desk.

After a few seconds several slips of paper slid out of an attached printer. The Gekomon examined them for a second then handed one to each of the Digimon. “Thish ith the number that will be called when itsth your turn to fight. You’ll be thiting in the stands ‘till then, enjoy and good luck.” Orionmon nodded his thanks and walked towards a flight of stairs set into the wall. Reddmon followed as did everyone else, when they got to the top Renamon was again stunned, not an easy thing considering the things they had been through. Although from the outside the building looked old and weathered the inside was a stark contrast. Concentric circles of plush chairs and stands sat around a deep pit lined with a mirrored metallic substance, giving a very futuristic feel.

Several digimon were already sitting down either in pairs, large groups or alone. Orionmon led them over to an area at the front that no one was sitting in and lowered himself into a seat. Reddmon motioned for everyone to take a seat then sat down next to Renamon and Rika. Renamon and Rika leaned forward taking a look at the arena, it was several metres deep and a good thirty or forty wide, plenty of room for fighting, with little chance of attacks straying into the crowd.

“A bit empty isn’t it.” Said Terriermon, pointing at the pit. Renamon had to agree, a digimon who specialized in long range attacks would be able to stand against the wall and just shoot at his opponent, completely avoiding attacks. “The terrain stays hidden until the match and is changed between each, you know using data storage or whatever.” Said Reddmon as he looked around at the digimon already sitting down. “What do you reckon Orionmon, sense anyone really strong?” Orionmon nodded, “Yeah one or two, this should be fun. Especially with you all here. Means we have someone to cheer for.”

Orionmon cleared his throat and turned to them. “So, I guess I should tell you all the rules. First off the contestants wait up here until the number they were allocated appears on those screens.” He pointed to a set of large TV’s that were mounted on the upper walls, just above where the crowd would sit. “Then they make their way down to the doors of the arena,” He pointed down to a pair of arches covered with iron grates. “Just before you enter a new battlefield will be digitally generated. They are pretty varied, I’ve seen flat plains, a block from a city, lush forests and more. Next step is to find and fight you opponent in the arena, keep fighting till he either gives up or is unconscious. As I said before deleting your opponent is prohibited. Oh, and besides getting outside help or digivolvling past champion, anything goes.”

“Don’t forget, the whole thing is worked out in a elimination system, last digimon wins.” Noted Reddmon. Renamon rubbed her chin. “How long is the break between matches?” Reddmon grinned happily “Thought you might be the one to ask that. As long as it takes for the last digimon to leave, or be removed from the arena.” He chuckled at that last bit. “So it’s going to end up being a contest of strength and endurance.” She sighed, if they took too much damage in the previous bout they would be at a disadvantage in the next, and they would have shorter rest periods as they got into the semi-finals.

“Yep.” He said simply. “Oh, hey it looks like we’re about to begin.” He nodded towards the nearest entrance as a horde of digimon began pouring out and taking seats. Within minutes the whole place was bustling with movement as digimon talked animatedly about various things. Renamon was surprised at the sheer number of digimon that had come to see something that was practically a daily occurrence in the Digital world.

One of the arena grates opened and an orange figure walked out into the arena. He took a microphone from behind his back and practically yelled into it. “Welcome ladies and gents to the fifteenth Etemon champion league! I hope you’re ready for some mayhem because we'll begin without further ado.” He pointed up to one of the screens which blinked on and displayed 13 vs 45. “Numbers 13 and 45 C’mon down.” He said with a flourish and a horrible Elvis impersonation as he walked out of the arena. Renamon and the others glanced down at the slips of paper they had been given. Was one of them the first to fight?
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Morning of the tournament.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Reddmon shrugged. "Guess I'm up," he said before warping into the arena. As he landed another digimon appeared out of nowhere. It was a massive wolf-like digimon that appeared to be wearing some kind of body armor. (here's a wiki of him: http://digimon.wikia.com/wiki/Sangloupmo... )

"IIIIIIIIIIIIIiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiinnnnnn this corner we have Reddmon," Etemon announced into his microphone, "And his opponent, Sangloupmon!"


Sangloupmon:

Champion level-Virus Type

This demon-beast can move over great distances by breaking himself into data and forcing himself around by sheer will. He feeds on his enemies' data cores and leaves them to die.


"AND BEGIN!"

There was slight buzz in the air as the environment appeared. Reddmon took a quick look around and materialized a black card and an equally black Digi-vice.

"DARK DIGIVOLUTION!"

REDDMON DIGIVOLVE TO... VIRALREDDMON!

Viralreddmon's golden armor glinted against the light. "Let's get this party started!"

(Author's note: I'm assuming that the environment is bigger on the inside than the outside. Like the TARDIS in Doctor Who. )
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Reddmon vs Sangloupmon

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Everyone and their partners glanced at their slip of paper, “Nope, nope, nope.” They said one after another. “Good, that means you get to see what level the fighting is at before you’re thrown into it.” Said Orionmon looking around the arena. Renamon looked around as well but with all the movement of the cheering crowd it was difficult to spot someone standing. After a few seconds the whole arena was filled with a bright light and when it faded the shiny surface of the pit was replaced by a sandy field, with large and irregular rock formations jutting from the ground.

The grates slid up and a pair of digimon emerged, one resembled a pirate, all but his right eye hidden by his shirt and hat. A huge hook attached to one arm and a large flared cannon on the other. The opposing digimon was a rather short and rounded warrior clad in silver armour and carrying a pair of long swords in his thin, almost lanky arms.

Etemon’s boisterous voice burst from speakers somewhere above them, “The first match is gonna be kicked off by Hookmon and Gladimon. Warriors, on you marks 1,2,3, fight! uh, huh, huh.”

At the word fight the Hookmon raised his gun and fired a large cannonball at his opponent. Gladimon dove for cover behind a boulder, which was blown apart by the solid projectile. The sword wielding digimon dashed behind the next one, getting himself closer at the same time. Seeing that this tactic wasn’t going to work Hookmon began edging closer, firing off shots whenever he caught sight of Gladimon.

As Hookmon blasted another rock to gravel he noticed that he’d lost track of his enemy, Renamon smiled as she realised what Gladimon was planning. Sensing something Hookmon swung his cannon up and shot another iron ball through a bolder next to him, as he looked over the debris Gladimon made his move. “Sword Dancer” was called out somewhere behind him and a rock formation was suddenly sliced apart as a tornado like apparition burst through it. It was Gladimon, spinning at high speeds towards Hookmon. He’s twin blades chopping through any rocks he passed.

Hookmon fired another shot at the incoming whirlwind but Gladimon weaved aside and came in for the kill. Hookmon tried to block with his large hook, but that was knocked aside and one of Gladimons blades lashed out and drew a thin crimson line across Hookmon’s chest, ruining his jacket in the process.

Hookmon roared in anger and made a clumsy swipe with his hook, which Gladimon easily avoided, cutting Hookmon’s hook arm. Hookmon backed off, hurt but not ready to give up he fired off another shot and ducked behind a boulder. He leaned against it for a moment and inspected his wounds, from the looks of things this fight was over. The Hookmon looked up as Gladimon tapped his sword on the rock. He was standing over him, sword pointed at this head. “Surrender or suffer further injury.”

Hookmon glanced at his shoulder then nodded. “Yarr, fine I gives in.” He said grudgingly as he began walking out of the arena while Gladimon raised a sword in victory and quickly left as well.

As soon as he left the arena glowed brightly again and reappeared as a dense forest, although the canopy was rather thin so they could easily see the ground. “That was a awesome match, hope his pride heals as fast as his wounds. The next will be..... Number 1 and number 29.” Renamon glanced at her number, ”Not mine, any of you guys up.” Everyone else shook their heads. So they would get another chance to scout out the competition before they fought.

A few seconds later the grates opened and a digimon appeared, he had shaggy brown covering his body with a pair of strong looking arms that almost touched the ground. “Is that a Junglemojyamon.” Breathed Henry. “I thought those where supposed to be mythical.” Renamon nodded, she had never seen one herself nor heard of any rumours of them being seen, guess this one needed the money or something. “Hold it where’s the other digimon?” Asked Takato, Renamon looked around. Takato was right, she hadn’t seen or sensed another digimon enter, was it a forfeit?

“So it’s Junglemojyamon versus Sealsdramon this time. On your marks, get set. Fight!” Yelled Etemon. “But there isn’t an opponent in the ring.” Called Rika. Renamon frowned watching Junglemojyamon closely. He seemed unsettled about something, despite having the environmental advantage.

Suddenly from the trees a figure emerged, he looked like a lizard standing erect and covered in armour that blended into its surroundings almost perfectly, the effect finished with a few attached branches. “There!” She said pointing at the attacked. The others looked just in time to see the Digimon throw off it’s camouflage and strike Junglemojyamon in the back with a fierce blow. The rare digimon silently collapsed, knocked unconscious in a single hit.

“Uhh, that was quick. Cool show an all but could’ve been more dramatic.” Muttered Etemon over his microphone. As Sealsdramon walked out of the Arena a pair of digimon clad in white cloaks bustled in and picked up Junglemojyamon, carrying him out. “Medimon. They're hired to take care of wounded at events like this.” Said Reddmon, having noticed her watching them.

“Hopefully this match will last longer. Numbers 12 and 34, step up to the plate.” The Digimon glanced at their tickets.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Someone else shows them how it's done.

choices: The warrior digimon take his turn.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
“I’m up then.” Said Renamon, standing up and starting to walk towards the staircase. “Wait up Renamon.” Called Orionmon. “Rika should go with you, to let you digivolve first. It might be difficult to do so mid match.” Rika nodded and jumped to her feet, sliding past Reddmon and running up to Renamon. They both descended the stairs by two levels, following signs marking the way.

When they got to the grate Rika pulled out her digivice and a digivolution card. A second after she swiped it Renamon felt her body overflowing with power and strength. After the traditional transformation montage Kyubimon was ready for battle. “Rika do you want to go back to the stands to watch?” Rika smiled and began running from the small tunnel. “Put on a good show O.K.” She called after herself. “Always.” Kyubimon replied softly.

There was a now familiar burst of light from the grate and when it faded a small grouping of islands set in a emerald lake was in the place of the previous battlefield. Kyubimon stepped closer and the gate slid up into an alcove. As Kyubimon walked out onto the stony outcropping that was attached to her gate she was shocked, well surprised at least to see a familiar looking Clockmon walk out of the opposing gate.

“Wow, Kyubimon! It’s wonderful to see you, it’s great to see you, well it’s alright.” Yes it was definitely the Clockmon they’d met last time they were here in the digital world. He looked vaguely like a medieval executioner wielding a mallet and attached at the waist to a clock with arms and legs, a single eye showing through a broken section on its face.

“Just because we know each other doesn’t mean I’m going to go easy on you.” Chuckled Clockmon, hefting his hammer. “Quit yer' yappen’ an’ get ta' slappen’! fight!” Bellowed Etemon, signaling the match to start.

Kyubimon decided to end this as quickly as possible so she went straight to her strongest attack. She leapt in the air and spun vertically, building up heat and energy “Dragon wheel.” She yelled, releasing the energy in a serpentine torrent that rushed towards Clockmon, forming the open maw of a dragon. The attack was dead on, but as it was about to wash over Clockmon he suddenly disappeared. One moment he was there the next, gone. Not even with the fading effect she and Reddmon made.

“How did he do that?” Kyubimon muttered, looking around for him. A second later she noticed a shadow growing below her and instinctively jumped back just as Clockmon slammed into the island she was on, cracking it in half with his hammer.

She had no idea where he'd come from but Kyubimon pounced forward anyway, knocking him from his feet and landing on an undamaged chunk of rock. As she turned Clockmon picked himself up, yanking his weapon from the stone and smiled as much as his stitched mouth would let him. Kyubimon wasn’t sure how he dodged her first attack but she needed to keep on the offensive.

She gathered more energy to her tails, the flames of which flared brighter. “Foxtail inferno!.” She cried, unleashing several flaming projectiles at him. Before any of the attacks came close he disappeared again, Kyubimon didn’t even have time to look round, she only felt the heavy mallet hit her in the back on the head. Dazed but still coordinated enough to react, she clamped her jaws around his arm and tossed him across the water, he skipped against the surface once then hit the edge of an island with a clank of metal denting. He clung to the island and pulled himself up. In the throw he had dropped his hammer somewhere, which gave her a massive advantage.

Clockmon glanced around, probably looking for his weapon. Kyubimon took this chance and gathered power into her tails again, launching another set of shots at him. Clockmon noticed the movement at the last second, raising sets of arms to try and protect himself. But that didn’t stop him from being wreathed in blue flames, he thrashed about he fell back into the water.

Suddenly a pair of Medimon burst from the darkness of the gate and dove into the water, resurfacing a moment later with the unconscious form of Clockmon, who had passed out as he fell. “And Kyubimon wins. A solid fight, some good maneuvering. But on to the next round, 11 and 44 get down here.” Called Etemon, not even giving her time to leave the arena.

Kyubimon finally got out and de-digivolved back into Renamon then teleported up to their seats. Renamon ignored the squeals of fright her sudden appearance caused from those sitting near them and noticed that Henry and Terriermon where missing. “Was that their number called out?” Reddmon nodded and she sat down in her seat between him and Rika. “Good job.” They said in perfect unison, Renamon laughed as they looked at each other, their cheeks slightly reddened.

“Hey guys, Gargomon’s on the field.“ Called Guilmon pointing a claw down at the arena. Indeed the large gun bunny was standing in the pit, which now took the form of a city block, as Orionmon had described. Everyone looked to the other entrance as they heard a clanking sound, like metal slapping and scraping against rock.

As the din grew louder a tank like digimon trundled into the arena. His treads against the concrete the source of the noise. He was extremely bizarre looking. Painted a dull green, his head formed the tanks turret while his arms ended in mean looking machine guns.

“This match is between Gargomon and Tankmon, let the bullets fly!” Announced Etemon gleefully. The Tankmon pointed his cannon at Gargmon and with a thunderous blast a large warhead rocketed from his nose. Gargomon rolled to the side as the shell flew at him, missing by centimetres. The wayward shot slammed into the side of a building and detonated, the ensuing explosion caused the structure to topple over, crashing to the pavement.

Tankmon kept rumbling along, scanning the buildings and alleyways. As she scanned as well Renamon caught a glimpse of green through a window. It seemed like Gargomon had realized he couldn’t win in a straight up fire fight. Which meant he had a plan up his sleeve or at least he was working on one.

Gargomon edged slowly from behind a building. He had gotten behind Tankmon, who had just reached the wreckage of the building. Gargomon stooped down and picked up a small chunk of rubble, tossing it at a far off building then stepping back into the shadows.

Tankmon slowly wheeled around to look for the source of the noise, swinging his machine guns up. Gargomon watched this for a moment then ran down the alley he was in, disappearing from her sight.
