Tankmon kept turning round, now growling in frustration. With a shocking suddenness he began pouring tank round after tank round into the buildings, strafing everything with his arm mounted guns. The Arena quickly began filling with smoke and The others began coughing from the dust. Suddenly through the loud whine of the gunfire came a series of louder shots and both abruptly stopped. As the dust settled Gargomon appeared, standing behind Tankmon who had several bullet holes in his tracks, as well as his guns being shot apart. The military digimon tried to turn towards Gargomon but he couldn’t seem to move or pivot, only producing a grinding noise.

“Looks like this is over, Gargomon wins. Let's hope the rest of the matches are this destructive.” Yelled Etemon. Gargomon waved to the cheering crowd then walked out while a large group of Medimon rushed in and dragged Tankmon out the other exit. "Hopefully they have a good mechanic here." She chuckled to herself. Etemon called out the next numbers “6 and 31, get you’re buts down here and your gloves up.”

Again the digimon checked their numbers, although only Guilmon, Reddmon and Orionmon where left to fight in the first round.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Renamon's turn.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
“Alright, seems that my opponent is waiting.” Said Orionmon as he stood up, Renamon pulled her legs in slightly to make room for him when he walked past. But he just fell downwards, having opened a hole under himself.
“Show off.” Muttered Reddmon glancing at the hole as it closed in on itself. Renamon smirked and elbowed him gently in the ribs.
“Your furiously trying to think of some more flamboyant way of entering, aren’t you?”

Reddmon gave her a funny look for a second then smiled broadly.
“Ha, ya got me. I’m leaning towards of some sort of explosive. You know, enter with a bang?” Renamon shook her head at that horrible pun then peered down into the arena which had gone through it’s change already. The paved streets now replaced by a sandy beach, complete with white crested waves on one side and a dense forest of palm trees on the other. It was all very beautiful and a strange place to fight but what confused her was, where were the waves coming from? They just seemed to appear from the arena wall.

Renamon’s wondering was cut short when the grates slid open. Orionmon stepped out of one while a large armour plated dinosaur stomped from the other. The Monochromon didn’t stop moving once he had entered the ring. In fact he sped up, quickly gaining impressive momentum. “Hey I didn’t say start…. aw hell, go fer your lives.” Etemon complained sullenly.

Renamon knew that while a Monochromon’s charge was horribly destructive it was relatively easy to avoid, so she was surprised when Orionmon spread his feet and braced for impact.
“What’s he doing? Isn’t he going to dodge?” Asked Renamon worriedly.
“Nah, not his style. He’s almost as head strong and stubborn as I am.” Laughed Reddmon, waving his paw casually.

The Monochromon lowered his large horn, preparing to gore Orionmon with it. But as he closed the last foot Orionmon leaned to the side, pushing down on the horn as it rushed past, putting his other hand under Monochromon’s snout and lifting. Using his opponents momentum to flip him over and hurl him into the trees, crushing a large swathe with his bulk.

Renamon and the others sat stunned as Orionmon got up and brushed himself off. Reddmon began howling with laughter.
“You should see the looks on your faces. Bet that was the last thing you were expecting huh? Heh, he‘s the only guy I know nuts enough to try that.” Said Reddmon, raising his voice to be heard over the crowd as they roared their approval.

The Monochromon didn’t seem to be quite so pleased with his rough treatment, he quickly rolled to his feet and reared back his head, launching a massive ball of fire from his maw, bellowing “Volcanic strike!” Orionmon dashed forward, running low and fast. He ducked under the projectile mid flight and slid to a halt in front of his opponent as the attack hit the ground and detonated in a brilliant flash of heat.

Before Monochromon could react Orionmon grabbed his chin and yanked him up onto his hind legs, exposing is unarmoured stomach. Before he could get his feet back on the ground Orionmon delivered a series of brutal punches that actually kept Monochromon elevated. He suddenly stopped, stepping back as Monochromon fell, raising a large cloud of sand as he hit the ground.

Monochromon groaned and tried to push himself to his feet but only fell back down with a grunt of pain. Looks like he’d had enough. “This match is over, seems like Monochromon couldn’t handle him. The next fighters are, 8 and 9.”

Orionmon stepped backwards into a hole while some Medimon retrieved Monochromon. Orionmon appeared back in front of his seat just as Guilmon practically exploded from his. “My turn, my turn, my turn!” He cried happily. Apparently it was his turn to fight. Thought Renamon, wondering if he could show his inexperience anymore obviously. Although, childish as he was he could still fight exceptionally well, so he‘d probably be fine.

Renamon and the others wished him good luck as Takato took him down to the arena gate. As they made their way down the beach disappeared, replaced with off all things a massive chessboard. The stone pieces at least three metres high and set-up, from what she knew of the game, with black one move away from cornering white in checkmate.

A few seconds later the gates slid up into their slots and Growlmon came out, having to stoop to fit in the tunnel. Judging by the way he was rubbing a claw against the top of his head he’d found out how low the ceiling was the hard way. Looking over to the other entrance Renemon smiled. A large treelike digimon walked out, his skin, well bark was a light brown. A crack in his trunk forming his mouth.

“A Woodmon, looks like Growlmon has this one in the bag. Once he finds out that Growlmon has a fire alignment he’s gonna’ fold faster than you can say digivolve.” Laughed Rika. Renamon nodded in agreement, Woodmon were famous for their fear of fire digimon. Which was well founded after all, since they where exceptionally flammable.

“So it’s Woodmon versus Growlmon. Go!” As Etemon signalled the beginning of the match. Growlmon went straight onto the offensive, extending the fins on his arms and running forward, knocking over any pieces that got in his way. Which pretty much meant any that got within arms reach.

As he approached the Woodmon ducked behind a white rook, apparently waiting for something. Whatever it was he had waited to long because Growlmon sliced through the stone structure. Missing the top of Woodmon by barley an inch. Instead of flinching the Woodmon spun and rammed his larger upper arms into Growlmon’s throat, his lower pair grabbing Growlmon’s arms.

“Branch drill!” Laughed the Woodmon, small spheres of glowing green energy began running from Growlmon to Woodmon. Growlmon tried thrashing but the grip on him was too strong so he angled his head downwards facing Woodmon. “Pyro blaster!” He yelled, bright flames bursting from his mouth.

At the last second Woodmon swung his arms up, hitting Growlmon’s muzzle and diverting the torrent of flames. Visibly frightened the Woodmon backed off, raising his arms in surrender. “I knew this would happen first match. I give!” He said turning and running as fast as he could towards the exit.

Growlmon watched him run to his gate and pound against it, yelling to be let out. He shrugged and walked to he own as the crowd began booing. “It started off well but that was a let down. Growlmon wins.” Declared Etemon, “And the next numbers are 4 and 25” he finished as the gate opened and the contestants walked out.

Is it finally Reddmon's turn?
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: The warrior digimon take his turn.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âTook their time, I thought they might have forgotten about me.â Joked Reddmon, getting up and vaulting over the wall, teleporting out of sight midair. As he disappeared the arena flashed white, the previous battlefield being replaced with a grassy field, an old stone house sitting atop a small hill, a quaint scene to say the least.
          Again Renamon was bemused by the way the grass blew in a wind she couldnât feel, creating a beautiful wave effect. âHey, was it Reddmonâs turn to fight?â Asked Takato, who had just returned with Guilmon. Renamon let them get to their seats then nodded to Guilmon âYouâd better be more careful next time. You only won because all Woodmon are pyrophobics.â
         Guilmon cocked his head and looked at her. âPyrowhatics?â He asked. Ugh, mental note, get Guilmon a dictionary for Christmas. On second thought, he might just eat it. She thought, rubbing her eyes in frustration. Henry thankfully answered for her with a lot more patience than she could have mustered. âIt means they fear fire, so when he saw your pyro blaster attack he was terrified and forfeited.â
         âOh, rightâ¦.. Yay I got lucky.â Exclaimed Guilmon happily. Renamon shook her head and looked back to the field just as Reddmon and another digimon stepped out of their alcoves. Reddmonâs adversary was what looked similar a Gaomon, but instead of his signature boxing gloves he had a pair of metallic and futuristic looking gauntlets that had bundles of cables leading to a vest that matched his gloves, except that it had flat black panels of the back of it.
         âSo this match is Reddmon vs Heliogaomon.â Shouted Etemon, apparently having run out of âwittyâ remarks. At Etemon's announcement Heliogaomon looked up suddenly then tensed visible, his lips pulling away from his sharp canines, his hackles rasing. âWhatâs up with him?â Asked Rika, having noticed the agitated state the blue digimon was in.
         Currently, because of a hill between them the digimon couldnât see each other. But Reddmon teleported to the top of the hill only to duck down a moment later as a beam of incandescent light shot past him. âYou! I finally found you! Lambent shot!â He yelled vehemently, firing off another pair of beams from the palms of his gloves, the panels on his back now glowing bright yellow.
         âSolar panels? Well that explains the name I guess.â Muttered Henry, almost to himself.
         âWhat do you mean?â Asked Renamon, watching as Reddmon dodged around another beam which etched a dark line across the hillside.
         âWell helio means sunlight so this digimon uses light based attacks and the black panels on his back gather energy. Pretty much giving him infinite power as long as the suns out.â
         The wolf like digimon was advancing on Reddmon now, still firing his attacks off with wild fury. With the speed the shots travelled Reddmon was struggling to keep himself from being fried, already Renamon could spot a couple of singe marks on his fur.

          Damn this sucks! Thought Reddmon, dodging a pair of beams that passed by either side of him, they travelled way too fast to watch, he had to guess their trajectory by the guyâs movements alone.
         He needed find out what his problem was, he seemed seriously peeved off to say the least. Reddmon rolled under another blast of light then dashed towards him, teleporting to the side to avoid another attack, as a third came at him he jumped over it, flying towards Heliogaomon, ready to tackle him. Heliogaomon raised his hands, the palms of which had large glowing circles on them, Reddmon noticed them pulse slightly then the light suddenly intensified. Reddmon was sure this meant he was about to fire so he teleported behind him and grabbed both of his arms, pushing him to the ground, using his size and weight for leverage.
         âWhatâs your problem kid? Those attacks were aimed to maim and kill.â He whispered into his captiveâs ear, keeping a firm grip on his arms.
          âWhat! You donât even remember?â He cried angrily âIâm gonna annihilate you for what you did!â As he vehemently spat that last part the panels on his back began glowing as well âSolar flash!â He yelled, a blinding light bursting from his back and arms.
         Reddmon pushed himself to his feet and stumbled backwards, he couldnât see a blasted thing, only a after image of those panels blocking his vision.
         âIâm going to make you sorry that you took one step into my village.â Said a voice from somewhere to his left. Reddmon spun in that direction only to have a fist slam into his muzzle from his right. Reddmon was sent tumbling to the ground, his face throbbing dully. Hearing a low buzzing he rolled himself to the side, feeling a blast of heat as another attack flew by.
         Reddmon looked up to see that his vision had cleared somewhat, everything was still blurry but he could make out the building that stood on the hill. He Jumped up and teleported behind it, out of sight of his enemy. Breathing hard Reddmon rubbed his eyeâs and blinked rapidly, trying to clear up his sight a bit quicker.

          âThatâs right, hide you coward. Iâll find you and rip your cold, black heart out!â

          Reddmon couldnât take him head on, he had way to much firepower, and probably another trick or two up those shiny sleaves of his.
         âWell Iâve got one or two as well.â Muttered Reddmon creating an energy ball in one paw. Steadying it with the other he began pumping more power into it, causing it to swell in size like a balloon. Strangely enough it also gained a bit of weight so when he felt it was ready he really had to put his back into it to lob it over the building and hopefully towards the middle of the arena.
         Reddmon pushed himself flat against the wall and covered his ears, readying for the blast, which certainly didnât disappoint.

*BOOOOM*

          Reddmon chuckled as a wave of orange light washed past him. Orionmon had been right manipulating his attacks statistics was pretty effective. âMaybe I overdid it a bit?â He muttered as he looked around the corner of the building, his eyes having readjusted enough to take in the damage heâd done.
         Most of the arena had been reduced to scorched earth, only that which was obstructed by the building and hills was left uncharred.
          âHold it. Where did he go?â Reddmon couldnât see Heliogaomon anywhere. Surely he didnât hit him dead on.

          âNot satisfied till youâve killed the last one, ehâ

         Reddmon span to see Heliogaomon holding himself up against the wall with one paw, the other was aimed at him, specifically his head. As he looked at the glowing circle Reddmon noticed that his opponents arm was shaking slightly, seems like he was tiring or injured from the blast.
          âFor the last time I donât know what your talking about. Youâve got me mixed up with someone else.â Reddmon said truthfully.
          Heilogaomon barked a course laugh then moved with surprising speed, rushing forward and grabbing Reddmon by the throat. âFour years ago you attacked my village and razed it to the ground, killing all but me. I will never forget you from that night, everything from you eyes to your scent is burned into my memory and I will never forgive you.â
          The doglike digimon raised his other paw in front of Reddmonâs face and began putting apparently huge quantities of energy into it. Reddmon grabbed the arm holding his throat and pulled, but it wouldnât budge, so he kneed Heiliogaomon in the chest, then as his grip loosened he stepped behind him and slammed a fist into his back, knocking him to the ground.
          âIâm really sorry for what happened to you, but I donât know anything about that. I didnât do it.â
          âLying basterd, Iâll kill you if it the last thing Iâ¦.Ughâ With that the vengeful thought the digimon lost consciousness and fell weakly to the grass.

          Reddmon stepped aside as a pair of medimon came by and inspected him, picking him up a moment later and carrying him off. âThat was awesome, Reddmon wins and moves onto the next round.â Announced Etemon jovially. Reddmon didn't quite share his enthusiasm, Orionmon had mentioned that he had been causing havoc before the point to which he could recall, but what Heliogaomon had described was outright murder. Was he really capable of that? After all he had beaten a few digimon up but nothing too serious.

          Reddmon slowly walked out of the arena, not particularly feelling like he should rejoin the others immediatly. If he really did that and didn't remember, what else did he do, who else did he hurt? Reddmon walked to the stairs, drawing a single claw along the stone wall as he went. He needed to talk to Orionmon about this, but not today.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Reddmon's conflict

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Renamon watched Reddmon walk out of the arena, noting a suspicious lack of goofing for the crowd. She had overheard all of what Heliogaomon had said, but she was pretty sure no one else had, mainly because they were still cheering loudly. Although at the other end of their group Orionmon was also watching Reddmon leave looking saddened by something. Maybe he knew what Heliogaomon had been talking about.
         The next contestants were called out but neither of the numbers belonged to any of them so Renamon turned her attention to the archway that Reddmon would probably appear from, that is if he didnât choose to teleport in. After a few minutes, almost double the time it took the her or others to return, Reddmon appeared from the arch, but stayed half hidden in the shadows. Something was bothering him, that much she could tell, was he feeling guilty? Was what the blue digimon said true?
         âRika, Iâm just going to have a look round for a while. Iâll be back soon.â Said Renamon, excusing herself, then got up and walked up the isle between the rows of seats.
         Reddmon was really wrapped up in whatever thoughts were bothering him, he didnât even notice her until she was practically standing next to him. He was staring vaguely towards the arena frowning about something.
         âWhatâs on your mind?â She asked as she came up next to him. He looked at her and switched on a smile, but she could tell it was only half real.
         âAh, its nuthinâ really. So is any one fighting in this match?â The question was casual but she could tell he was just trying to change the subject. She continued scrutinizing him for a few more moments, then as if reading her mind.
         âNot working huh?â He said sadly, letting the smile fade.
         âNo, not really. So will you tell me whatâs wrong?â
         â*Sigh* You know me way to well. Itâs, just something that digimon said.â
         âAbout that attack on his village four years back?â She offered.
         âSo you heard huh? I donât remember doing anything like that, but then I donât remember all that much anyway.â
         âYouâre worried you did something that will affect the way we, I, look at you?â
         Reddmon chuckled a little. âAs I said you know me way too well already.â
         Renamon kissed him lightly on the cheek and hugged him firmly. âYou know, youâre kind of cute when youâre insecure. Donât worry, remember what I told you before. Everyone has come to like you for who you are know. You've stopped causing trouble and chaos so they have nothing against you, theyâve accepted you. And we will always be there to help you. Now câmon, lets go sit down.â Reddmon let her take his paw and lead him back to the seats, sitting next to her and watching the current match come to a conclusion.

         The next few matches only got tougher as the group of fighters dwindled and the weak were eliminated, Terriermon moved on by winning a close match against the Gladimon from the first round, while Guilmon lost to a Snimon, now sporting a large bandage which covered a nasty gash across his chest.
         Shortly after, Reddmon had an intense game of cat and mouse against a Ninjamon, managing to get behind him and take him out. Then Orionmon but heads with a Nanimon, literally, he head butted him into submission receiving nothing but a small bruise on his forehead. Seemed he had a harder head than even Guilmon

Then, finally Renamonâs number was called. She walked out into the arena, which was a now a small village that wouldnât look out of place in a rural area, a gravel road formed a path between the two entrances.
         âThings are really heating up now, itâs Kyubimon fighting of against Commandramon!â Kyubimon looked down the main road, at the other end stood a digimon that resembled an Agumon, except with checked navel camouflage replacing his usual orange skin, and dressed In full combat gear, including a dangerous looking assault rifle.
         Kyubimon remembered seeing this guy fight before, he used efficient military tactics to isolate, trap and neutralise his opponent, but the Frigimon he took out last round wasnât the best fighter, heâd quickly panicked and ran headlong into an ambush.
         Kyubimon had no intention of doing likewise so as soon as Commandramon dashed into a yard she mirrored his movements and ran into one as well. He was probably going to try to hunt her so she doubled back and snuck around to where heâd entered the town.
         She quickly caught his scent and began following it, when all of a sudden the trail turned into a building, a wide open window showing his path more clearly that his smell. Kyubimon squeezed inside the mid-sized opening, finding a strange satchel sitting on a table in the middle of the room. It didnât match with anything else and it was covered with Commandramonâs scent so he must have placed it. She cautiously moved closer and looked at it. It was wrapped in brown fabric and had a small panel with a green light on it which was flashing slowly, beeping in time.
         Damn, itâs a bomb! Thought Kyubimon, her first instinct was to get out of the house as quickly as possible, but then she noticed a stubby black protrusion sticking out of the top of it. So itâs detonated remotely, maybe I could use it. She grabbed a corner with her teeth and quietly left by the window she had come in by. Knowing that if Commandramon saw her he could easily blow her head off with this thing. She cautiously sprinted across the gravel road and nudged open a window of the adjacent house, tossing the satchel inside then closing it again.
         With the trap set all she had to do was find him. Which wasnât that hard, she only had to walk down a few paths and within minutes a barrage of machinegun fire raked the wall in front of her. She faked a cry of surprise and turned tail, running back the way she came. After turning around a corner she spun and unleashed a dragon wheel at him as soon as he came around the corner. He managed to jump back out of the way of the torrent of blue flame but by the time he could swing his gun back around she had already continued running.
         A few turns later the house she had set the bomb in came to view, Kyubimon ran past it, back across the gravel road and up to the window that Commandramon had opened earlier, she then turned around to wait for him.
         It took a few seconds for him to appear, and as soon as he saw her he swung back behind the wall, as he did she swore she saw him grin. Then in a sudden wave of force the building exploded, bricks and mortar flying in all directions. Once it stopped raining chunks of rock Kyubimon cautiously walked forward to investigate. But her worries where settled when three Medimon ran out and began digging into the wreckage, dragging out the battered form of Commandramon.

         âSneaky, I like it. Kyubimon wins the match in a blast of glory.â

         Kyubimon walked out of the arena and sighed, de-digivolving to Renamon. That win had more to do with luck than wanted to admit. She walked up the stairs and sat down in her seat between Reddmon and Rika. Rika gave her a thumbs up, âGood job Renamon you beat him at his own game.â
         âYeah that was impressive.â Agreed Reddmon, smiling warmly.
         âThanks, hey, Takato can you please pass me some bread?â She caught the roll that was thrown to her a moment later. As she began eating the next match started, it was between Sealsdramon and a Wizardmon, which ended in a similar manner to Sealsdramonâs first match, with a effective stealth attack.
         Just as she brushed the last remaining crumbs from the fur on her chest Etemon declared that the second round was over and they where now in the quarterfinals, which meant a max of three fights to go, but also the chances of her fighting one of their friends increased.

Next up...
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Renamon's point of view

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âWhat? Already? Iâve barely gotten my breath back from the last match.â Moaned Renamon, getting up tiredly.
         âWell, hopefully it will be an easy one.â Said Rika also getting up and walking with her down to the arena entrance.
         As Kyubimon padded into the arena she looked around at the rocky outcroppings that thrust from virtually every surface, punctated by large crystalline formations. Seriously, who went to all the trouble of making these things. Thought Kyubimon as Etemon announced that she would be facing a digimon called Shurimon.
         Kyubimon looked over to a cave that matched the one she had entered by, in front of it stood a digimon dressed in desert ninja attire and holding a tri-bladed shuriken in each of itâs spiralled, vinelike arms and legs. Behind a matching veil glowed two yellow eyes, watching and gauging her strength as she did likewise to him, at least she wasnât fighting an amateur.
         Suddenly he disappeared in a whirlwind of leaves, which was strange because there wasnât any leaves around. Kyubimon snapped to her left as she heard a rustling sound slightly above her, rolling aside in time to avoid a pair of shuriken as they lodged themselves into the ground with two solid thunks. Kyubimon drew power into the tips of her tails as Shurimon landed lightly and leapt at her, the shuriken in his hands raised to be swung or possibly thrown. But Kyubimon didnât give him the chance, hurling several flames at him âFox Tail Inferno!â She yelled, but Shurimon just vanished in another sudden flurry of leaves, which were set alight by Kyubimonâs attack.
         There was another rustle of leaves behind her and Kyubimon only just managed to duck another spinning blade as it whirled overhead, nicking a tail and her ear. Kyubimon grunted as she felt a trickle of blood run down her head and quickly turned to her attacker. He was slowly edging towards the two shuriken which where sunk into the rock, he currently only held one more and wore a big one on his back. Kyubimon dashed forward, not wanting him to retrieve his weapons.
         She tackled him to the ground, dodging a swipe from one of the blades and pinned him down with her paws. He struggled for a moment then looked her in the eyes, disappearing as another whirlwind shrouded him, but this time she was in middle of it, and she could see smaller shuriken swept up amid the leaves.
         Dammit! She thought, as a small blade slashed across her back, it was a glancing strike, probably a warning of whatâs to come, but it still stung like crazy. She poised herself to make a break for it, but as she was about to jump Shurimon resolved from the leaves, holding the bigger shuriken with both hands.
         Before she could even dodge the large plate of metal rushed towards her face. With a dull thud like a hammer hitting wood she was knocked to the ground, and as she tried to pull herself up, her vision struggling to refocus, a blackness encroaching on the edges, she saw a pair of strange, white digimon running towards her. Just before she passed out one absurd thought ran through her fading consciousness. âReddmonâs going to laugh his head offâ
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Renamon falls.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âUgh, what hit me?â Mumbled Renamon, pushing herself to a sitting position, grimacing as her head span from the movement.
         âRenamon! Your awake.â Shouted someone nearby, it sounded like Rika.
         âPlease Rika, not so loud.â She replied looking over to the young red head, who sat on a chair beside her bed. Hold it, her bed? Renamon looked down and for the first time noticed the pristine white bed sheet laying across her waist.
         âWhere am I?â She asked, rasing a paw to scratch an itch that had risen on her ear, only to find it, and indeed half of her head wrapped in bandages.
         âYou lost and were taken here, to the medical ward for treatment.â Answered Henry, who was sitting on her other side, between another bed, on which lay Terriermon. Likewise wrapped up in bandages. Although his were mainly around the waist, and judging by the lack of blood, probably cracked ribs.
         âSo he lost too, huh? Whereâs the others.â Renamon asked, exploring the dressings further, finding a nasty sore spot above her right temple. It was slightly swollen but not too bad considering sheâd gotten hit over the head with a chunk of plate steel.
         âWell Orionmon, Takato and Guilmon are still upstairs, while Reddmonâs the one fighting at the moment.â Answered Rika, as she finished they all turned as a pounding of footsteps echoed from behind a large pair of closed doors. They suddenly burst open, kicked hard from the other side by none other than Reddmon. Who ran over and smiled warmly as soon as he saw she was awake.
         âWhat happened to you?â She asked when she noticed that he was covered in thin deep cuts.
         âKnife fight.â* He replied simply as a pair of Medimon came in behind him, carrying an unconscious Sealsdramon, who had similar cuts on him as well. Though he also sported a rather sizable dent in his helmet.
         âIâm glad to see youâre finally awake, the Medimon said youâll be fine to leave their care soon, something about a final check-up." As he said this one of the mentioned digimon walked over and asked about tending to his wounds but Reddmon politely declined, saying he would be fine.
         âSo you won then?â She asked, absently scratching at the gauze wrapped around her ear, which had began to itch like nothing else.
         Reddmon nodded and pulled up a seat sitting next to Rika. âSo how are you feeling, you took a pretty nasty hit.â She could see the hidden concern glinting in the corner of his eye.
         âIâll be better once we get out of here and back to watching the tournament, I want to see who wins or even better, who gets the best of you.â She said, looking around the relatively large room. It was just like a regular hospital, except itâs occupants where a bit more, varied, than in the human equivalent. White walls and a white tiled floor, and an overpowering smell of disinfectant.
         âSure I can handle that.â He said, turning to a passing Medimon, âDo you think my friend could be cleared to leave now.â The physician digimon nodded and set the folder he was carrying on the foot of the bed, producing a small penlight, flashing it in her eyes then holding a gloved finger up and asking her it to follow it without moving her head. Satisfied he said she could go, but warned her to take it easy and avoid fights for a day or two.
         Terriermon was still unconscious so Henry stayed behind with his partner. When they got back to their seats they noticed that Orionmon was gone, a quick glance into the arena revealed his location. He was fighting hand to hand, well, spike to sickle with the Snimon from Guilmonâs match, and by the looks of things he was coming out on top. The forest they where fighting in mostly levelled, either sliced down or smashed apart as the competitors fought.
         âHey Renamon, now we match.â Called Guilmon, waving a claw wildly as he noticed them approach, causing Takato to duck as he was nearly hit in the head.
         Renamon smiled slightly at that and sat down just as Orionmon slammed his opponant to the ground in a brutal duplex. As the Medimon came out to retrieve Snimon Orionmon disappeared and re-appeared using a portal, noticing their return.
          âAh youâve recovered enough to watch with us, sorry to see you lose. But donât worry itâs likely one of us will get to sort him out for you.â He said indicating Reddmon and himself. This match marked the last of the quarter finals, only one more round left till the finals, something which Etemon declared almost word for word. He also called out the numbers for the third last fight.

* Think RE4 Krauser vs Leon cut scene.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: One killer hangover

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âWell thatâs me.â Said Reddmon, teleporting himself to the cool, dark hallway in front of the grate barring the entrance to the arena. Which he could see through, well partially anyway, his vision was obstructed by large piles of garbage as well as various mechanical odds and ends, wrecked cars and the like. His nose stinging from the rancid smell wafting off it.
         âDammit, Iâm gonnaâ smell awful after this, probably wonât get the smell out of my fur for a week. Arg, Renamonâs not going to come within ten feet of me.â Grumbled Reddmon as he ducked under the ascending grate. Even before Etemon announced the opponents Reddmon knew he was facing off against the Shurimon from Renamonâs match, he had dedicated his number to memory.
         As soon Etemon did start the fight Reddmon ran as fast as he could around the edge of the arena, watching in between the mountains of trash. Glimpsing a flash of white and green he instantly changed from speed to stealth, hopping across random but solid objects like old washing machines and cracked bath tubs, making his way to a large and precarious hill made of car wrecks.
         He finally got a clear view of Shurimon, who seemed to have gotten lost trying to wander through the maze of rubbish. Reddmon gently eased an iron bar out from under a pile of old chairs and tossed it against at the stack opposite to him, causing a loud clattering crash. Shurimon reactively span and threw a spinning disc at the pile, slicing a large gouge into it. Reddmon smiled as the tower of detritus slowly began to topple. Making his move Reddmon used the groan of buckling metal to mask all trace of his sound, teleporting behind Shurimon and kicking him viciously in the back, knocking him to the ground, within the shadow of the falling trash.
         With another burst of foul air the heap of refuse crashed to the ground like an avalanche of moulding slime, completely covering Shurimon. Ugh, maybe that was too mean. Thought Reddmon as Shruimon dragged himself from under the rubbish, his white clothes stained with several smears of something he didnât care to identify. With an angry growl Shurimon disappeared in a swirl of leaves, with several chunks of metal and old fruit swept up in the mix.
         Expecting this Reddmon ducked as a blade of steel lashed out above his head, sweeping around he created an energy ball and thrust it at Shurimon, letting it explode at point blank range. Reddmon winced as his arm was caught in the blast but Shurimon took the full force of it and was sent flying into another pile of rubbish, caught in another tide of refuse. The Medimon appeared from nowhere and began digging for him, but Reddmon had already turned to leave, he certainly didnât envy their job.
         As he got out he wiped the new layer of soot and burnt fur from his arm, and noticed for the first time the state he was in, covered in dirt, sweaty, cuts and blood stains all over his fur, and now a smell of rotten garbage. What a lovely day it's been, all I need to do now is to go roll in a pig pen.Bracing himself for the barrage of good natured jokes Reddmon teleported back to the others.
         âOh man, did somebody just open a carton of year old milk or something, oh itâs just you Reddmon.â As he expected Terriermon was the first to take a shot.
         âYeah yeah, I stink, I know. Orionmon, you usually have something for every occasion, you got any shampoo or anything.â
         While Renamon gave Terriermon a withering glare Orionmon opened a portal and put his arm into it, rummaging around for a bit and pulling out a small pale green bottle, tossing it to him.
         âIâll try to drag my match on a bit, go here to have a wash.â He said, getting up and opening another portal in the ground in front of Reddmon, through which the sound of moving water could be heard. As Orionmon made his way to the arena Reddmon glanced down at the bottle in his paw, quickly scanning the label.
         âDog wash? Oh, real cute Orionmon.â He called sarcastically. Everyone, even Renamon and the digimon within earshot began laughing. âWhy did I say that out load.â He grumbled under his breath as he stepped into the portal and landed lightly in a small forest clearing, one side taken up by a sheer rock wall, from which a beautiful sparkling waterfall fell.
         Stepping into the pool that formed around the cascade Reddmon found it pleasantly warm, possibly from a nearby volcanic spring. Orionmon always did know some of the best places to rest or train.
         Opening the bottle he empted half of it into his paw and began lathering it up all over his body and his tails, quickly covering all his red and white fur with a thick layer of bubbles. At least the stuff had a nice strong eucalyptus scent, powerful enough to make his nose sting slightly, and effectively cover the smell of old decaying trash. Wading through the small pond he stepped under the waterfall and began rinsing himself off.
         âEnjoying the show?â He asked loudly, sensing a voyeur. Moments later Renamon dropped down from a tree, blushing deeply.
         âJust making sure you donât, um, slip or anything.â She said, now looking at anything but him. Reddmon laughed and began lathering up again, concentrating on his head this time.
         Once he had finished washing up he waded back out. Renamon had been discreetly watching him from the corner of her eye the whole time, though he would probably be doing the exact same thing if she was bathing.
         âNow how am I going to get dry before I start stinking of wet fur?â He asked rhetorically, materialising a pair of water balloons behind his back. âHey whatâs that?â He said, nodding behind Renamon.
         âWhatâs what?â She asked, turning and looking into the undergrowth. Looking back just in time to take a balloon to the muzzle and chest. Not particularly phased, but thoroughly soaked Renamon just wiped the excess water from her face.
         âThanks Reddmon. Now weâre both going to smell like drowned rats.â Reddmon chuckled and threw her a towel he had just metallised as he began to dry himself off.
         They were both quickly dry and Reddmon no longer smelled like he had just taken a nap in a dumpster.
         âCâmon lets go back, Orionmon has probably beaten his opponent to a pulp by now.â Said Renamon, leading the way back to where the portal still hung a metre or so off the ground. They both jumped up through it landing back into the testosterone rich atmosphere of the arena. As soon as they arrived there was a cheer as Orionmon picked his opponent up, the Starmon that had beaten Terriermon, and threw him through a rock formation, similar to the first matchâs environment. Battered and bloodied the Starmon was carried off by the Medimon while Orionmon walked out.
         âAnd that ladies and gentlemon is the last round of the semi-finals, will Reddmon please come to the field so we can watch you fight for our entertainment.â Called Etemon, apparently going for something that vaguely resembled irony.
         Reddmon teleported himself back to the arena entrance and began stretching for what he anticipated to be the most fun fight so far, although the bath he just had was pretty relaxing so he probably had a slight advantage, what with Orionmon getting no such break. Still he was likely to put up one hell of a fight. The arena flashed brightly again, momentarily blinding him, and when it reappeared it was a...
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: an odorous battle.

choices: Orionmon was wrong, a force of digimon attacks.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Rika watched as both digimon walked out into the arena, which was just a flat dirt field with a large white circle painted on it. They stepped up to a pair of lines just inside the ring, waiting for the signal to start. She was pretty sure they were both totally insane, but Renamon had a thing for Reddmon and Orionmon was friendly enough, having acquired a few odds and ends she wouldnât have been able to get otherwise, so if she could cope with Takato and his goggle head friends then she could handle these two.
         Reddmon and Orionmon visibly tensed as they took up fighting stances, games faces on as Etemon began speaking.
         âAnd so we have it, after some amazing fights only Reddmon and Orionmon stand, but now we get to see which one takes the prize this time.â As soon as he finished his sentence both combatants launched themselves forward, racing towards each other. But Reddmon moved faster and he threw a flying roundhouse kick at him before Orionmon had covered even a third of the original distance between them.
         Orionmon was ready for it and easily brushed the blow aside, slamming his open palm into Reddmonâs chest in return. A strike that sent Reddmon sailing backwards.
         He recovered easily and landed on his feet and paws several metres back, immediately rolling to the right as a spear of fire bored into the ground where he had been standing . Orionmon kept up the attack, launching one fiery projectile after another. Reddmon ducked and weaved, stepping around each one, several came within inches but none finding their mark.
         Then suddenly he disappeared. Reappearing a moment later behind and above Orionmon, holding a ball of crackling energy in his paw. He tossed it at Orionmonâs back before the bulky digimon could turn round. But only inches before it made contact a hole appeared and the sphere and flew into it. Another hole came into existence next to Reddmonâs leg and Orionmonâs hand shot out of it and took hold of him. Orionmon pulled hard and simultaneously made the hole bigger, yanking Reddmon though it and tossing him bodily across the arena.
         As he sailed through the air Reddmon turned and formed another pair of energy balls, hurling them in a pair of identical arcs towards Orionmon, who smiled and braced for impact. But instead of hitting him they collided right in front of the digital warrior and exploded with a thunderous blast that engulfed both him and half the arena in a cloud of thick black smoke.
         Reddmon landed again and dashed into the smoke, the sounds of heavy impacts and grunts of pain issued from within. After a few moments the concealing cloud cleared enough to reveal Reddmon and Orionmon, both locked together, each holding one of the others wrists. It was a battle of pure strength and Orionmon had the clear advantage, he shifted his stance and began to push downward and forward.
         Orionmon changed his grip and looked like he was about to finish it when Reddmon disappeared again, leaving Orionmon stumbling forward. Off balance and unable to block as Reddmon appeared behind him and unleashed a withering volley of smaller energy balls, quickly wreathing Orionmon in yet another cloud of thick acrid smoke. He was completely hidden by the smoke but Reddmon just started scattering the shots slightly to ensure an impact.
         Suddenly the form of Orionmon appeared several metres above Reddmon, the portal he had appeared from closed in on itself as he began falling. As he gained velocity he raised his arms above his head, his arms then body became wreathed in fire and he yelled âINFERNUS AXE!â at the top of his lungs.
         At the sound of Orionmonâs voice Reddmon snapped up and leapt backwards out of the way, a second before impact. A massive pillar of fire exploded from Orionmon with enough force to send Reddmon slamming against the arena wall. Everyone watching the fight was forced to shield themselves as a blistering heat washed over them.
         The blaze suddenly abated revealing a panting Orionmon, he grinned widely and slowly walked from the charred crater he had created and stood with his arms across his chest. Reddmon pushed himself from the wall, revealing a Reddmon shaped outline against it, he laughed boisterously and brushed the soot and singed fur from himself.
         In a sudden blur of motion he was in front of Orionmon standing on his paws. He must have gotten weary from the fight because the warrior digimon didnât get his arms up in time and took several kicks to his chin and torso. He stumbled backwards and regained his balance only to have Reddmon teleport behind him and land a solid kick at the back of Orionmonâs leg, forcing him to his knees. As he fell Orionmon made one last gesture of defiance, spinning around, his now extended spike flaming and yelled âBLAZING SLASH!â Sending a horizontal wave of fire towards Reddmon, who dodged under it with a backflip. Orionmon fell clumsily on his back, panting heavily while Reddmon stood back up. After a few seconds Orionmon didnât get up, so apparently Etemon decided to call it.
         âThe victor and tournament winner is, Reddmon!â An uproarious cheer was raised from the crowd as they clapped and hollered and generally made a lot of noise. Reddmon walked over to his fallen opponent and crouched next to him saying something then helping him stand. The Pair then limped across the arena and out through the door Reddmon had entered by.
         âThanks for coming to this yearâs Etemon grand cup, light class. Hope you come for the heavy weight in a few months.â The digimon began to mill out of the stadium, talking about this and that. As they did Reddmon and Henry, with Terriermon came out of the stairway and began wading through the crowd.
         As he finally made it over to their seats Guilmon and Takato rushed over and began chattering away about Reddmonâs fight, filling Terriermon and Henry in on what had happened while they where in the infirmary.
         âHey Reddmon, whereâs Orionmon? We need him to get us home remember.â Noted Rika, cutting through the excited jabbering of the boys.
         âOh yeah, heâs dealing with Etemon now, he said we should just wait around for a bit.â
         âHe better get that information about Cyberdramon, I donât want this to have been a total waste of time.â She said, turning to look at the arena, which had reverted back to itâs shiny metallic state.
         âDonât worry about her, sheâs just upset because I didnât win.â Whispered Renamon. Rika had about a hundred come backs to that, but she let it slide, mainly because Renamon was right.
         They all sat round and talked for a while, waiting for Orionmon to arrive when there was a monstrous explosion on the other side of the arena, everyone leapt to their feet as a large portion of the walls fell in on itself. From the smoke several Commandramon and Sealsdramon emerged, sweeping the area with their guns, looking for targets.
         With a shout one of the invaders noticed them and began firing, the seats and walls around them breaking into chunks as everyone ducked for cover.
         âWhatâs going on?â Yelled Takato over the clatter of gunfire.
         âLike I know goggle head, just keep your head down before you get hit.â Rika snapped back.
         âUgh, good adviceâ Said Orionmon as he appeared from a hole and landed on his chest with a thump, Rika noticed that in his right hand he clutched a thick manila folder.
         âCâmon man get us out of here.â Urged Reddmon as a fresh barrage of gunfire racked the chairs next to them, spraying them all with white foam.
         Orionmon complied, quickly forming a small portal which he indicated they should crawl through. Rika waited as the boys crawled through then let Renamon go after them, quickly shuffling through herself.
         With a solid thump they landed on the grassy hill that Orionmon had dropped them off at last time. Brushing her self off Rika stood up and glared at Orionmon.
         âWhat was all that about?â She demanded, they could have been killed, and she at least wanted to know why.
         âYeah, Iâd like to know as well. You came way too quickly for that to have been unrelated.â Said Henry as Terriermon climbed back onto his shoulders.
         Shrugging Orionmon dropped the files he was holding into a hole that appeared in front of him. âNot entirely sure yet, but I do know they were sent by the same people who altered Cyberdramonâs coding to make him become fixated on Reddmon. Iâll need a day or two to find out more, but as far as I know they wonât be able to enter the real world. Yamaki dealt with that.â
         âYouâve been talking to Yamaki?â Asked Takato, who seemed to get along best with the creep. Rika hadnât trusted him an ounce since the day theyâd met.
         âYeah, smart guy but not exactly polite, almost condescending really.â Rika smiled at the digimonâs words, another brownie point for him.
         âSo you gonnaâ let me read those files then?â Asked Reddmon casually.
         Orionmon shook his head. âNo real point, most of itâs just raw info and half of itâs incomplete, as I said Iâll have it all organized soon, so Iâm going to head off.â He said, waving and turning to step into a new portal. âOh, by the way. Reddmon do you want me to get you something in return for your prize money?â
         Reddmon scratched his head and went through some sort of mental checklist.
         âMight as well get me some hardware, Iâm running short of the usual stuff, and maybe anything else that you think would catch my eye.â
         âRight, Iâll try to get all that as soon as possible. See you later everyone, hope you enjoyed yourself today.â He said, disappearing as usual. After a few moments everyone said good bye and walked off to their respective homes, leaving Renamon and Rika alone.
         âSo what do you think Renamon, we havenât been in it this deep since the D-Reaper incident.â Asked Rika as she began walking in the general direction of their house. Renamon followed close behind still visibly unnerved by the sudden attack, probably expecting another despite Orionmonâs assurance that it was unlikely.
         âIâm not sure this isnât as big as the D-Reaper, but whoever wantâs Reddmon obviously has some impressive resources to throw around. And I guess I wantâ¦. I want to protect him.â
         âSoftie.â She chuckled as they turned onto the road that lead directly home.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Grand final.

choices: Then again it's probably better to get this lot sorted out.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Reddmon woke up the next morning stiff as hell, that tournament had been great fun, especially with Renamon and the others there, but he had taken a thorough beating. He tenderly touched his chest, exploring a huge bruise where Orionmon had thumped him. Luckily his thick chest fur hid the darkened patch so nobody would be the wiser.
         Pushing himself up Reddmon groaned as his shoulder throbbed dully. Rubbing his aching muscles he walked into the kitchen, opened the fridge and took out a few spare bread rolls that Takato had given him.
         As he chewed on them he sat down at the kitchen table and materialized his record player and CD’s. Searching through them he found one of interest, then after turning it on he got up and retrieved some butter for the bread, spreading it on them as he listened.
         Reddmon planned to ask Renamon out on a date this evening so he wanted to practice a bit before he went out and begin planning the night in detail. Which he was determined to make as romantic as possible.

         A few hours later he had indeed gotten several great ideas and was feeling rather pleased with himself, but the sun had gone down so it was almost time to get going. Before he left he went through a mental checklist, sort of “feeling” any objects he had stored to make sure he grabbed what he wanted when he needed it.
         “Right here goes nothing.” He muttered walking out the front door and closing it behind him. A short trip later he was looking over the Nonaka’s place.Â On one side of the well groomed garden there was a tree across a pond, from which he planed to “lure” out his “prey”. Since he was going to use music that was the best place, as it was near Rika’s bedroom yet the rooms in which her grandmother and mother slept where both rather far away.
         Renamon would probably sense him soon so he had to act fast. Teleporting into the tree he sat down on a relatively unobstructed branch and materialised a pair of lanterns with paper shrouds, lighting the candle in each and hanging them on either side of him, so that he was softly illuminated with a warm, orange light.
         Satisfied Reddmon created his instruments of choice, a pair of spheres humming with energy, after doing a quick tune up as quietly as he could Reddmon began playing one of the songs he had taught himself, loud enough for someone nearby to hear but soft enough for anyone else to dismiss it as a radio or something of the like.
         Almost immediately after he started light in Rika’s (and presumably Renamon’s) room blinked on, casting a pair of shadows against the sliding rice paper door. It slid open to reveal a bemused Renamon and a groggy looking Rika. Renamon whispered something to her partner who whispered something back, smiled then disappeared back inside.
         Renamon stepped outside and quietly slid the door closed behind her. The light inside was extinguished a moment later. Reddmon changed his tune as she walked around the pool and jumped up to sit next to him.
         “So that’s what you warned Guilmon not to talk about, hmm?” She said, laughing softly as she watched him and the spheres. “C’mon I know a much quieter place.” Reddmon had looked throughout the day but didn’t find anything suitable so he nodded and followed her as she leapt from the tree and began travelling downtown. Reddmon followed, jumping from lamppost to lamppost, following close behind.
         She quickly reached the forest but didn’t slow down until they passed a old dilapidated house.
“Hey Renamon you heading anywhere in particular?” He called as he ran across the shack’s veranda, noticing the smell of old rotten wood and dead animals.
         “Don’t worry it’s nearby, I just use this place as reference.” She jumped back into the cover of the trees and he put on a bit more speed to keep up, he was about to ask how she found this place when she abruptly stopped, standing on a thick branch, waiting for him to catch up.
         As he came up next to her he chuckled at Renamon’s sense of romance. The tree they stood in was the last for quite a while, mainly because it stood on the edge of a sharp cliff. The moon had emerged from behind the horizon and was reflecting off the expansive field of green below them, which swayed gently in a breeze, an ocean of movement and life.
         “Nice. So you must wander around a lot?” He asked as he created another pair of energy balls, picking one of the slower more melodic tunes he had picked up.
         “Yes, after we dealt with D-reaper and managed to get back to this world things have been a bit slow. Besides it pays to know ones surroundings down to the last detail. Anyway, I’m surprised something so destructive could make such a beautiful sound.”
         “You talking about me or these.” He joked nodding to the pulsing balls of power.
         “It’s seems like you’ve gone to a fair bit of effort to impress me.” She chuckled creating a paw full of diamond shards and lifting them aloft with a smooth gesture. Reddmon watched entranced as they floated up in front of the night’s radiant moon, glittering as they began slowly spinning.
         “Seems like I’m not the only one who’s been pursuing artistic hobbies.” Chuckled Reddmon. Renamon shrugged and smiled as she began guiding the crystals in and impressive aerial ballet.
         After several minutes Renamon launched them towards the moon and watched them reach the top of their arc then slowly fall, diving into the trees below.
         “What do you think the chances are that you just killed someone.” Noted Reddmon, surprised by Renamon’s slightly careless action.
         “Oh no!” Gasped Renamon, paling slightly. “I didn’t think of that, I’ll be back in a moment.” She disappeared and Reddmon smiled, taking this chance to rematerialise the basket that held the boxed dinners he’d picked up from a nice place in town.
         “All clear, thank goodness. Oh, thanks.” Reported Renamon as she reappeared on the branch and took the offered meal.
         As they ate they began talking about various subjects, including what they wanted from life and what they thought their purpose in said life was. Reddmon was surprised to hear that until relatively recently Renamon’s only goal was to become the strongest and to digivolve to as high a level as she could, much like himself really. But due to meeting Rika, initially a means to an end, she slowly become protective of her new friends, and now Reddmon.
         “Ahem! Er, shall we go home then?” Asked Reddmon with a cough, slightly pleased yet simultaneously unnerved by Renamon’s similarities and differences to himself.
         “Might as well, do you mind if I stay with you tonight.” She asked, smiling at him somewhat coyly.
         “Sure, c’mon.” He flipped down to the ground and took off at a run, following their scent from earlier.
         “What’s the rush? Why don’t we just walk for a while.” Reddmon jinked aside as Renamon whispered into his ear, he expected her to be close but not right next to him. Sliding to a halt he let Renamon pull up next to him.
         They began walking at a more relaxing pace and Renamon took them off the path they’d come by, though she assured him that they would get home before midnight. As they walked they began talking again idly moving from around in a lazy route between the trees. At one point Reddmon materialized an army knife he had gotten somewhere, he didn’t quite remember who he’d took it from but it had a nice vicious look to it. Tossing it into the air and catching it by the opposite end. They eventually heard the sound of running water, which as it was on their way turned out to be the very waterfall Reddmon had bathed in the other day, which disturbed Reddmon that Orionmon seemed to have the whole area scouted out so well.
         Shortly after they passed the waterfall Reddmon began tossing the knife into trees along their path, being well crafted it flew straight and lodged itself into the target trunk with little effort.
         “May I have a try?” Asked Renamon, who had been watching the flight of the knife as they walked.
         “Sure.” He said as he handed it to her, handle first. “Just hold it loosely in the palm of your..” *Thock* The knife embedded itself several inches into a trunk seven metres away.
         “Okay so seems like you’ve done this before.” Reddmon muttered half to himself as Renamon laughed and gave him a wonderfully enticing smile
         “You should see what I can do with a katana or some shuriken.” She chuckled, yanking the thrown blade from it’s tree.
         Deciding to make her put her money where her muzzle was Reddmon produced said weapon and passed to her. Which elected another lovely laugh, and in a blur of motion all the tree blanches in the vicinity fell to the ground in almost perfect synch.
         “Ok, that’s impressive. You do have a lot of free time don’t you.” He said as she reappeared and sheathed the sword with a sharp. *klack*
         “When you have it it’s best to do something useful with it.” She replied, offering him the sword.
         “Nah you keep it, it suits you.” True enough, the yellow of the scabbard was only a half tone darker than her fur, something that was by no means accidental.
         She smiled at him again, a look he was really beginning to enjoy. As she readjusted the strap to place the sword over her shoulder they jumped out of the thick layer of diced foliage Renamon had created and within half a hour they where back within the city limits. Managing to get themselves in a brawl with a couple of punk teenagers harassing a group of young women.
         “Well that was fun, we should patrol the streets more often.” Chuckled Renamon as she sat on the couch, resting her paws on the pommel of the her new sword. Reddmon nodded in agreement then sat down an the couch as well. It was getting late and Reddmon could tell by the way her grip was slightly loose that Renamon was as tired as he was. After a bizarre recounting of previous misadventures they’d had, both in and out of the digital world, Renamon yawned and excused herself for the night, going up to the bedroom she’d used previously.
         Reddmon smiled broadly, congratulating himself on an almost perfect evening. He fell soundly asleep wondering what he should plan for next time.

         Reddmon woke slowly the next morning, almost not registering the weight on his chest as he was about to stretch. At some point during the night Renamon had snuck down stairs and sat down next to him, laying against his chest. It was amazing she hadn’t woken him up, he was usually a light sleeper.
         Then he noticed the table. It was about one grenade shy of collapsing under the weight of the military gear that had been heaped upon it, rocket launchers, machine guns, both light and heavy, as well as many cases of various grenades. how Orionmon got it on there without waking them he would never know. Reddmon could usually get enough stuff to keep himself amused for a while, either by black market or theft methods, but Orionmon always had the best weapons, and would never let on about his source. He had asked Orionmon to get him things in the past, but this time he’d surpassed himself, it looked like he had given him more than his moneys worth, but then again he’d probably be needing most of it soon anyway.
         He was tempted to go through it and get it all sorted and stored but staying where he was at the moment was pretty tempting as well.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: An uneventfull nights sleep.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Reddmon gently eased Renamonâs body off his own, that pile of goodies was too inviting to pass up, and besides Renamon might take him for some sort of psychopath if she saw this arsenal. He began quietly inspecting things, dropping them into his other space in logical groupings, ready to be grabbed at a moments notice.
         Eventually Reddmon came across something he didnât recognize. It was a gun, that much he knew, but it was like nothing he had ever seen before, it had the basic shape of an automatic rifle, closely resembling a P90, with the exception that instead of a barrel it had a large pair of electrodes jutting from it as well as wires all over.
         âSome kind of supercharged tazer maybe?â He thought to himself, putting it somewhere near the âtopâ so he would remember to try it out later.
         Just as he put the last grenade away he heard Renamon stir then yawn.
          âWhat are you doing down there Reddmon?â
          âJust sorting through some things.â
          âRight. What do you want to do today?â She asked crouching down next to him and noticing that there was nothing besides thoughts that he could possibly be sorting through, he needed to work on his excuse and diversion making skills.
          âNot going to school to watch the kids eh? Umm. How about we get breakfast then wander around for a bit?â
          âSounds good, câmon I know a nice place to get breakfast.â True to her word Renamon took them to a quiet tea shop the she apparently frequented, where Reddmon made an utter fool of himself by breaking nearly every rule of etiquette and being retaught said rules by her.
         âSo where to now?â Asked Reddmon as he rubbed his head where the store owner had hit him with a ladle after he spilled a kettle of tea. Renamon giggled and began walking off in a seemingly random direction, but Reddmon noted that if they walked straight ahead they would eventually reach the school.
          âYouâre not used to being away from Rika for extended periods are you?â He asked as he jogged to catch up to her.
          âExperience has taught me that weird things tend to happen to the three of them, so we make sure that at least one, preferably two of us are with them most of the time. Itâs easiest when their at school because just one of us can do the job. Anyway I just want to check up on them. We donât have to stay there long.â She explained with a shrug.
          âWhat sort of weird things?â
          âWell there was this one time when an Icedevimonâ¦â She was interrupted by Reddmonâs phone ringing suddenly. Worried that the tamers might be in trouble Renamon moved in closer as Reddmon pressed the receive button and brought it to his ear.
          âHello?â
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Morning tea

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âHi Reddmon, having a nice morning?â Orionmon practically yelled into his speaker, they could both hear the sounds of gunfire raging in the background, with occasional explosions punctuating the rattle of automatic weapons.
          âUhh, good morning Orionmon, what have you gotten yourself into now?â
          âSorry, canât really explain at the moment. Meet me at my place, the portal is behind you. I should the information we need soon.â Sure enough a gaping black hole had appeared a metre behind them, waiting. Renamon motioned for Reddmon to hand her the phone for a moment.
          âOrionmon could you bring Rika along as well?â
          âOkay just hurry through. Iâll see you soon.â With an explosion and a curse Orionmon hung up. And with a shrug between them they stepped into Orionmonâs portal.

         Half an hour earlier

          Orionmon dropped himself down at the very edge of the military complex that was supposedly containing the information on the person trying to take Reddmon out. Crouching low he snuck up to the chain link fence, creating a hole through it and dashing up to a large concrete bunker. It was daytime so he had to get inside before he was spotted, the further he got before that happened the better.
          According to his sources he would find a hatch in the building that would lead him to a underground facility in which he could follow a map leading to a file room with info on test subject targets and all sorts of other useful intel, apparently it was a hard copy backup room, far apart from where anything really important took place. Which made it ideal for him.
          Moving over to the thick steal door he listened for a moment and heard the muffled voice of a guard talking which meant that there was at least two digimon inside at the moment. He wrenched open the door and charged in, storming towards a Gabumon in the centre of the room.
          As he entered the guessed pair of digimon span towards him the other digimon, a Koemon, quickly reached down to grab a phone like device at his hip. Only to have Orionmon sweep his forearm round and knock him to the ground with a sharp crack of skull on concrete. The slower one, the Gabumon faired no better as Orionmon kept the momentum going, taking a step past Koemon and grabbing the furred digimon by the neck, punching him once in the face then dropping him unconscious to the floor.
          âGrunts.â Muttered Orionmon disdainfully as he looked to the hatch that took up a large amount of floor space, though that didnât say much. The building itself was rather large and seemed to function as a barracks most of the time, being stuffed with bunk beds. Which kind of made sense, during the night the barracks would be full and during the day the whole place was being patrolled.
          With a sharp twist Orionmon opened the hatch, and by the sounds of it, stripped gears that would be used to open or close it, either automatically or remotely. Hopping down into it Orionmon found himself in a hallway with a steel grate floor and riveted iron walls
          âHomey.â He thought wryly as he checked the room he wanted respective to his current location. Left, straight twice, right, another straight, left then three doors down. Setting off at a run Orionmon made the first left turn then crashed headlong into a pair of digimon, a Commandramon and a Gaurdromon. The Commandramon was sent sprawling by the impact but the champion digimon held up better, merely stumbling back a few steps.
          As soon as he didnât recognise who Orionmon was he slapped his hand against a red button attached to the wall, which Orionmon noted were set up at regular intervals. As soon as the button was pressed a shrill klaxon sounded out and a recorded message began declaring that there was an intruder in area 5. Orionmon slammed his spike across the Gaurdromonâs head, knocking him out of the way and out of the fight then gave the Commandramon a kick to the chest as he brought up his rifle, the huge steel shoe sending him tumbling down the hall.
          Orionmon heard the sound of pounding footsteps behind him and set off again, this made things harder but far from impossible, after all he just had to get the files he wanted then he could make his own escape path, no need to worry about being cornered.
          As he made it down the straights he slid to a halt and looked behind himself just in time to see a group of Gaurdromon launching a salvo of missiles as they pursued him. Taking this chance Orionmon pulled a Reddmon and grabbed a smoke grenade from a small portal pulling the pin then dropping it as the projectiles rushed towards him. Just as the missiles were about to hit the grenade went off and filled the junction with thick dark gas. Rolling to the side he heard the missiles rush past and detonate further down. He pushed himself back to his feet and dashed down the hall. That would have bought him a few seconds as they figure out which way he went. But he still couldnât hang around, it wouldnât be long before lieutenants or higher class digimon arrived to give him grief.
          Naturally as soon as you think about the worst case scenario itâll immediately happen. At the next corner he had to turn looked right, the way he had to go then left, to make sure no one was sneaking up behind him, and low and behold a Devimon was sneering at him from halfway down the hall. He was definitely not a basic trooper so he was probably going to take time to deal with.
          With a small grin Orionmon got an idea about how to move on quickly. As a security measure regular teleportation such as what Reddmon and Renamon used wouldnât work, although his portals were unhindered. So with a flourish he opened a pair that were linked to each other on either side of the Devimon, essentially creating an infinite loop. Orionmon heard the Devimons roar of frustration then ran the other way. He was nearly there just down this hall when suddenly a squad of Commandramon came around the far corner, he could see the door he needed, but even if he made it without getting mowed down he wouldnât have enough time to search.
          He quickly turned to the wall and rammed a spike in between two plates of iron that made up the walls, levering them apart. As the Commandramon rapidly took up firing positions Orionmon used his bare hands to tear the metal from its mountings with a horrible tortured screech. Just as he braced it against his shoulder the floor and walls not obscured by his makeshift shield where lit up with a hundred sparks and bullets ricochets. He needed to call Reddmon quick and this seemed like good a time as any.
          Tossing a dissuasive grenade down both directions of the hall Orionmon got his phone out. A quick conversation later and Reddmon and Renamon where at his place, he tossed another pare of explosives at the advancing enemies then called Rika.
          âHi Rika sorry to call you at such short notice but Renamon and Reddmon are at my place and we might need your help soon.â
          âWhatâs going on are? you under attack, your not gonnaâ get us shot are you?â
          âHa ha ha. No, Iâm not home and no one but me is in danger. But Renamon asked me to bring you along, would you be able to go through the portal behind you.â
          âHow do you know Iâm not in class or something?â She asked suspiciously.
          âDo you really think I wouldnât have checked that first. Your at lunch and you went for a walk by yourself in the forest, now could you please get in the portal, I really canât spare much more time.â
          âOkay, okay, no need to get pushy.â She hung up and Orionmon sensed her walking through the pathway and arriving at his sanctuary. Satisfied he got rid of the phone and took out a rocket launcher. He wasnât usually this blunt but he needed speed more than finesse.
          Bracing himself he shot an explosive round down in the other direction. Which hit the ground at the junction and exploded with enough force to bring down part of the ceiling, ceasing his worries from that direction. Feeling the gunfire cease momentarily Orionmon dropped the launcher and pulling out a small wad of a clay like substance. He grabbed the steel plate and slapped the substance against it, picking it up and spinning, throwing it with everything he had down the hall like a oversized shuriken.
          With a cry of alarm the digimon leapt out of the way as the large scrap of metal lodged itself into the wall, at which point he took out the detonator for the wad of C4 heâd stuck to the metal and pressed it. With a rush of heat and a blast of noise that hall caved in as well.
          Satisfied that he had a few minutes at least Orionmon jogged to the door he needed and used his spikes to rip that open as well, revealing a room literally lined with filing cabinets. Moving up to the first one he noted that they were all alphabetised. So logically R for Reddmon was the first place to look. And with a quick search he found a file marked with Reddmonâs name.
          He was about to send it to a table he had set up in his sanctuary for the others when he noticed a small square of paper clipped to the top of it. It read, see Cyberdramon. Guessing it was linked for a reason he quickly found the C section and then Cyberdramonâs file, which actually had another attached to it. The one that was apparently related indirectly to Reddmon was labelled âBlack Crystal Project Top Secret.â Definitely worth reading. Sending them to his place with the other Orionmon turned to make sure no one would sneak into the portal behind him.
          âWhat the?â Orionmon stepped back quickly. The doorway was, blocked. He had left it open to the tarnished metal hall outside, but now the door was concealed by a wall of dark smoke, blacker than even the grenades he used and perfectly flush with the door. But that wasnât the strangest thing, it seemed to radiate evil, a malignance like none heâd ever sensed before.
          As if sensing his fear a pair of blood red eyes coalesced within the darkness, followed by a large, grinning of set of teeth, canine judging by the shape. As Orionmon backed away s the dark face slowly became three dimensional like it was pushing through the smoke, defiantly canine. Spinning, Orionmon opened a portal and dove through it. Not seeing a trio of jet black diamond like objects shot from the smoke and follow Orionmon into his portal. As it closed a deep harsh laughter rang out through the empty room, a laugh full of the intent to cause suffering and anguish.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: all your base it raided by us

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âSo any idea what the big lug wants?â Asked Rika shortly after she arrived.
         âHe mentioned something about finding out what we needed, but he was under attack so he couldnât elaborate.â Answered Renamon as Reddmon crouched next to the fire pit from several days ago and poking through it with a stick.
         âFrom what, did he even say where he was?â Scowled Reddmon shoving the stick into the ashes and walking over to a rock and sitting on it.
         âNo, but although we havenât known him for long he has proven himself to be reliable Rika.â Noted Renamon.
         âAnd whatâs with that table anyway?â Asked Rika nodding towards the only piece of furniture that sat in the middle of the clearing, obviously put there to draw attention to itself. {
indent}Without notice a hole opened a foot above the table and dropped a couple of folders onto it. âDoes that answer your question? Câmon take one and have a scan through.â Said Reddmon, stepping over to the table and picking up one of the folders. There was three of them, each with a different name printed neatly on the top right hand corner. He passed Rika the one with Cyberdramonâs name, to Renamon his own and kept the one with the enigmatic name of black crystal project, which was apparently top secret.
         He began quickly scanning through page after page of stuffy science talk taking in maybe three fourths of it. Nothing in his file was even related to him, why did Orionmon bother to get it.
         "I hope you guys got some better stuff than me.â He sighed as he closed the folder and put it back on the table. Who knows, maybe Orionmon could explain itâs significance when he got here. With even less warning than the first another portal came into existence.
         âWell speak of the devil.â Muttered Reddmon as Orionmon stumbled into the clearing. He straightened himself up and smiled at them, only to have his smile freeze a second later and then quickly contort into a grimace of pain as he doubled over, revealing three large spikes of some dark material sticking out of his back.
         As the portal closed behind him he fell to his knees, Renamon and Rika stepped forward to try and help him but Reddmon felt a twinge of regret as he motioned for them to stay back.
