According to the file heâd read those crystals were a perfected version of something called a black gear. A controlling device used to manipulate digimon.
         âWhatâs wrong Reddmon? Weâve got to help him.â Asked Renamon taking another step closer, just as Orionmon roared in pain and exploded into a crimson red blaze, still visible through the distorting heat. At least that solved one problem.
         âOrionmonâs be infected by the same thing as Cyberdramon.â He explained to the tamer and her partner. âThose crystals are going to double his strength, at least. Not to mention making him obsessed with a single objective, probably destroying me. Damn here we go..â
         Reddmon trailed off into silence as the fire that surrounded Orionmon began darkening, quickly becoming a patch black flame that scorched the ground around him.
         Renamon and Rika gasped as they noticed the trees around them begin to rot, the leaves falling from their perch, many of them dissolving mid air, the rest forming a thin layer of fowl smelling mulch. Trees began twisting into gnarled shapes, the weaker of them falling to the ground to join their lost foliage. All of them forming a skin of ugly looking fungus, a horrible mottled material that spread itâs tendrils up and around the branches, glistening with seeping fluids.
         The whole place looked like something out of a childâs nightmare, endless death and decay, with the huddled form of his friend in the centre. With a grunt of pain the crystals on Orionmon withdrew into his back and he slowly straitened himself up again, his eyes no longer the bright green, instead they were a baleful red, practically glowing with anger.
         Seeing that there was no talking there way out of this one Rika took out her digivice and a card from the deck strapped to her hip. âReady Renamon? Speed activate.â With a blur Renamon disappeared from sight, dashing around Orionmon.
         âRenamon wait, heâs not going to be so easy to beat this time.â He called dashing forward to help her.
         As Renamon reappeared behind Orionmon he didnât even look back, with a growl he quickly drew his arm back, elbowing Renamon hard in the chest and sending her tumbling into the muck lining the small clearing, before he could even call out her name he realised heâd bumbled into Orionmonâs reach and took a fist to the jaw a second later.
         Rolling to his feet and teleporting backwards Reddmon created an energy ball and called out. âDonât make me do this Orionmon, if you can hear me fight it.â He tossed the sphere straight at Orionmon and grimaced as it hit him square in the face and detonated. Seems like he canât use his portals, or at least doesnât want to. Thatâs a plus at least.
         As the remnants of the explosion faded away Reddmon blanched, that attack would have usually knocked Orionmon off his feet, but those things had increased his toughness a hell of a lot, he hadnât even moved let along shown any signs of pain.
         âThis would certainly qualify as bad.â Groaned Reddmon as Orionmon drew back his arm again, except this time it was wreathed in that dark flame. âCrap!â He yelled as Orionmon launched his attack, not at him but at Rika. Teleporting next to her and grabbing her by the waist he, with some difficulty, managed to move them both several metres to the side as Orionmon unleashed his attack. It was his fire pike alright, but as it rushed passed it seemed more like a freight train, several times larger than usual and mush more cohesive it bored a trench into the ground and incinerated a path through the trees.
         âYep, that certainly qualified.â Said Rika somewhat shakily, probably not used to having such destructive attacks aimed at her. Renamon suddenly appeared next to them, still a bit dazed from the blow she took.
         âCâmon you better digivolve, weâll need strength more than speed to take him down.â He said, pulling out his digivice and a blue card he kept for emergencies. Ignoring their looks and gasps of surprise Reddmon swiped it through and quickly digivolved to, sans montage.
         âQuit staring and digivolve already.â He snapped as he flexed his claws, waiting for her help to attack.
         âBut how did you? Where did y..â Stuttered Rika, like she was the only person to have a digivice.
         "Iâll explain later alright, but we really have more pressing matters donât chaâ think?â He sighed, jerking his chin towards Orionmon who had been staring ruthfully at them the whole time and certainly wouldnât be polite enough to keep doing it for long.
         Renamon had been giving him a suspicious but no less disturbing look since heâd taken out his digivice but said nothing and nudged Rika, nodding for her to proceed. In a flash Renamon was replaced not with Kyubimon but her ultimate form, Taomon.
         âOnce we cleanse him of those evil influences you will owe us an explanation Reddmon.â Stated Taomon, clearly not happy with him having secrets. heâd probably have to reveal Redd/ Holt as well.
         âItâs ViralReddmon.â He corrected. âAnd I donât think we can, short of deleting him, apparently that was a weakness of the previous versions, they could be destroyed without killing the host. Which tended to leave the victim pissed and wanting revenge.â
         âSo whatâs the plan then?â Asked Rika.
         âWell first weâveâ¦got to get the hell out of here.â He yelled as he saw Orionmon lifting his arms for his infernus axe attack, and judging by the boost his other attack had gotten he would raze a huge area to the ground.
         He quickly scooped up Rika in his arms and began running full pelt through the trees, his champion form making it much easier than as a rookie. But he slid to a halt and nearly dropped Rika as Taomon appeared in front of him.
         âWhat are you doing, move.â He urged as she calmly raised her arms, the long sleaves of the robes she wore sliding up to reveal her paws. Reddmon looked behind him to see Orionmon slam his arms to the ground, a huge wave of all consuming black fire rushed in all directions. âAw nuts.â Muttered Reddmon as it came towards them, showing no sign of slowing.
         âTalisman spell.â
         A dome of white light spread from Taomon as a ying,yang symbol appeared beneath them. âCould you let me down now?â Asked Rika from her rather uncomfortable position on his shoulder, probably not enjoying the edges of his armour.
         âAnd when were you going to tell me about that?â He asked as the flame washed over them, not even changing the internal temperature. Instantly regretting his choice of words as they gave him a withering stare.
         "I said Iâll explain everything later okay, Iâm sorry I kept secrets from you.â He assured them as the wave of flame suddenly withdrew into itself, becoming a brilliant white ball of light with the changing Orionmon in the center. âOh great Heâs digivolving. Thatâs all we need a super charged Savagemon. I think itâs time to go on the offensive.â
         With a nod of agreement Taomon dropped the barrier around them and moved forward, lightly hopping from rotting tree to rotting tree. Moving faster ViralReddmon ran through the muck, making his way around Savagemon, who was still howling at the sky, the last of the flames dying out.
         Taomon pulled, of all things, a giant brush from the folds of her robes and drew a symbol in mid air, quite literally as the symbol stayed there as if it where drawn on invisible parchment. Reddmon was about to call out to her, asking what she was doing when the symbol glowed and a beam of brilliant white light burst from it and hit Savagemon. Clearly damaging him. Savagemon roaring in pain and raised his arms and axes in front of him.
         Seeing an opening ViralReddmon jumped from the thick filth around his feet. The beam of light cutting off a second before he passed into it, with a sweeping motion ViralReddmon brought his leg round and kicked Savagmon hard across the face, appearing a second later behind him and grabbing him by the neck, slamming him to the ashen ground. Moving backwards again he dodged aside another beam of light that Taomon hit Savagmon with.
         Pushing himself to his feet, ignoring Taomonâs attack completely, he turned to ViralReddmon, growling and taking a step out of the blaze of light. With another bestial yell he threw one of the thick bearded weapons. ViralReddmon ducked under the blade, which for some reason exploded when it hit a tree. They werenât getting anywhere, they were faster than him but it was only a matter of time, Savagemon charged forward wielding his remaining axe two handed, before got a solid blow and killed one of them.
         âTaomon!â He called, dodging back from the crazed berserkerâs swings. âYou got any ideas?â
         âCan you digivolve any higher?â She asked stepping in-between them and blocking the axe with her brush.
         âWell yeah of course.â
         âThen donât stand around. Do it now.â
         âYes sir.â He said with mock salute, pulling his digivice out and swiping another blue card. With a second boost of power a pair of leathery black wings formed from cracks in the armour on his back, stretching to full span, which was about a metre and a half each side.
         âWings? Is that it? You grow a pair of wings?â Asked Rika disbelievingly.
         DeviReddmon glanced over at her, Fine then smart aleck. He thought, moving high speed around Taomon and in front of Savagemon kneeing him in the gut then grabbing him by the throat and tossing him back.
         Savagemon landed hard on his back, losing his other axe in the fall, which DeviReddmon swiftly scooped up and threw far into the distance.
         âSo still think I just âgrew wingsâ, eh?â He called to Rika, who had stepped up beside Taomon, who calmly pointed behind him.
         Following the finger but expecting a charging Savagemon DeviReddmon was surprised to see him standing where he was thrown, glaring at them with pure hatred. Thatâs weird. every time Iâve seen Savagemon heâs attacked relentlessly, never stopping until the target stops moving, if their lucky.
         âOh, cool looks like where going to get to see Orionmonâs Ultimate form.â Commented DeviReddmon as he backed away, Savagmon had begun to exude power from himself, distorting his shape.
         âAre you crazy? His champion form was enough trouble.â Yelled Rika angrily. At the sound of Rikaâs voice the energy cut out, Orionmons ultimate form coming into focus. warriors
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Orionmon's fury.

choices: A night's rest will clear his mind.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Covered in dark red samurai armour with an animal motif, a demonic shaped mask covering his face, and a pair of katana large at his hips, Reddmon had to admit that Orionmon had a pretty cool ultimate.
          âHey Rika. You got any info on him?â He asked not taking his eyes of their new opponent.
          âGimme a secâ. Yeah, got it, according to this his name is Bushidomon, a vaccine digimon who stands by the old codes of honour and has a devastating dragon king slice attack. How do you think we should take him on.â She replied, shuffling through the cards she had. âOh here we go, this might work.â
          âWell, I guess Iâll let you ladies lead then.â Reddmon said with a bow, ducking under a blade as Bushidomon dashed forward. He was much faster than Orionmon or Savagmon but still not in the same league of either of them. But on the other hand he probably had endurance and strength that they would struggle with.
          DeviReddmon rolled to the side as another sword rushed past his head and was quickly followed by a sandaled foot which missed him by inches and smashed a large hole into the ground. Flipping to his feet as a sword slid into the dirt where his head had been DeviReddmon teleported behind him and tried to sweep kick Bushidomonâs legs from under him but he blocked with his other sword and drew the first back for a killing strike.
          âSkullmeramonâs chains.â
          A long pair of thick chains whipped out of nowhere and wrapped around Bushidomon, strapping his arms to his body. Not missing a beat DeviReddmon lunged at him, knocking him to the ground and further pinning him with his own weight, as Bushidomon glared up at him with those glowing eyes DeviReddmon cocked his fist and slammed it into the side of Bushidomonâs helmet which jerked to the side with a resounding clang. Pulling his other arm back he swung again and again until, with a primal roar Bushidomon flexed his arms and shattered the chain, throwing DeviReddmon off in a rain of broken metal links.
          Thrown back, DeviReddmon landed on his paws and knees, sliding backwards in the sludge of decaying leaves, which he just noticed had stained his fur, armour and to a lesser extent Taomonâs robes.
          With not even the slightest signs of pain, discomfort or disorientation Bushidomon pushed himself to his feet, even though his helmet was covered in dents and must surely be ringing like a church bell at a wedding.
          âWell that didnât phase him much, Iâm out of ideas, how about you two?â Asked Rika, taking a final search through her cards. By the look of things Bushidomon was about to go on back on the offensive not a fun proposition. And they hadnât even seen his special attack yet.
          DeviReddmon had one attack he was sure would work, but it wasnât something he wanted to use on a friend. No matter what the circumstances. With a threatening growl Bushidomon changed his stance, holding his swords with the point backwards and the blades out. Without further warning Bushidomon dashed towards him one sword held back the other forward, almost ninja style. With a spinning motion he slashed at DeviReddmonâs chest the first missing but the second and third found gaps in his armour and drew blood, as Bushidomon brought up his leg to knee him in stomach DeviReddmon brought up his own and pushed off it, launching him out of the way of a final rising slice.
          âTalisman of light!â Yelled Taomon as she drew said symbol mid air, a blast of light stopping Bushidomon from pursuing DeviReddmon before he could land.
          Bushidomon glanced at Taomon menacingly, raising both swords above his head then slamming them, point down deep into the ground. Both swords began to glow brightly and a pattern of straight burning lines began to snake out from the point the swords penetrated the ground.
          âDamn, this must be that dragon king slice. I need to end this now.â Muttered DeviReddmon as a pulse of raw power washed out across the glowing hieroglyph like markings that now reached out past where Rika stood, which meant she would be caught in it too.
          DeviReddmon gathered all his energy into his right paw and began running towards Bushidomon as another pulse passed underneath them, then another, quicker this time and defiantly brighter. He didnât have much time and this would be all or nothing too.
          Leaping into the air DeviReddmon pushed all the energy into a ball, then forced that into a short blade. It wasnât big but it could cut through anything and corrupted data on a massive scale, heâd taken out megas with it in one strike.
          âDark blade!â Bellowed DeviReddmon as he crashed into the kneeling Bushidomon, his attack effortlessly passing through armour and flesh alike. With a single grunt that sounded more surprised than anything else they tumbled to the ground, the glyphs on the ground swiftly retracting and dissipating.
          DeviReddmon pulled the blade from his fallen friend and dispersed it back into his body just as Bushiomonâs red eyes faded back to green. The fight was over.
          With and sigh Bushidomonâs form was momentarily blurred as a flurry of data code unravelled from him, leaving Orionmon on his back with a dark edged knife wound in his chest.
          âSorry about that.â Coughed Orionmon, trying to push himself to a sitting position but groaning and falling back as the just de-digivolved Renamon and Rika ran up next to them.
          âWhat are you apologizing for? I just sign and enforced your death warrant.â DeviReddmon chuckled, waving off his friends apology.
          âHere, this is the last of the information *cough hack cough* on the person trying to do you in.â He said, wiping the blood he coughed up off his hand then plucking a folder from a hole and giving it to him. âAnd youâll probably need this to *hack cough*, sorry about that, get home.â He finished pulling out a digi-modify card and handing that to him as well.
          âThe warriors path? Cute, I guess it opens one of your portals back to the real world?â
          âGot it in one. Sorry if I hurt any of you.â
          âCâmon Orionmon stop talking like thereâs no tomorrow.â Said Rika, crouching next to him and wincing as she saw the darkness around the wound spreading visibly.
          âHa ha, *cough cough* me and Reddmon both know Iâm done.â He chuckled, his body becoming sort of pixilated for a moment before regaining form.
          âLook Reddmon, be careful in the next few days. Your life is still in danger, as is those of your new friends, I was the first but theyâll begin using them against you soon. I hope we meet again, I enjoyed your friendship.â His body blurred up again, but this time it didnât recover, he broke up into thousands of cubes which floated apart from each other then faded away.
          âUm, Iâm sorry to be insensitive, but arenât we stuck here now.â Asked Renamon laying an paw gently on his shoulder. Reddmon watched the last bits of data disappear before answering.
          âNo, Orionmon was clever like that, he built in several failsafe into this place.â So this was what it was like to lose a friend. It sucked like hell. He was going to find who caused this and crush them with everything he had, make them pay dearly.
          âAhh! Reddmon!â He looked up from his tightly clenched paw to see Rika pointing towards the edges of the horizon. Which had began to pixilate just as Orionmon himself had.
          âDonât worry thatâs just this world collapsing because Orionmon can no longer maintain it.â
          âDonât worry? How is that meant to allay our fears.â Asked Renamon disbelievingly, turning around to find that the whole realm was collapsing around them, revealing a black void.
          âBecause any living beings that Orionmon tags upon entry are deposited where they entered should he be deleted, as I said fail safes.â He explained, watching as the nothingness approached, he knew they where safe but watching that approach was kind of unnerving.
          âHey, Reddmon, Iâve heard rumours that powerful digimon, when deleted are reborn again.â Said Renamon giving his shoulder a squeeze. She was trying to make him feel better, that was nice of her, at least they didnât hate him for deceiving them.
          âYeah I know, but when that happens your personalty might be maintained but all knowledge and skills are lost, even if I manage to find him and befriend him again it will be years before heâs a challenge.â
          âOne track mind, you delete him and all you can think about is when you can meet him in combat again.â She chuckled, rapping a knuckle across his head. Reddmon was desperately trying to come up with a comeback when suddenly everything went black. Well more like the black swallowed everything. He blinked to try and refocus but everything was simply replaced with a forest, one that he quickly recognised as the exact place Orionmon had picked them up from this morning.
          âIâm going home to look through those files some more, Iâll call you if I come up with something.â Reddmon said, noticing for the first time that Rika wasnât with them, then he remembered that she wasnât with them when they entered so she would have appeared somewhere else.
          âReddmon. Iâm sorry that you lost a friend today, if only for a while, but donât do anything reckless okay, call Rika and myself if you intend to go hunting for the culprit. We can and will help you.â She said putting emphasis on the last statement.
          âHey, reckless I may be, but stupid Iâm not. I just need time to plan, Iâll see you tomorrow, oh and donât tell the guys, okay?â With that he teleported out of there, quickly making his way home. He was sure she was worried about him, hell he would be if she lost Rika. But he was also sure she had enough respect to leave him alone for a few hours.

          He was shortly at the abandoned house he called home and had let himself in, realizing for the first time that he was still in his ultimate from. With a cleansing breath he de-digivolved and changed back into Reddmon, thankful to have his tails back again. Making his way to the kitchen he materialized the four folders heâd gathered throughout the day and dropped them onto the table before finding a cloth in one of the cupboards and wetting it under the tap.
          Sitting by the table he opened the folder marked with his name and began swabbing at the cuts and bruises, wiping off any of the foul gunk that clung to his feet. Reading through it he found that it was filled with everything there was to know about himself, most of which he himself didnât know. It also outlined why he was targeted, something about prior employment with a virus type digimon by the name of Reapermon. Who had for some reason or another lost favour with him.
          Moving on to the other folder he found that the Cyberdramon that attacked him was just a wild digimon that theyâd captured and used as a guinea pig to test the latest version of the crystals, which according the that relevant folder was a precursor to the version that was used on Orionmon.
          But while the first three files brought him up to speed it was the last one that gave him a direction to go in. It was all about Reapermon, everything about him. Where he could be found, things he owned, and even his fighting style. Orionmon came though again.
          Reddmon looked out the window and was surprised to see that night had rolled over the town and that he had been reading in twilight from what little shone through the window, he hadnât even noticed.

          What now? Sleep on it or plan now?
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: A rumble to remember.

choices: Leg it, just knock Guilmon out of the way.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
He needed an idea before he could even lay down let alone rest. *sigh* âI need ideas, a plan, something.â Reddmon groaned to himself, ruffling the fur on his head in frustration.
          Well, according to Renamon under Guilmonâs hideout he could find a path to the digital world so he could use that to get there, that was the trickiest part sorted. Once there he could find the common places Reapermon frequented and then all he had to do was smash his way through an apparently impressive array of bodyguards and a personal army. But that would be easy enough, he had the firepower and certainly the intention. The really difficult part would be leaving without anyone noticing, especially since heâd have to get past Guilmon to do so.
          âDamn! How an I going to get past Guilmon? Hmm, I could knock him out. But I canât let him see or even sense me. No I need something more cunning than that.â He pondered out loud.
          âYou could probably distract him with food, but youâll have to cover your scent.â
          âGah!â Cried Reddmon spinning and knocking the chair over to see Renamon and Rika leaning on the open windowsill and smirking at him.
          âYou were going to leave without us werenât you?â Asked Renamon, frowning darkly at him.
          âNo, no, uhm, Iâ¦I was just planning.â He blustered, knowing they wouldnât buy it for a moment, even Rika would notice that he hadnât sensed their presence .
          âSo I think you owe us an explanation, the digivice, whoâs after you and what you think you were going to do all alone.â Stated Renamon, climbing in the window then helping Rika through as well.
          Reddmon gulped, he hadnât told anyone much about himself, and now that he knew the alleged whole story. Heck even Orionmon had only pieced together bits and pieces, going to a lot of effort to do so. Oh, great, the old fight or flight reflex was kicking in, he could feel a silly amount of nervousness and apprehension about telling them everything. Well, this sucks.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: The planning stage is always the hardest.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Renamon watched closely as Reddmon glanced at the doorway, probably thinking of making a run for it. She could tell he wanted nothing more than to be somewhere else, but he needed to answer some questions first if they were to continue trusting him. Mainly how in the world he got that digivice.
          âAlright, I guess you both deserve the full story. Rika read the file about me right? So she knows a bit, and she probably told most of it to you Renamon, and thatâs why youâre here for answers right?â âWhat?â Thought Renamon shooting her partner a look. Rika hadnât told her anything, just said they should come here and talk very soon. What had she read? If it was so important why didnât she at least give her the highlights.
          Reddmon must have picked up on the meaning of the glare Renamon gave Rika because he chuckled softly. âOr maybe not. You just wanted to get the whole story before making decisions, right Rika?â He asked as he gathered up the files and papers strewn across the table
          âExactly, I didnât want Renamon to, erm, overreact because I did a Chinese whispers kind of thing.â She explained slightly sheepishly.
          âWhatâs that?â Asked Reddmon.
          âItâs a game in which a phrase is passed around a group. Without fail it changes massively from itâs original wording, in essence a practice in the failings of gossip.â Answered Renamon, seems like sheâd almost done exactly what Rika had tried to prevent, but worse.
          âSo anyway back to me. Damn, that sounded self-centred. Iâm a human-digimon hybrid able to take on the form and attributes of either.â
          âphe, yeah right, try pulling the other one Reddmon.â Scoffed Rika, and Renamon had to agree, it seemed highly unlikely if not impossible that such a thing could exist.
          âWell has any human suddenly appeared without explanation and made direct contact with you? Maybe helping you, hmm?â He asked with a knowing smile, although that didnât ring any bells to her.
          âNo, not really. Wait, youâre not? Holt?â Exclaimed Rika. Referring to the kid that had helped her with a bully problem a few days back. Which did actually fit within the timeframe of Reddmonâs arrival. And anyway, she expressly forbade him form coming to school.
          âGot it in one, I usually call myself Redd but I felt that was too obvious, might have fooled Takato or Guilmon but the rest of you would have guessed immediately.â
          âAlright that explains what you are, but who are you? Where do you come from?â Asked Renamon, moving onto the second most pressing matter.
          âWell thatâs a bit tougher. Mainly because I donât remember, but according to that file I worked as the second in command for a bounty hunter organization led by a Reapermon. Doing allsorts of violent and destructive odd jobs. And for some reason I quit or was fired, then I disappeared for a while. Actually now that I think about it that might explain that Heliogaomonâs anger when he saw me in the tournament.
          So anyway, when I reappeared I was apparently much less, dangerous. Still causing havoc but not on a murderous warpath. That new period matches reports which place it at the start of my memory.â
          âSo weâre up to speed now, right?â Asked Rika.
          âNot entirely. Shortly after I reappeared Reapermon started putting massive resources into tracking me down. I came here, he eventually followed, hence the attack with Cyberdramon. And Orionmon. To put it simply this is the guy Iâm after now. I have a rough plan of attack and Iâll fill in the specifics when I go to the digital world.
          âIâm going with you.â Stated Renamon, everything had the ring of truth to her ears and she was certain that no matter how good Reddmon was heâd do something reckless and get himself deleted.
          âMe too, I cant let you two go with out a person to watch your backs and let Renamon digivolve.â
          âI couldnât stop the pair of you if I tried could I?â He sighed resignedly. âYou do know Iâm going to have to fight through an elite army.â
          âHuh, if we can take on a creature that deletes data by touch then we can handle an army of digimon.â Renamon scoffed, like sheâd lose to minions.
          Reddmon smiled and shook his head, shrugging his shoulders, âFine, but the guys donât come.â
          âWhy, wouldnât it be easier if there were more of us.â Asked Rika.
          âOnly if you want to face the whole force, I was hoping to do what Orionmon did. Go in, strike, then disappear, that card he gave me should sort out any hasty exits we need to make. I can see those four making a huge noise at the worst possible moments. Where as we could easily run you through the basics of stealth as we travel.â He explained, something that was actually a great idea, as long as they came back in a better shape than Orionmon did.
          Renamon winced as she finished that thought, it wasnât exactly respectful to the dead. Well, the temporarily missing at least.
          âAlright, itâs decided then. Weâre going back to the digital world.â Declared Rika enthusiastically, slamming a fist into he open palm.
          âTomorrow, miss sunshine. Iâm tired. You should prepare for a few days travel. And maybe tell your parents.â He advised, standing up and dematerialising the folders he still held. Renamon nearly laughed out loud, never in her memory had Rika been called that, sheâd have to remember it for the right moment. They followed him to the door and said their good byes for the night, arranging to meet up in the park in the morning.
          Just as Rika turned to leave Reddmon grabbed her by the shoulders and pulled her close, kissing her on the muzzle for a slow moment. âThanks.â He whispered releasing her and taking a quick step back.
          âRenamon, câmon itâs getting late.â Called Rika impatiently, looking back to see what was holding her up. Renamon felt heat rising to her face as she looked from the waiting Rika to a smiling Reddmon.
          âWhy you cheekyâ¦â She muttered, not bothering to finish the sentence let alone knock him over the head, instead hurrying after her partner.

Next morning
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Revelations

choices: On the way to the park.
Skip the segway, at the park.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Reddmon woke half expecting to find Orionmon sitting in one of the chairs, grinning at him. Heâd always had a knack for doing the unexpected. But it was way to soon for him to have been reformatted and re-digivolved back to his rookie form.
          âSo until then Iâll just have to deal with Reapermon to keep myself amused.â A glance at the clock told him that he still had a fair bit of time to wait till he had to meet up with the girls so he had plenty of time to grab breakfast.
          After checking that he had everything stored that he wanted, weapons, extra food, camping stuff as well as other survival paraphernalia. He locked the front door then teleported round to the back of the house, transformed into Redd and ambled down to the business district. He wandered around for a bit before walking by a sit down food stall. It smelt good enough and he was running out of time so he lifted one of the hanging fabric doors aside and sat down on one of the stools.
          âGood morning! Whatâll it be?â Bellowed the chef jovially, obviously in high spirits about something.
          After a quick glance at the menu he ordered some beef with rice and a bowl of miso soup. Glancing around he noticed that he was the only customer in at the moment, granted it was still quite early but he expected someone else to be having breakfast.
          âMorning, Holt.â He felt a familiar three fingered paw lay on his shoulder and turned to see both Rika and Renamon. âThe usual Mr Hamano.â
          âSure Rika, Renamon. But arenât you meant to be at school in a few minutes?â Mr Hamano asked as they sat down on either sides of Redd.
          âNot today, we have an excursion of sorts with our friend here.â Explained Rika, coming up with an admirable cover on the spot.
          âSo you guys come here often do you?â He asked Rika, turning to look at Renamon. Flinching as he almost came nose to nose with her. She was staring at him intensely, studying every detail of his face, her icy blue eyes moving slowly around his face.
          âYou look nothing like I expected.â She stated having come to some sort of decision. She backed off a bit and began absently looking around the restaurant, acting decidedly odd.
          Redd leaned over to Rika and whispered. âWhatâs up with her?â
          âSheâs been like that all night, I think sheâs trying to make up her mind about something.â
          âI can hear you.â Their topic of discussion muttered menacingly.
          âSorry.â Redd hastily apologized. âWeâll talk about it later. So doesnât anyone notice you here Renamon?â He continued, trying to engage her in a solid conversation.
          âWeâre the only regulars in the morning, and if anyone comes in I can disappear easily.â
          âOrders up.â The chef declared placing several bowls in front of each of them. Renamon had gotten rice and a bowl of soup he couldnât quite identify but was wonderfully aromatic, simple as heâd expect. Rika order was a seafood curry with a strong green pigment, again very aromatic.
          âLooks good, Thanks.â Said Redd, picking up his chopsticks and digging in, following the rules of etiquette Renamon taught him yesterday, if only for brownie points.

          Once they'd finished their food Redd offered to pay their bills, but Mr Hamano just shook his head then gave him a knowing wink. âDonât worry about it, have a nice day, eh.â
          Redd just waved and politely smiled in return, the guy must think him and Rika are together or something. Whatever, Redd turned to see Rika hefting a massive backpack onto her back.
          âCâmon, what are you staring at, lets go.â She urged when she noticed his gaze. Shaking his head he followed out the front and let them lead the way to the park.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Breakfast

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
As they were walking towards the park Redd walked slightly behind them, holding his hands behind his head, looking casually around at the stores. âFunny thing,â Redd pretty much blurted out, although he was trying to sound nonchalant. âThat chef seemed to think weâre an item, Rika, pretty weird, eh?â Renamon smiled to herself, giving Rika a sideways glance. âDonât you dare.â She didnât have to be physic to read that from Rikaâs expression. But she was in a bit of a mood with the pair of them.
          âYou didnât hear Rika fawning over her saviour, Holt.â
          She smiled as Redd nearly walked straight into a pole. âDonât mind her, sheâs just annoyed we kept secrets from her.â Explained Rika, which was true enough to wipe the smile of Renamonâs muzzle. âAnd anyway thatâs nothing compared to the things she says about you.â She finished, breaking into a run, although not a fast one with the massive backpack weighing her down. âAn eye for an eye Renamon.â Thought Rika as she disappeared around the corner.
          âVery funny.â Renamon shot back, glancing back at Redd to see that heâd successfully made contact between a light pole and his face and was now rubbing he forehead. Her smile creeping back
          Renamon dropped the smile as Redd glanced at her surreptitiously, deciding to drop the whole thing with both of them she slowed down a bit and fell in step beside him. âSo are you going to try and regain your memories when we get back to the digital world?â She asked lightly as he gave his forehead a last ginger touch then let his hand drop.
          âNot really, Iâm happy with who I am and with what Iâve got. What I had seems to be, well, evil.â He replied, looking at his feet more than her.
          âIâm glad to hear that. Come on, Rika should have gotten Guilmon away by now.â She teleported onto a building and began leaping towards the park. Halting and masking her presence as she saw Guilmon run down an alley below her. She disliked deceiving him, but they couldnât have the others following them later on and getting lost. They couldn't count on Yamaki to pull another ARK from his hat.
          As the red lizard went off in the direction of Takatoâs bakery the just digivolved (or whatever it was) Reddmon appeared on the rooftop beside her. âWhereâs he off to?â He asked, letting his tails stretch themselves about.
          âWe decided to get him to go home for a bit, Rika told him weâre going to hide a surprise for Takato in his hideaway and we needed him to keep an eye on Takato to make sure he doesnât find us.â Renamon explained as she began moving again, feeling surprisingly happy to have Reddmon back in his digimon form, she could read him better this way for some reason.
          They soon dropped onto the stairs in front of Guilmonâs hideout just as Rika came out, brushing dirt off her hands. She noticed them and smiled slyly, chuckling as she made eye contact with Renamon "I see he's back to his sexy self." Renamon just ignored that, thankfull Rika didn't say it out loud.
âWhatâs with the grave diggers hands?â Asked Reddmon.
          âJust burying something to make our excuse more credible.â Said Rika as she walked over to her bag, which was crammed with food, medical supplies and other survival gear, almost too much for Rika to carry and they'd both agreed that Renamon should be able to fight at a moments notice, so in the end they'd probably trick Reddmon into carrying it. Rika took one of the thick, high strength straps and began pulling them shut, so they wouldn't come undone when they fell into the digital world, a fall that experience told them would be rough.
          Reddmon watched as Rika struggled to pick the bag up then sighed. âHere, give me that.â He said taking the backpack up then immediately dropping it. Rika was about to protest when the bag disappeared.
          âWell that will make things easier, do you still feel the weight?â Asked Rika, trying to spot some trace of the bag, like heâd hidden behind his back with some slight of paw. Sheâd seen Orionmon pull similar tricks before but humans probably didnât get used to the sudden disappearance of objects.
          âCâmon, lets go before Guilmon gets back.â Said Reddmon walking inside the Dinoâs hideaway. âUmm, how do we use the portal?â He asked, poking his head back out the doorway.
          âJust follow us. Oh and, brace for impact.â Said Renamon, walking past him.
          âWhat?â He cried running after her. She was going to enjoy seeing his face when he saw the drop.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: On the way to the park.

choices: Rika decides which direction they go.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âHow much longer.â Whined Reddmon as he ducked under a flying decimal point, one which seemed to have taken a particular interest in him. Theyâd been walking through a sea of mathematical symbols for at least twenty minutes. Last time they where here theyâd gotten out by luck more than anything else.
          Suddenly Renamon felt that familiar sensation of relocation as the three of them, who had been walking side by side were scattered over a small area.
          âWhat in the world was that?â He asked.
          âA translation.â Replied Rika simply.
          âTranslation? What does that, woah!â He was cut off as they all felt a lunch deep in their stomachs as they began plummeting downwards.
          âDid this, humph, happen last time you came here.â He yelled over the rushing wind as they crashed through what looked like massive circuit boards.
          âPretty much, hent, at least the views good.â Called back Renamon, having counted the walls theyâd passed though last time.
          âView? I cant see anything but, oof. Oh crap!â He yelled as they burst through the final layer, revealing a massive drop to a desert studded with large rock formations.
          âHa, donât worry Reddmon, besides passing out you feel fine once you hit.â Laughed Rika, which clearly didnât calm him down. Renamon chuckled as her view began blurring, blackness quickly creeping in from the edges of her vision.

          âHey Renamon!â
          Renamon felt someone shaking her gently by the shoulders, calling her name. âRenamon.â
          âWhat is it?â She mumbled back wondering why it was so bright in their bedroom.
          âWake up, itâs time to go.â Reddmonâs furry muzzle came into focus above her, with Rika just above him. Oh yeah thatâs right, the digital world. Renamon pushed herself up, seemed like she was the last one to come to, everyone else had already crawled out of their own sandy craters and scrambled into hers.
          âGlad your alright. Just promise me one thing.â He said as he helped to her feet.
          âWhat?â She asked, brushing sand from her fur.
          âWe never do that again, ok?â She nodded, it certainly wasnât a fun way to start an adventure. Besides she had the feeling theyâd be falling almost as much as last time they visited.
          âWe do have a better plan of action than last time donât we? This is all feeling way too much like dÃ©jÃ  vu.â Moaned Rika, pointing off to a collection of craters Renamon instantly recognised as their last point of entry. Which was strange since that was a such long time ago
          âWhat was the plan last time?â Asked Reddmon as he scanned the rather bleak horizon, staring at the rock formations that resembled radio towers then glancing at each of the data streams that were currently passing, one roughly north, one south east and another to the west. Assuming one could discern the points of a compass from the sunâs location, again on the assumption the digital world played by that particular rule. Which was highly doubtful.
          âOh. We had a plan beyond, âfind Calumonâ?â Asked Renamon wryly as she picked the last grains of sand from herself.
          âThat pretty much sums it up. Can you pass me my water bottle, its in the side pocket of my bag.â Asked Rika with a shrug. Reddmon laughed to himself for a moment before frowning in concentration for another, plucking Rikaâs dark green water bottle from mid air.
          âWell, I donât know where we are so I was gonnaâ suggest hopping through data streams till we find a town. Then go hunting for info the usual way.â He said, tossing the bottle to her then walking off in a seemingly random direction.
          âWhat should I have expected? Heâs a boy.â Whispered Rika as she began walking after him.
          âYes. This was going to be exactly like last time, at least Rikaâs going to be complaining to him not me.â Thought Renamon, following the pair as they began squabbling about which direction to go.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: A familiar fall.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âLook, as long as we jump in at the same time weâll land in the same place, trust me on this.â Urged Reddmon, keeping a firm grip on Rika as she tried to her arm free and get out of the path of the bright pink column of light that was rushing toward them. Heâd travelled through them hundreds of times, with and without others and they'd generally gotten him where he wanted, although that was usually as vague as just somewhere else.
          âEvery time those things caught one of us our group got more and more scattered, we should just walk around until we find someone or something helpful.â
He could tell Renamon agreed with Rikaâs argument and was about to intervene, but heâd win anyway if he only stalled a few more seconds.
          âIt only takes a few seconds for the drop off point to change by kilometres, Iâll even hold your hand to make sure...â Reddmon cut himself off as a white paw clamped around both their hands/paws, he looked to Renamon to see he staring between then at the approaching stream.
          âFine you win.â Sighed Rika, giving in and stopping her struggle.
          They watched as the data stream loomed over them and Reddmon felt that odd falling sensation, although it was more like falling up rather than down. But suddenly that changed, they bagan falling properly and the blinding pink light was cut off, revealing exactly what he was looking for, a large desert town. Only problem was they where about seven metres off the ground, easily a dangerous fall. He fealt both there hands/paws squeeze sharply as the girls saw where they were.
          Acting instinctively he pulled on Rikaâs hand and grabbed her as they make contact, Renamon let go and righted herself as Reddmon did so for both of them, landing almost perfectly in the sand with a heavy thud that send shockwaves of pain running up heâs legs.
          âSee, piece of cake.â Moaned Reddmon, letting Rika to her feet then rubbing the pain out of his thighs. He stumbled over to a wooden crate by the side of the small yard they were in and lifted himself onto it. Kneading the aching muscles.
          âSo where are we.â Asked Rika, looking around and taking in the unusual architecture.
          âItâs a large merchant town by the name of Amani*, mainly made from data on middle eastern bazaars, exactly what we need.â He answered, frankly quite happy with his luck, he even knew several friends in the area who he could pull favours from.
          âLets go, we have someone we need to talk to.â Reddmon pushed himself off the crate and motioned for the girls to follow him. They walked out of the back yard and up a side ally between two squat, single floor buildings that were the same colour as the sand around them. As they left the alley they found themselves in a bustling main road. Digimon of all types and levels travelling to and fro, half of them carrying large stacks of packages in front of them the other half pulling heavily laden carriages behind.
          Renamon sniffed the air casually and instantly snorted, probably trying to get rid of the overpowering smell of exotic spices and something else heâd never been able to identify. âOhh that smells nice. What is it?â Asked Rika, also tasting the scent on the air, although it was probably nice and mild for her.
          âFood court.â He said, pointing down one way. âWeâll go there later, but first.â He pointed to a side road a few metres in the opposite direction. âWe go that way. Stay close together, itâs pretty easy to get lost here.â He regretted that as soon as he said it because they both shot him a irritable look.
          âWe arenât children you know.â Hissed Renamon, walking in the direction heâd pointed. Rika shrugged and walked after her, for a second Reddmon considered hiding, just to give them a little scare. But he knew a few slave mongers hung around here and would have no qualms or problems with kidnapping them. Renamon was street smart but Rika needed more experience, so in the end he just jogged after them, ducking and weaving through the crowd.

          After walking down several roads, each more seedy and less frequented than the last they came to a large rug store at the very edge of the city, deep within the shadow of the high wall surrounding the âCity of Wishesâ as it was known.
          âAre you sure this is the place? Seems kind of..â Rika tried to find the right word to describe it.
          âMusty?" He offered, "Donât worry, he might be shady but this guy is the best informant Iâve met. Heâll have info on where we can find Reapermon.â Reddmon ducked under a large, incredibly old rug that hung over the door and lifted it aside for them. As soon as they were all in another rug hanging against what appeared to be a solid wall flew open from which emerged a short digimon wearing an orange robe that brushed his feet, his head covered in dusty bandages that only parted to show two darting yellow eyes, a Cheshire smile and a pair of pale orange cat ears.
          "Hello Basimon. Hows business?
          âAhh Reddmon, I was wondering when Iâd see you next.â His voice soft and with the slight rasp of age but still full of authority. His sharp eyes sliding over Renamon then resting on Rika, lingering a few moments to long. âItâs not at all like you to travel with others, least of all a partnership of digimon and human. Something troublesome must be coming my way, hmm. Sigh. Ah well you always pay my fees, what is it you need?â He sat himself of a stack of cloth and motioned for them to do likewise. Reddmonâs makeshift seat, a collection of older articles released a small cloud of dust that made him break into a coughing fit.
          Once heâd cleared his throat. âI need to know the current whereabouts of a digimon named Reapermon, do you know him?â
          Basimon chuckled to himself. âYes of course I do, but heâs a dangerous individual, I would need to cover my tracks well.â His grin widened disturbingly, his eyes glinting greedily.
          With a sigh Reddmon materialised a large sack he kept various valuable things in and tossed it to Basimon. Upon catching it Basimon simply hefted the bag and put it behind him. âWonderful, go to the bazaar find a food stall selling curry and wait there. A Digimon I trust will be there soon to guide you.
          âWait, you mean heâs actually going to take us there?â Asked Rika, probably not believing how helpful Basimon was being, who despite looking shifty was actually very reliable, to those who paid enough.
          âYes of course girl. Now go, shoo, shoo. I need to prepare for you.â He urged, waving for them to leave.
          âCâmon, this gives us a chance to get something to eat, itâs about lunch time anyway.â Said Reddmon walking out and again holding the rug aside for them to pass.
          As they where walking back down the path they came from there was a massive crash and a lot of hollering at the intersection up ahead. And in almost perfect unison Renamon and Rika both dropped there heads. âOh no, its them. So much for stealth here on out.â Groaned Renamon.
          Reddmon looked at Renamon Then Rika. âDo you know whatâs going on? Who is it?â
          Rika drew her hand down her face. âItâsâ¦..

*notes.
Amani is Arabic for wishes
Basimon, basim is Arabic for smiling, ergo, smiling monster
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Reddmon chooses.

choices: They arrive at the meeting point, late.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âKazu and Kenta, some school friends of Takatoâs. They've been taking a holiday here with their digimon. Sigh, I was really hoping weâd avoid them.â
          âWhyâs that?â Asked Reddmon taking a step closer to the intersection, he wanted to get a look at these tamers. Since they were here already they might as well be helpful. Reddmon stopped in his tracks as there was a blossom of light followed by a blast of sound that rattled the pots in a nearby store.
          âBecause theyâre even more noisy than Guilmon hunting for the peanut better jar.â Mumbled Renamon. âCâmon we probably should get them out of trouble. It certainly won't be the first or the last time we'll have to.â
          This time Renamon took a step forward but was stopped by Rika putting a hand on her shoulder. âNo way, the last time we were stuck with those two I nearly went insane. Letâs just hide back here till everything dies down, they have Guardromon and MarineAngemon with them. Theyâll be fine.â There was another series of explosions then more yells and they all looked down the road to see two kids, probably Kenta and Kazu, running around the corner, shortly followed by a small pink digimon that floated off the ground and a Guardromon bringing up the rear. The brown haired one, wearing desert gear waved to them.
          âHey! Rika, Renamon, help.â He yelled as a large mob of angry looking digimon came into view behind them.
          âI see your point, but no helping it now. Alright, lets see.â Reddmon glanced around them, no easy doorways or any large objects to hid in, only two empty roads behind them. One of which, the one theyâd just come from, was a dead end. âGot it, Renamon, get Rika on top of that building and hide with this. Be ready for us, we'll need to do this fast and smoothâ He said, materializing a large folded square of tarp like material and passing it to her then pointing to a building a bit down the road leading back to Basimonâs place.
          They nodded then Renamon scooped her partner up and disappeared. His part was somewhat harder, he made a show of seeing them and pretended to run down the other path, discreetly dropping a few smoke grenades with timers he hoped heâd set right. Once out of sight he immediately pressed his back to the wall, waiting.
          âWhereâd they go?â Said a young boys voice, different from the firstâs
          âNo clue, but who was that red dude they were with?â Panted the other.
          âPsst. Quick over here.â Whispered Reddmon as they came into view. Not stupid enough to ignore help in their current situation they wheeled into his alley without a moments hesitation.
          âWho are you and where are the ladies?â Asked the Guardromon immediately. Admirable set of priorities. Noted Reddmon, holding up a finger for a moment. The smokes heâd set burst into a screen of fine grey mist that would give them plenty of cover for what he was planning.
          âFollow me.â He said, dropping another smoke grenade and running down the road he sent the girls. The kids exchanged a look between them then followed. As he entered the intersection again, a third of which was obscured, he dropped not only a few more smoke grenades for good measure but also what were known as flash-bangs. When they went off they produced a blinding white light and a deafening crack, useful for disorienting enemies without killing them.
          He quickly made it to the building Renamon and Rika were on. âReady, here they come.â He whispered, hoping Renamon would react quickly enough. Because as soon as the first of their new friends caught up, the boy who had black hair and wore glasses, he made a shushing gesture then grabbed him by the lapels of his jacket and tossed him upwards towards the roof of the building. Too surprised to make a noise the kid was snatched from mid air as he came level with Renamon, and hopefully hidden under the blanket heâd given them, which was specially designed to hide all traces of a digimon's presence.
          âHey where did Kenta ge...â Reddmon clamped his paw around the now identified Kazuâs mouth as he emerged from the spreading cloud then tossed him up as well. Luckily the Guardromon seemed to catch on quick because he nodded then crouched down, jumping an impressive height and managing to hoist himself up onto the roof. Lastly the MarineAngemon appeared, but because he could fly all Reddmon had to do was point upwards and jump onto the roof as well.
          When he got ontop he was greated by an odd sight, the stealth blanket (He hated that name but couldn't think of anything better) was easily large enough to hide even a large ultimate class digimon with little trouble but it still looked rather lumpen with them all under it, and by the looks of things there was a bit of a struggle going on underneath. He lifted one corner and ducked in, holding it up a second longer to let the MarineAngemon in as well.
          âMmpff!â Reddmon pivoted on his haunches to see that it was the brown headed kid, Kazu, making all the fuss. He was thrashing about with both the girls holding him down, hands and paws held firmly over his mouth.
          âQuite kid, we have to hide for a few minutes, if you need to ask questions whisper, alright?â Said Reddmon under his breath, gently easing the girls muzzle from his mouth.
          âWho are you?â He whispered, pulling a small water flask from his robes and taking a swig.
          âMy name's Reddmon and Iâm a friend of a friend.â Reddmon whispered back. The one who was probably Kenta gave Rika and Renamon a questioning look and they nodded, confirming his creds.
          âHey, why are you all here anyway?â Asked Kenta
          âTo sort out his past, now shush.â Admonished Renamon as part of the pursuing mob stopped in front of the building. Chattering about their sudden disappearance. After several tense minutes of waiting everything died down and eventually all the digimon left, probably to clean up whatever mess they'd made.
          Reddmon threw off the concealing blanket and began folding it up into a square. âSo what did you guys do anyway?â He dropped it behind his back and let it disappear, getting odd glances from the newcomers.
          The Guardromon was the first to answer. âMy partner Kazu had an altercation about the cost of our lunch. Regrettably we didnât have enough to pay and I was forced to defend us from the rather aggravated storeman.â
          âLook, we have an appointment to keep, do you have somewhere to go?â Asked Rika, seemingly wanting to get rid of them, which was fair considering they seemed to be trouble magnets.
          âWell, no, we kind of forgot how to get home, weâre already late.â Said Ketna, hanging his head.
          âCongratulations, this is your lucky day. We just happen to have a one of a kind digi-modify card that'll get you right home.â Reddmon put on his best salesmen voice, pulling out the warriors path card that Orionmon had given them.
          With a flourish he gave it to Kazu and motioned for him to scan it. âWhatâs it do?â He asked, flipping it over and looking at the official logo most of the digi-modify cards had.
          âIt opens a portal to the real world. We donât know the exact target location but probably some place in Shinjinku.â Explained Renamon as Kazu gingerly ran the card through his digivice. Crying out in surprise as one of Orionmonâs characteristic black holes silently appeared.
          âYou actually expect us to get in that thing?â Asked Kenta disbelievingly.
          âDonât worry weâve travelled through these loads of time while you where gone, there probably safer than travelling by plane.â Rika said, sounding remarkably like Reddmon talking about the data streams earlier.
          âLets go for the blunt approach shall we?â Suggested Reddmon moving forward and plucking his card form Kazu then grabbing the chest of his shawl and tossing him into the portal. Snatching Kentaâs arm and throwing him bodily through it as well.
          âMy word, what are you doing?â Blustered Guardromon as he backed away from Reddmon, probably thinking him to be insane.
          âGetting you home.â He said, plucking MarineAngimon from above his head and pushing him into the metal digimonâs hands, then grabbing him by the round handle that adorned his front and swinging them through the portal, not a moment before it closed in on itself.
          âWell that handles that then, eh.â He said, proudly slapping his paws together and turning to the girls to see Rika struggling to keep herself from laughing as Renamon shook her head with a paw over her eyes.
          âYou donât think you could have handled that with a bit more finesse?â She asked when she noticed his confused look.
          âWhat, they barley made a sound let alone reacted.â He replied with a shrug.
          âThatâs not what I meant.â She sighed as Rika actually burst out laughing, a rare occurrence.
          âCome on you two, weâve still go to meet that guide.â Renamon said, throwing a paw up in exasperation and hopping down off the building. Reddmon exchanged a grin with Rika then picked her up and jumped off the house after Renamon.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: The comic relief has arrived.

choices: Nah, we should wait until he gets here.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âUmm does any one remember where Basimon said to meet his contact?â Asked Rika as she looked around the crowded food court like area. It wasnât really a set section there was just more food stalls here than in other places.
âHe said by a curry store, so maybe we could just follow any scents of spicy food.â Suggested Reddmon, trying to sift through the tangy air for anything that smelt hot. But that was easier said than done, the air was just way too rich here, even a Renamon or Garurumon wouldnât be able to pick one out.
          âCouldnât it have occurred to Basimon to give us even a vauge discription of the guy.â Groaned Rika doing a final sweep then giving up.
          âYouâre the oneâs Iâm meant to meet then?â They all span to see a stooped digimon looking up at them with a pair of pale brown eyes that had pinpoints of white that seemed to serve as his pupils. His rather morose eyes the only part of his face that was visible under the large grey cloak that covered his head and indeed his whole body except for his clawed hands and a worn pair of leather boots.
          âWhere did you come from?â Asked Reddmon. In response the digimon jerked a thumb at a store that sold, wouldnât you know it, curry. They had been looking in the wrong direction the whole time.
          âMy names Sairamon, Iâve been watching you the whole time. Waiting for you to mention our, mutual friend before approaching.â He walked back to the curry store and picked up a huge collection of odds and ends strapped and banded together, swinging it over his shoulder with little trouble. Reddmon could spot things like rolls of fabric, several sheathed swords, and he could of sworn he caught a glimpse of a tap poking out from the side. The whole bundle was easily bigger than any of them, and substantially larger than Sairamon himself, probably heavier than him as well.
          "Shall we head off then?â He asked, adjusting the thick straps crossing his chest. Reddmon was still amazed he could even lift something that big. He was probably strong in as an ox in a fight, he felt like a champion at least.
          âDo you mind if we get something to eat first?â Asked Renamon, pointing toward the store they were standing next to, Basimon nodded and made a suggestion about going for the mild, a piece of advice they all took.

          As they walked out of the city they finished the last of their lunch, or possibly dinner, Reddmon had lost track of time a while ago. Sairamon wasn't saying anything just leading the way through the maze of stalls and buildings, shrugging off all questions they asked.
          Finally they made it out, yet their guide still remained silent, motioning for them to be patient. It was only when they had walked over several sand dunes and were completely out of sight of Amani did Sairamon explain where they were going.
          âI apologize for the sustained silence but you never know who might be listening. Our goal is the current whereabouts of the mercenary-king known as Reapermon, correct?â
          âYes, so you know where we can find him?â Asked Renamon as they began climbing up the next dune.
          âOf course. A while ago by happen stance I noticed a convey that bore his mark crossing the desert, curious I followed and saw them entering a large structure. A month later I was in the area, again by chance and saw the exact same convey enter the building. I went back two more times to confirm then told Basimon, who paid me handsomely.â Reddmon couldn't see his face but he could practically hear the smile in his voice.
          âAnd how long till he arrives next?â Panted Rika, the heat apparently getting to her. Geez like she could complain, she wasnât even covered in fur. Never the less Reddmon sighed and pulled out a coolie hat and her water bottle from his other space, passing it to her.
          âThanks, but why do you have this anyway?â She asked, slipping the strap of the water bottle around her shoulder then looking the coolie hat over before putting it on.
          Reddmon shrugged. âNot quite sure, Iâve got some weird stuff in there though.â
          âTonight to answer your earlier question. And by the way, weâve arrived.â Said Sairamon, having stopped and waited for them to finish. He pointed to the top of the dune they where currently scaling.
          Reddmon dropped to his stomach and crawled to the top, peaking over the peak, Renamon and Rika coming up next to him. Beyond the sand dune they were on was a vast sprawling complex that that was surrounded by a tall barbed wire fence with several tall towers at the corners, which probably had sentries scanning the no mans land that separated the dunes from the base.
          The base itself was made of thirty or so utilitarian military buildings painted to blend in with the desert each short squat and designed to have a small silhouette.
          âNice place, I wonder who does the decorating? So should we go in before or after Reapermon arrives? i say before an be ready for him when he arrives.â Proposed Renamon and Rika nodded her agreement.
Sairamon {saira = traveller )
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: A heavily laden guide.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
âHeâs probably going to come with a lot of extra security so letâs get inside now, take out anyone who sees us then hide until he arrives, everyone good with that?â Asked Reddmon, receiving nods from both Renamon and Rika.
          âAlright then, thanks for your help Basimon.â
          âYouâre most welcome sir, it is a pleasure.â With that he turned and began trekking off down the dune, not giving them a second glance.
          âGive me a second to plan this out and weâll go for it.â Reddmon looked around the perfectly flat and featureless ring surrounding the complex, that was going to be tricky to pass, it was two far to teleport in one go, with or without Rika. So that was problem one.
          Once they got inside they needed something to give them a few minutes to find a place to conceal themselves while being able to watch the main entrance, a large gate that had another pair of lookout towers attached to it. As he looked around the enclosure he saw a large group of digimon march out into a open courtyard, taking up rigid formations then changing said formations at a gesture from a Strikedramon who appeared to be their sergeant. The twenty or so digimon moving around in perfect sinyc were all a species known as Jundmon, steel armour , jagged blades, vicious tempers and little else. Another reason to keep everyone occupied while they slipped in. so that was two problems, solving them with a single solution would be optimal.
          âThis seem as good a time as any to use some toys.â Thought Reddmon as he flipped through the list of weapons heâd âacquiredâ through various means.
          âEureka.â Said Reddmon suddenly, giving Rika and Renamon a start as they scrutinised the walls for possible weak points. âIâll be back in a moment.â
          Reddmon began making short teleports around the enclosure making sure to stay hidden behind the dunes till he was about a third of the way round. With a smile he waved a paw and a large gun metal box appeared, and after pulling at a few handles and twisting a couple of parts the correct way one of his favourite pieces of hardware was ready.
          It was in essence a high tech multiple missile launcher, with several racks of explosive projectiles, a short antenna and four sturdy legs digging deep into the sand. He slid a pair of blocky binocâs from a recess and crawled up the slope.
          He pressed a few buttons on the top of the binoculars and brought them up, looking at several of the towers in turn for a second each, âpaintingâ them with an infer red marker, which would mark the impact point of one of the bundles of fun. After targeting all the towers Reddmon still had four left so he just aimed them at random points throughout the complex then set the timer for a minute, pressing the confirm button and tossing it back near the launcher.
          âThis should be a good lightshow.â Chuckled Reddmon, quickly making his way back to the others, landing silently next to them. âAlright, once the place is softened up we move. Renamon you take Rika, follow me and Iâll cover you.â
          âSoftened up? What do you mean by thaâ¦.â Renamon didnât finish as a sharp whistling broke the comparative silence of the desert, they all turned to see a finger of smoke tipped by a black cylinder shoot up from behind the dune he went to, followed by another, then another, they just kept coming until the first stopped rising and began curving downward until it was pointing dead on at one of the towers. There was a cry of alarm and a shrill keening of a klaxon began but that was drowned out as the first missile hit its mark, damn near blowing the building in half in a brilliant fireball and a visible wall of concussive force. Then another one hit destroying more watchtowers, followed by even more, the whole place quickly reduced from a figure of military perfection to a smoking war zone.
          âTime to go.â Reddmon said, leaping to his feet and snatching out a grenade launcher he kept for special occasions, the missiles had taken out all the towers but several where still in flight, Rika glanced at them worriedly and was probably about to question the sanity of moving now but Renamon pulled her onto her back and jumped up with him.
          âYou are crazy, you know that right?â She said as she tensed to follow him.
         âI wouldnât be nearly as much fun if I weren't, would I?â He said, teleporting half the distance in one go. He smiled as she followed him, he couldnât count the times heâd done this kind of thing with Orionmon, and he didnât have the heart to tell them he was being cautious for their sake he was pretty sure that would earn him a friendly clip round the ears and nothing else.
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Nothing beats missile barrages.

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Nasirmon glanced at the others tapping away at their control stations, the sooner this forsaken command centre got to home base the sooner he could clock off and head to Amani for a few weeks leave. He took another surreptitious glance at the raised seat behind them, the large mega level digimon with a skull motif they knew only as boss sat glaring around the room, one metallic claw digging deep gouges into the solid steel armrest, the other arm, a large scythe like blade just tapped and tapped and tapped. If it was anyone else he might have asked them to stop. But Nasirmon were gangly, with a thin body covered by loose fitting sun-bleached robes, not made or know for fighting. That was probably why they gravitated to secretarial jobs.
          âSir we have an attack on home base.â Declared a younger Nasirmon several stations down. Nasirmon sighed mentally as the boss turned his metallic, horned skull towards the unfortunate digimon, despite having nothing but darkness within the steel face Nasirmon could sense the malice, and the displeasure.
          âAnd?â His voice had a terrifying authority, cracked, discordant and laced with heavy static, like it had been spat from a broken recorder used by a madman.
          âErm, we should prepare for a rough entry?â The digimon and his station disappeared and a blur of movement and a spray of fragmented data as a chained claw suddenly whipped forward, retracting with a painful screech as it pulled free of the ruined electronics.
          âWould anyone else like to attempt to pick up his failure?â He half rasped, half crackled as his hand drew three large gouges in the steel plate floor all the way back to his arm.
          Nasirmon had been around long enough to know that if no one acted heâd kill them all without a moments hesitation. He turned back to his station and let his nimble fingers fly across the keys sending and receiving messages in rapid succession.
          âSir, you personal guard has been sent forward ahead off us to assist the base troops, additionally two platoons on patrol have began returning immediately. Reports imply that there have been several explosions onsite and all the gun towers are our of commission. I think it might be a small operation trying to use diversions. The facility is now in total lock down and only your personal code can allow anyone in, or out. It should be resolved before we arrive.â
          The fact that he was still talking implied heâd probably be getting a raise rather than being, "reconfigured".

(sorry I missed last chapterâs glossary)
Jundmon (jund = Arabic for soilders/army)
Nasirmon (nasir = Arabic for helper)
1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.title: Report!

1111111112221112112121111121111111112111.content:
Reddmon launched another pair of grenades on a high trajectory, easily clearing the buildings and hopefully landing far enough away to keep the scrambling guards looking in the wrong direction. So far heâd achieved both objectives of enforcing chaos and keeping everyoneâs attention away from them. He smirked as he heard the twin explosions followed by the desperate bellowing of those trying to maintain order then ducked back into the alcove Renamon and Rika where sheltering in.
          âYouâre having way too much fun, put that blasted thing away for a moment and help us with this door.â Renamon urged, jerking a thumb at a semi-concealed door that blended in with the wall pretty much perfectly, anyone walking by would probably overlook it unless they knew it was there. Luckily Renamon had noticed it as they were running by.
          âWhy havenât you just teleported inside?â He asked dematerialising the grenade launcher, he was out of ammunition anyway. Still, a purchase well made.
          âBecause, for some reason I canât,â She bristled, âand I certainly canât knock it down, that would defeat the purpose of sneaking inside altogether.â She made room for him as Reddmon moved forward and materialized a set of lock picks. Heâd learnt how to use them ages ago and but never actually had to, never thought he would really. Taking out a pick and a lever he began feeling around inside the tumbler and was surprised to find only three pins that needed lifting, a military place like this usually had better locks, but hey this only made things easier.
          He slipped the tools away then nudged the door open, looking both ways down a deserted and stark hallway then motioned for Renamon, then Rika to follow him. He eased the door shut then whispered, âRenamon, you go take the front and Iâll keep a watch behind us, just follow any signs that peek you interest.â Renamon nodded then proceeded quickly to the first intersection, finding a stupidly convenient sign showing what was down each path.
          âDo you think the henchmen here get lost often?â Asked Rika as they turned left. Reddmon glanced at the sign as he backed past it, seemed like Renamon had chosen the control room, or the barracks. He assumed, well, hoped for the former.
          âProbably, Iâve heard this guy tends to hire the brutish types a lot, he finds it easier to stay in charge that way.â Noted Reddmon, recalling the profile heâd read on Reapermon.
          âShhh, someoneâs coming.â Said Renamon, stopping mid stride. Reddmon turned from his rear guard position and strained his ears, picking out a pair of steel shod footsteps, he sensed a pair of champions nearby so it was probably small Jundmon patrol. Renamon made a small movement with her paw and they both dashed down the hallway. Her on the left him the right.
          Just as he expected two of the soldier digimon marched into the intersection and noticed them immediately, guarding for their charge, twin swords up and crossed, legs spread to take the force but loose enough to adjust if needed. Renamon must have seen this too because when they were two metres away he noticed a small twitch in her leg and arm muscles. âClever, that should work.â Reddmon came almost level with her then pulled an arm back as if preparing to strike, Renamon did similar.
          Both the Jundmon changed their stances minutely to take them on but just before impact was made Reddmon leapt over Renamon as she swept under him, crossing over each other and hitting their surprised targets around there guard and with lethal force.
          The Jundmon burst into blue clouds of data and as Reddmon yanked his arm from a small hole heâd made in the wall he turned to Renamon and smiled, noticing the big blocky digimon beyond her a Husamon, the ultimate form of Jundmon. Keeping the steel armour and visored helm but exchanging the twin swords for a large shield wielded like a buckler and a long scimitar, which made his stomach turn as he saw it soaring through the air towards Renamonâs back.
          Reddmon Grabbed Renamon by the shoulders and swung her to the side, she cried out in protest but cut herself off as the flying blade slide through his shoulder and clattered to the ground past them.
          Reddmon barely had time to straighten himself to the Husamon as he came thundering forward, slamming the shield into him and crushing him into the wall. He jerked his head aside as a pile driver of a fist crashed into the reinforced concrete wall, leaving a hole twice as big as the one heâd made. With a thick chuckle he easily yanked his fist out, a tangle of rebar clenched in his hand. He dropped it and curled his fist again, he wasnât going to miss again.
